Reviews.Title: “Forgetable”
Reviews.Author: Marycantanato
Reviews.Content: Slightly churlish reception staff, all about taking your money here, showers are so badly designed I can't believe it. Once you have worked out the temperature then you can turn on and not soak the floor as the shower aims straight at the door and mine came out cold I had to run out but couldn't get back in without soaking everything. Breakfast good. bar friendly. Next to a good shopping mall but too far out of the gothic centre for me but close to beach! The receptionists put me in a bad mood!!

Reviews.Title: “safe hotel choice - all you need to know!!”
Reviews.Author: indiecritic
Reviews.Content: Forgive the long narrative but i'll be honest......before i start the other recent reviews are accurate and are a fair reflection of this hotel... my partner and i stopped 11th floor, sea view side, so wasn't blessed with the city view but i'm more than sure the view would be breath taking, we did have the sun rise to enjoy. The room was a standard size for a city centre hotel room. the room is more than adequate for a short stay and the toiletries included toobrush and paste, shoe shine, razor and cream, soap (hand), shower gel and shampoo. (Read recent reviews for the mini bar), hairdryer ok, slippers, bathroom, safe, okay, a quick word regarding the shower/toilet....it is a glass wall into the 'bathroom' area, the shower and toilet are seperate cubicles and have smoked glass. ***my partner and i have been together for a long time and therefore the lack of privacy whilst using the bathroom/toilet wasn't an issue but i wouldn't recomend this hotel if it was your first romantic weekend away together. There is a mechanical blind for the glass wall to offer some privacy! Breakfast was varied and plentyfull, it would have been nice for the coffee dispensing machine to have distributed coffee when i pressed the coffee button but the hot chocolate was reasonably tasty alternative and after 2nd day i gave up and pressed the espresso once and topped up with milk button, personally i would have liked an option to have an english breakfast but we were in spain and if i wanted english breakfast that much i could have gone to London!!!! The convention centre was next door and saturday night had a music gig on so was a bit loud until early hours of the morning but it didn't spoil the stay As with previous posts don't bother with a taxi public transport very good, if you arrive at barcelona (el prat) walk to the train station where you will find ticket machines, buy a T10 card (9.50 euro's) this gives you 10 journeys, catch the train into Passeig de Gracia train station (only 1 train you can catch they run every half and hour or so and can be busy walk to the far end of the platform) get off at Gracia and find metro (red diamond with M) and your looking for L4 (yellow line) take the line to LA PAU get off at El Maresme-Forum and the hotel is out of the station turn right and its about 250 yards. Gothic centre, olympic port/ marina all on L4 line. Once you've entered the metro you can travel anywhere on the tube for no extra cost in zone 1 even if you change lines. We travelled on the tube at 10.30pm from baceloneta and felt safe travelling on the tube that late. Same advice as ever in a city centre keep your wits about you and you'll be fine. There is the shopping centre next door to the hotel and it has all the usual international eateries (mcdonalds, burger king etc on the 3rd floor) and supermarkets and shops on the lower floors, there are restaurants out the back of the centre on the hilton hotel side. Barcelona has a lovely beach with deep golden sand its worth a visit, and is reasonably close to the hotel. I would agree with the other reviews regarding service but i like being left alone and not fussed when i'm away. All in all hotel is good and apart from the usual mini/minor gripes i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicola C
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. New and modern. Clean. Helpful staff. A bit out of town but worth travelling back to every evening.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: kerrydolls
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with wonderful service and staff! Lovely rooms and en-suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. A jewel in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice modern comfortable hotel where attentive staff cannot do enough for you. Bedrooms well equipped with a large comfortable bed. Enjoyed a massage whilst staying at the hotel too. Ok, hotel located outside the centre, no problem as the excellent metro was 2 mins walk away.Will definately go back again and recommend to my friends and coleages too.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful central clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: moregan
Reviews.Content: really close to a metro stop for easy access to the centre of barcelona. 15mins on the metro to the centre. exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. very modern clean hotel. free mini bar which was great. free bathrobes and slippers which was lovely. great powerful shower. big lovely towels. pools were very very small unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Crackin' Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Iain H
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and modern and staff could not have been more helpful. Only downside was the wait on the lifts sometimes, ended up taking the stairs a few times but luckily we were only on the 5th floor. Very close to two shopping centres and a few restaurants. Quite far away from main tourist area and La Rambla (2 hour walk, we found out the hard way!) but there's a good tram/metro service which takes you to all the main tourist attractions within minutes. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn M
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic trip to Barcelona, we stayed at this hotel and i have to say we had no complaints at all. Our room was amazing and the views we had were amazing, the free mini bar is a bonus too. I would suggest getting the train and metro from the airport to the hotel as we paid €40 for a taxi and on our retrun we used the train and metro and it was so easy to use and only cost about €10 each, much better value. Also the hotel is away from the main touristy areas but we saw this as a good thing, being away from the hustle and bustle and so close to the beaches that are lovely and good long stroll to Port Olympic was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Barcelona! I can really recommend this place if you are staying in Barcelona with a group. The service is excellent and I can also recommend the menu of the day with high quality food at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: Vidocq_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the business area of the city but just by the beach. It is surrounded by Barcelona’s skyscrapers, the natural museum (£7/person including botanical garden – in my view not quite worth it but it could be good fun for children) and Barcelona’s beaches. Positives The hotel has 26 floors. We asked when booking for a high floor not quite knowing how high the hotel was. We had a 20th floor room with stunning views of the city. Especially at night it was simply beautiful. The rooms are 5 star rating with everything you would need (except bathtub – compensated by an excellent shower). The rooms were clean and well equipped. The mini-bar (1 beer, 1 coca cola, 2 bottle of water and a soft drink) was free. Bathrobes and sleepers included. In the price of the room we had 50 minutes free massage at the hotel’s spa. The hotel has 2 pools, one of them at floor 23 with stunning views of the Mediterranean Plenty of choice at breakfast including fresh fruit and vegetables Good location near the metro, buss to city centre and taxi station. It is also great location for running or walking along the beach. The beaches are in walking distance. The taxi (station across the road) to the airport takes about 20-30 minutes depending on the traffic and it costs around 25-35 euros. It is worth it as there is no direct link for the airport via public transport. Negatives What was missing from the room: wireless internet (you needed cable to connect – not sure if chargeable) and team-making facilities. The pools (level 3 and level 23) are small but this was compensated by the views. No wireless access in the hotel (apart from reception) Staff was probably the main complaint. In short I did not feel welcomed and I found the staff attitude to be cold and not very helpful. At breakfast the story was the same, the only interaction with the staff was just to be asked the room number. After that we were left to our own devices in a very big and crowded restaurant. The breakfast staff laughing, whistling and humming around the tables was also not great either. At the restaurant at dinner, the food was superb but pricey (expect to pay 60-70 euro for two with drinks and a desert). Our bill was mistaken and we were overcharged 25 euros. Fortunately we saw the mistake in time and the mistake was rectified. The massage was good but the phonic insulation of the two massage rooms was inexistent and it was a bit difficult to relax during the massage. On the day we left out flight was at 5PM. The checkout was at 12. We asked the hotel for a late check-out (2 hours). We were told that was not possible as the hotel was full the next day. However, if we choose to pay half a day accommodation we could stay in the room until 7PM. We explained we only needed 2 hours but we were told that unless we pay 85 euros we cannot have the room as the hotel was full. Do I need to say more? Overall, the hotel is great, comfortable and in a good location. The staff was not great and they were not very keen to help. Would I recommend it? Yes, for the views and location not for a great overall experience. Would I go again? No, I wouldn’t.

Reviews.Title: “Barca getaway”
Reviews.Author: loughton09 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days. Ideally located for metro and tram. Huge choice at breakfast. Free wifi and also a bank of computers and printers available, free too. Very close to restaurants and a shopping centre. Only slight gripe was length of time waiting for lifts - need to use them as there are 23 storeys - and the pillows were very hard indeed. Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends who didn't want to be right in the middle of town. Peaceful location with easy access to the heart of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a distance might be a problem for some”
Reviews.Author: Mackean
Reviews.Content: Was staying in Barcelona Princess during the mobile world congress 2012. I love this hotel as it has 1) nice room 2) next to a shopping mail which able to get various type of food and daily needs 3) One of the nicest breakfast buffet I have 4) There is a metro station nearby the hotel However, I find that the hotel is far from centre and also Fira .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: CF2_12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is bit far from the center / las ramblas, however it´s very near to a Metro station, and takes about 15 to 20 minutes to the center. There is a shopping center right next door, and there are a lot of restaurants for lunch and dinner. The staff in the reception are all very friendly and the room is really confortable, with a huge bed. Frigobar and wired network available for free.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Favorite”
Reviews.Author: robinbayvillage
Reviews.Content: After three trips to Barcelona, I found this jewel. Superb breakfast choices of highest quality items. Very comfortable room and mattresses. I swim for cardio and their pool is ideal. Concierge directed us to wonderful places (food, entertainment, less expensive travel alternatives). Amazing floral displays in the lobby. Out door beer garden ideal for relaxing and light snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ana C
Reviews.Content: I was very happy to stay in the Princess. The staff were lovely. David for the corner Bar is fantastic . Great smile. The rooms are spot on. Very close to the Centre 15min. Lovely shower lovely room lovely people. Good price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not superior to 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Stephen J
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in March mainly because the price was much more affordable than others in Barcelona. The location didn't bother us, yes it does take about 20 minutes to get into the center but the sites/museums etc in Barcelona are so spread out that no matter where you stay you will have to travel around. Wear sensible and comfy shoes. The tram stop is closer than the metro station but runs every 8-12 minutes during the day so you may have to wait a while. Luckily the number 7 bus also goes down Av Diagonal towards the metro and the bus stop is right next to the tram. I' recommend figuring out where you want to go and then timing with the different transport options - or throw money at the problem and take a taxi. The hotel is definitely not 4 star (sup) which I'm assuming stands for superior. There are some nice touches such as robes and slippers in the room, free minibar and (wired) internet in the room. Breakfast was nice lots of choice but some of the fruit looked sad and the quality was just slightly below par. If a hotel claims to be superior to 4 stars then I arrive with certain expectations. There was a leak from the bathroom above and we asked to be moved to another room. Their preference was to call maintenance before we move but we insisted - there was a stream of water dripping from the ceiling! The room we moved to didn't have a shower curtain or screen. As we were only staying one more night we didn't mention it to the front desk - we decided it was better to put up with that than cart our bags to another room. The pool on 23rd floor was nice, heated and more so than the smaller pool on the 3rd floor. we were the only people there but I can imagine that it would not be as enjoyable with more people there. The hotel has over 300 rooms and pools, gym and saunas really aren't big enough to accommodate that amount of guests. The jacuzzi was cheap, not hot enough and looked like it was bought for someone's back garden. One of the lifts broke and wasn't fixed over the weekend - when the hotel was at it's busiest. Overall, the Barcelona Princess was good value for money as long as you don't expect quality or service above a standard 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Muriel D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A work a fantasy for the architect but in reality nothing much than a 3stars hotel of this category. In some rooms the blinds do NOT block the city lights so don't expect to sleep in a dark room. If anyone suffers from vertigo this is NOT the place for you, glass elevators and glass bridges to cross between corridors Other than that, breakfast is within the range of quality standards before mass produce and genetically modified invaded the food market

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Break”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Y
Reviews.Content: We are Just back after staying here for the weekend we had a fantastic time the hotel is beautiful and the staff are really friendly and helpful, We stayed in room 1907 in the Junior suite which had exceptional views of the city even from the bathroom and a balcony which had sea views, The champagne and truffles in our room on arrival where a fantastic touch and made us feel really special, The breakfast was fantastic cooked foods, fresh fruit, cereals and loads more, There is a taxi rank and a metro station just around the corner, Also there is the Diagonal Mar shopping centre and food court which is right beside the hotel and its absolutely massive, It even had a Primark :), I would highly recommend this hotel its fantastic we will definitely be back,

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and luxury”
Reviews.Author: DelUk
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location if you are attending conference centre, easy distance to splendid public transport system. Not so close to main tourist sites, but easy to get there on public transport. Rooms very good and modern, lots of extras. Possible to get good room rate if you search around. Safe area.

Reviews.Title: “The highlight of my trip”
Reviews.Author: Justin m
Reviews.Content: Had a junior suite on the 22 nd floor. The extra space is important and the sitting room, in addition to a small balcony made a huge difference. The location is right on the sea and the views of the ocean from the room were fantastic. Although not central it is very close to the attractions and there is a shopping Mall right next door. The breakfast is excellent and as good as any five star hotel- choice goes on for ever! Very friendly staff and the overall experience was excellent. Would not hesitate to recommend or stay st this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great views, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: KontikiLondoner
Reviews.Content: A return visit to the Princess. Managed to get the same room on the 24th floor.. which gives a panorama view of the city.. all the way from Montjuich to The Foster TV tower: wonderful at night. Sagrada Familia is central to the view as well as the Barcelona copy of London's Gherkin tower block. Room is large, one wall is full glass giving the great views. Large and comfortable bed.. possibly largest we've been in. Slippers and robe. Blinds block off the bathroom area. Good range of extras. Toilet flush broke but fixed very quickly. Check in staff.. and indeed all staff.. were friendly and helpful as well as multi-lingual. Breakfast is very good.. very wide range and choice of both hot and cold food. (perhaps they could add low fat yoghurt). Didn't use the restaurant this visit but very good on the previous visit 2 years ago. Room service meals were straightforward, good quantity! Had the "pamper" package with a daily massage. The massage bed can be improved: it is a flat bed with no headrest. Quality of massuers varied. Sauna was good.. no longer possible to add water for steam but the men's sauna was out of action for two days. It was wonderful to swim in the outdoor pool on the 3rd floor on a cold January evening. Very warm water! The smaller pool on the 23rd floor was also being used. One complaint: only wired internet in the rooms. Free. But really need wi-fi in this quality of hotel. I heard wi-fi may be installed later this year. Location is great for the conference centre. Three minutes walk from metro which gives quick journey to the Barrio Gotico and centre. Note the station is not on all the older metro maps. Tram is also a few minutes away. Shopping mall next door.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: noogs1
Reviews.Content: Just a very nice experience here. The staff was definitely 5 stars. The room was beautiful. We were on the 20th and had a views of the city. Beautiful. One whole wall was a window. The interior design was lovely. The shower did leak. But, i did not have to clean it up. ;) The comfort of shaving was discarded for the design of the bathroom. Getting a clean shave while looking in a mirror on the side wall was difficult. The commode was not extremely comfortable also having been neglected for the purety of design. Those were minor but they did serve to keep me from 5 stars. It is a little far out. But, honestly, that is a quibble given the ease and convenience of the Barcelona public transport system.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING !!!”
Reviews.Author: iwonaj1188
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in Barcelona Princess. Highly recommended place to go and stay! Excellent service, beautiful room, amazing city view!!! Will definitely go back there! ASAP!!!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: 187849Gsquare
Reviews.Content: We spent a romantic weekend, 26th floor and sea view. The hotel is well served by metro and tramway. You could like it or not: the bathroom is not really independent from the room: a glass wall is between them. But you can hide it more with a black curtain. The overall value is good. service is efficient, the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel new deco close to beach close to metro.... Just far off the city center”
Reviews.Author: Mpindradat
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to the beach and train station;however I still think its far from the city center since we have to take 7-8 stops everyday. We end up eating at the mall next to the hotel everyday coz there are no other place to go around. Would recommend for cleanliness and deco but not location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dogcop
Reviews.Content: just returned from 2 nights at this hotel. Stayed here 6 years ago and standards are still as good. Arrived 3 hours early for check and planned on leaving bags and returning later. Pleasant reception staff informed us the room was ready and we could check in there and then. Both girls very cheerful and smiling with good English. Explained all to us about the room and facilities. We were on the 14th floor with fantastic view over the city. Room was as comfortable as we remembered it. Smart decor, very chic shower and bathroom facilities. Bathrobes, slippers and toiletries. Free minibar, but only 1 beer, 1 coke, 1 lemon, 1 fizzy water and 1 still water, but gratefully recieved. TV only had 2 British channels BBC1 and channel 4, but didnt bother us. We dined out in the evening at the Mall next door. Varied choice of eateries and OK for us. Had breakfast included in our deal and what a good decision. Fantastic choice to set you up for the day. Dont expect the "Full English", but a varied choice by any standards. Pleasant dining area and exceptional staff who again, welcomed us and wished us a great day in Barcelona. Even the cleaning staff smiled and welcomed us. fantastic staff all round. My tips are, buy a 10 trip ticket from any of the ticket machines for about 10E. can use then on tram, metro or bus. Catch the tram to "Glories" and catch the metro red line to Catalunya square and begin your sight seeing. Or you can get the yellow line from "Forum" close to the hotel, but a bit of a long round about trip to get to the square. Anyway, would recommend this hotel for sightseeing or business. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for convention centre but a 20 minute metro ride to the city centre”
Reviews.Author: AndyShihtzu
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room with free minibar and tv with lots of channels.

Reviews.Title: “what more could you want”
Reviews.Author: Iwan89
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at the roundabout on the important street of Barcelona, Diagonal. This is one of the most recognizable hotels in Barcelona, due to its size. Because the hotel is high, I chose the room almost at the top, so had great views. The Internet is for free, clean, cozy, friendly service and a swimming pool, what more could you want.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - far out the way for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Jennavm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and the hotel was immaculate and well worth staying in. We loved it. The only issue is that it is quite a distance past the city from the airport and the transport is a bit of a mission (worth a taxi drive).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern hotel with fantastic views of the city”
Reviews.Author: Eileenmcl
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel!! We stayed on the top floor the views are amazing the glass lift was an added bonus to look over the city! The swimming pool on the 23rd floor (outside) was lovely and warm even though it was freezing to get in and out if lol!!! The staff could not have been friendlier. We will certainly be coming back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “no character, buisness only and faar”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: Faar from center, only buisness ppl attending conference center next to it. No bar or restaurant around for a late snack, way to faar from center...

Reviews.Title: “A Gem, not cheap but a lotta luxury”
Reviews.Author: bigmacAntrim
Reviews.Content: Barca is an easy city to get about even if you do get on a tube goin the wrong way its easily rectified LOL. Subway station is near the hotel, just turn right and straight ahead. Looks a little urban from the outside but hey its a city. This hotel has the advantage of being close to the sea and the boardwalk. Alternatively you can get the tram or metro into the city. The Rooms are class a wall of glass with a fantastic view of the city, free mini bar (beer water and soft drinks) Pools ok they are big but it is the city centre what do you expect, they are clean and well tended. I would imagine very busy in the summer months, but hey ur only a short stroll to the sea. One big minus no aftrenoon sun area you have to go to the beach. One big plus the jacuzzi - a must. Another is the massive shopping centre next door. Breakfast was good lots of variety. Bar staff helpful and friendly. Street cafe opposite charges a fraction of the prices for drinks and the staff are fun. Acid test would i go back - Yep in a heart beat. Again not cheap but a touch of class. Had a problem in the shower and got upgraded very quickly mid stay to a suite, whilst it was nice i wudnt have paid for the difference, not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: xxLaniexx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September 2008. Upon arrival I was very impressed with the lobby and the staff were very nice and helpful. We requested a high floor room and thats what we got! The room itself was overlooking the amazing rooftop pool, with an amazing view of the Barcelona coast. The room was very modern and furnished to a very high standard. I found the bathroom especially was amazing. Separate shower, wc & sink areas which was great when were getting ready to go out! The only thing I could have a little moan about was how cold the pools were! It would help if they were heated especially the rooftop pool as this can get pretty cold as its so high up. The views from all the windows in the hotel are really breathtaking. The lists are pretty cool too as they are glass and on the outside of the building. Located right next to the Diagnoal Mar centre this was really handly for food & entertainment. A short stroll to the beach and the bottom end of Las Ramblas. If I were to visit Barcelona again I would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a perfect location, it was easy to get into the city centre as the tube station. Huge shopping centre next door with everything you need. The staff all spoke excellent English and were helpful. The rooms were clean, I had a good view of the city.The Breakfast buffet, was nice with a good selection of foods and drinks. The breakfast is really too expensive - 19 EUR! My safe did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: xRachelBx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights during January this year in the junior suite. My partner and I chose the princess love package which was a nice treat but in hind sight not worth the extra we paid; although I would defiantly recommend a junior suite over a standard room for the views from the bedroom, balcony and the bathroom and the extra space. Only downside to the junior suite was the large square, hard, uncomfortable pillows which meant we did not sleep as well as hoped and the AC wasnt great. Upon arrival and throughout the stay all the staff were very helpful, informative and friendly and I couldn’t fault the customer service. We received a welcome letter on our first evening and a thank you letter on our last night. All rooms have free use of the mini bar which is restocked daily with water, bitter lemon, beer and coke. Breakfast had lots of fresh produce however the advertised full English breakfast consisted of only mini sausage, bacon and scrambled egg in the breakfast hall. We had breakfast in our room on the last morning which was much better and consisted of everything advertised including beans, fried egg, bacon, sausage and toast with English tea; with a supplement of 6 euro. Evening meals from the room service menu are reasonably priced and very tasty and well presented with various free condiments available plus no tray charge. Hotel facilities were nicely kept and both pools were open and heated to a lovely temperature. The hotel itself is quite far from central Barcelona but has good access to bus/taxi services and also, during the summer months, has a stop on the Barcelona tourist bus route. There is also a large shopping centre right next to the hotel and it is only a 10 minute walk to the beach. We paid 40 euros for a taxi from the airport with a journey time of around 30 minutes. A taxi into central Barcelona cost around 11 euros. Overall a nice hotel that I would return to given a better rate than what we paid this time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JDevlin50
Reviews.Content: Before I travelled to this hotel, I checked out the reviews on this site.. A mixed bag of pros and cons..seemed to me that some people are just moody and expect too much. The literature was impressive and it was close to the city, it would surely be fine.. Unfortunately, it was not. * Top floor pool 'Out of Use' * Top floor bar closed * Bar on third floor closed (apparently both of these bars are only open in the Summer..would have been nice of them to tell me that on their website before I took 3 trains, 2 flights and bus- 12hrs in total- to get there) * The jacuzzi was lukewarm, half-full and after a while the chemical disinfectant started to cling to my skin. On top of that, I had to ask reception to send someone up to switch it on on my first day there..that was after I'd hunted out the phone which I'd been directed to by the masseuse. It was also only half working, with sporadic jets, broken drains and rusty bolts. * The sauna gave a burning smell which meant I had to leave after a few minutes. * There was not one iron to be had in the whole hotel. I was offered a laundry service at €13. Now, the lady was extremely pleasant and done a great job, but €13 to iron a shirt, within an hour or not, is ridiculous. How can you call it a 4* hotel and not have an iron? * The minibar consisted of 5 drinks; two soft, two water and a beer. It was nice, and pleasant, particularly when there was such a nice view to admire. But no nuts, no crisps, it's not a 'FREE MINIBAR', it's a few drinks. * The breakfast at €19 was massive and nice enough..but you can't justify charging that price for a breakfast. I sat from about 7.15 to 7.50 and I was literally the only person in the huge dining room. It could have fed 30-40 easily. It just didn't make sense. * It's not cable TV, it's a mixture of free to view and some prescription channels. On the upside everyone I spoke to was extremely pleasant, the view from the room was fantastic, and the interior and design of the rooms was impressive and very comfortable. They did cancel the laundry charge and offer me a free breakfast, after some pressing and their insistence that they didn't have any authority to, and that the duty-manager who wasn't on duty didn't either and couldn't speak English anyway, but all in......this is not a 4* hotel..and if they are advertising features which they do not offer..people who invest time and money on perhaps honeymoons, anniversaries, family holidays or like me just looking for a relaxing break will be disappointed. It's a shame because it is run by friendly people and could be what it claims..but they don't seem to be able to, or have the will to, provide it..and that is simply not acceptable. I wouldn't recommend this hotel..sorry...

Reviews.Title: “Winter Sun in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: obaysan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Princess is right next to the beach, good quality, and easily accessible from Barcelona town centre (Pl Catalunya) by metro, tram, or bus. Spacious and modern rooms, great views of the sea or the city, 23rd floor heated swimming pool, 3rd floor sauna and jacuzzi... Ideal place for a long weekend and anytime. Hotel is right on Diagonal, and attached to a shopping centre, perfect for all purposes. Take a stroll along the beach all the way to W hotel. It's the most pleasant walk you can have without getting exhausted.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay and already wanting to come back”
Reviews.Author: tintysteph
Reviews.Content: Well, after our 3rd stay here i can honestly say we love this place!! The hotel is so clean, staff more than helpful and friendly (Guillermo in the Corner Bar is fantastic, so helpful and a genuinely nice guy - he told us new places we should visit!). ALWAYS request a room as high as possible, the views from the top floor are great! Hotel has 2 pools, we stayed in December and i was too scared to go in as wasnt sure how heated they were.... I dipped my feet in and it was a perfect temperature, wish i had gone for a swim now! Hotel has wifi however this is limited to the lobby area, you cant get it in the rooms however i believe internet is available via adsl in the rooms! Since our last stay they have put english tv channels in - bbc1, channel 4 and E4 (think there was a couple more but we only watched tv briefly!) Rooms were cleaned and tidied every day, my pj's were neatly folded and put on the bed for me and contact lense cage with bottle neatly placed in corner of side in bathroom! Oh, the shower in the bathroom is to die for, has jets going down your body, lush!! Free mini bar in the room consisting of still and sparkling water, bottle of fizzy lemon, coca cola and Estrella Damn (local beer), this is replenished daily! Had room service this time, ordered the english breakfast, pic attached! €23 per person was a bit steep but had it as a lil treat on Xmas day! It did come with a bottle of wine too(!!!) breakfast was very yummy! Absolutely love this hotel! Yes it is a bit out of town but with the metro station nearby and the shopping centre below the hotel, you have everything you need closeby! Will be planning our 4th visit soon! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stray”
Reviews.Author: The_Protagonist
Reviews.Content: This is really great hotel, a bit far from major touristic attractions but with good subway connection to citi center. Modern, well equipped rooms, great seaview (if You're on the seaside of building). Pool on 23rd floor is additional benefit, a really nice one. A minor caveats from my side: rooms are not too big... and the windows are fixed so You are forced to use air conditioning, which I really dislike. thus 3* in "quality" eval. on the other hand, good drinks at the bar ;)

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Sw84
Reviews.Content: This hotel in my opinion is not a 4 star. I have stayed in a lot of hotels in a lot of different cities and this hotel, to me is a 3 star at best. Just a few things that I feel let it down. Firstly, the jacuzzi was cold, the sauna was broken and the massage table was not a massage table it was just a table. The bar area is meant to be table service but that happened only once out of 4 nights. I you arrived to breakfast around 10 the same food was still there from what I assume is first thing as the eggs were cold and any pancakes etc were rock hard. The double beds are just 2 singles pushed together. On the positive side the rooms were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Princess Hotel ... Simply amazing !”
Reviews.Author: HanFlamez
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the hotel after i've visited them over the summer and i must say that everything was just splendid once again ! I got a room on the 22nd floor with a nice view over the sea ( very nice ;-) ) and every day my room was cleaned. The minibar got refilled every day. ( use of the minibar is free, so thats a very cool extra to have ! ) The breakfast, which was included in my stay, was again very delicious ! A lot of variety and only very tasty things ! Most excellent to start off the day ! :) Staff is very friendly and always helpful whenever you have a question or a problem. It is simply one of the best hotels i have ever visited and i can recommend it to everyone ! PS : Some people say the location of the hotel is not that good, but don't forget that you have a metro stop at only 200 metres from the hotel !! And everything is easily reachable with the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevielittle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in the summer and was not disopointed. The room I had was very nice with aa great balcony view, and the free mini bar is a nice touch. It's close to the beach and taxis and buses are just around the corner, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night in march -11. My first thought about it was, wow! This is a very good and nice hotel. Got a room on the 11th floor. Had a nice view out towards the city. The room was very nice and clean and seemed kind of big. Nice, big and comfy bed. Bathroom was behind a glass wall with electronics drapes. My thought, cool. And it was a massagage shower. Bathropes and slippers. The hotel has two pools. One on one of the bottom floor (where sauna etc is) and on of one of the top floors. Both outside. Even if I was at the hotel in the middle of march, and the wheater was a bit chilly, the pool was heated and very nice. The location of the hotel is a little bit outside the center of Barcelona, with the subway it takes about 20 minutes to take you to the center. I didn´t see much of restaurants or bars around in the area. But there is a big mall just beside the hotel with a lot of food courts. I tried the restaurant at the hotel, good food. Nothing special but I was pleased. Breakfest was very good. Good selections of diffrents things. Overall, this is a very good hotel and I would defintley like to come back

Reviews.Title: “It's amazing”
Reviews.Author: Maedhy
Reviews.Content: This hotel it's amazing, the rooms was very Nice, The view from the rooms were beautiful, the staff. Was super cool, such a service, their breathtaking decoration. This hotel is worthy of its name Princess, when it returned, it is a magnificent Kingdom I recommend all my friends a

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CMMN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the summer for a week. The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful. Room was cleaned everyday with fresh bathrobes, slippers & towels. We even got complimentary champagne and chocolates delivered to our room one evening. Perfect location for a relaxing holiday by the beach but not too far from the hustle and bustle or the city. Would definitely recommend and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Eileen_W13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in November and found the location good even though it is a little outside the main city. It is very handy for the tram which stops just outside and the metro station is nearby. As there were 4 of us we used taxis from time to time and they were easy and cheap, although we enjoyed the tram and it could not be beaten for value. The rooms were just about large enough with a good sized bathroom (no bath though). The free mini bar was a nice touch, but not much in it apart from a beer, some soft drinks and a bottle of water. A very large comfortable bed helped give us a good nights sleep. The buffet breakfast is excellent with just about everything you would want on hand. We also used the sauna, but not the pool as it was a bit chilly. We met in the bar most evenings and found the staff friendly and we took advantage of the half price cocktail offer. The outside restaurants in the Diagonal Mar were close by and the Italian we went to was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona with a cheap airport taxi transfer”
Reviews.Author: Matt D
Reviews.Content: Taxi Transfer Barcelona was the company that made us the airport transfer to the city. We used this local company because they were recommended by my sister who used their services last month. The transportation was very efficient and cheap. We paid only 50 euros all inclusive for a 30 minutes ride. Our driver met us on Terminal 1 with a sign with my husband's name. We didn't had to wait long for the luggage and once we got into the arrivals lounge we could see him waiting for us. We stayed on Princess in a lovely room. We used Loving this hotel and as usual we found them a great company to deal with (we have used them 3 times). The weather was lovely and we walked up and down the Paso de Gracia (the main shopping street of the City) and could buy some presents for the family. We went to Figueres for a day to see a Salvador Dali Museum. This is well worth the trip as it is a very interesting place. It is a very popular weekend haunt for tourist from Barcelona who are interested in this Great contemporary Artist.

Reviews.Title: “Not for an ipad user”
Reviews.Author: milligan_umlaut
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because I was put there while working at an event at the CCIB. it's not the part of Barcelona you would choose for a holiday. But the hotel is generally good, although I was only on the fifth floor so didn't benefit from the views. Breakfast is good and generous (great if you are at an event with v little food!), although I would have liked fresh coffee rather than from a machine. there is a free but limited minibar and the room is pleasant with an open bathroom. My main quibble was no wi fi in the room. They do offer an ethernet cable, but not much use if you have an ipad.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best views of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Wolfie54
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times mostly because the location is near a large shopping center and just outside the city of Barcelona. This fantastic hotel has very nice rooms with large windows facing either the city or the sea. If you ask for a room on top level and you are lucky enough to get one facing the city you will have a fantastic view over the city of Barcelona especially in the night. If you have a suite with balcony you will find it hard to go to bed as the view in the night is so fantastic. This will sure be our no 1 Hotel when we stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, very good breakfast, easy to get to the subway”
Reviews.Author: Alf_Bacon
Reviews.Content: Excellent room, very comfortable to sleep, very good breakfast, well placed and easy to get to the subway. Barcelona has an excellent public transport system so being close to the subway you can get anywhere in town. A large shopping center, just next door to the hotel, gives you lots of options for dining.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern business hotel, ideally located for CCIB”
Reviews.Author: LJ_Surrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 days and would definitely stay again if working at CCIB, however if you are looking for a hotel in close proximity of the tourist hotspots, then you may want to stay elsewhere as its some distance from central Barcelona. The view from the 23floor is lush (where the pool and bar is located). Wifi is free and so is the minibar however it only includes soft drinks and beer, so if you drink spirits & wine you will need to purchase these from the bar. The rooms are clean and very modern, designed with a open plan bathroom which isn't to everyones taste. The beds and linen are comfortable, but doubles are actually twin beds zipped together ;) breakfast is also really good is a large range of items available for most diets.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a meh location”
Reviews.Author: davidjoho
Reviews.Content: It's a terrific, modern hotel. Tasteful and elegant. My room was clean, modern, and comfortable. The Internet was free (via ethernet cable, provided at the desk), the breakfast was excellent, the views are beautiful (especially if you get a room facing the sea), and the people were friendly. But, it's outside of the city center. If you're in town for an event at the convention center next door, you'll find it perfectly located. For the rest of us, it's a long haul to the Barcelona we came to visit. The area is nondescript, abutting a major mall. Public transportation is right next door, so if you're ok commuting in to the Barcelona you'll love, the Princess is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Princess - Perfect for the Shopper In You!”
Reviews.Author: mothers_wisdom
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here. The staff were always friendly and helpful. I spent a fair bit of time at the bar enjoying the barbecue peanuts and cocktails. The hotel is conveniently located for public transport (bus, metro and taxi rank across the road by the convention centre) and there is a great mall right next door with plenty of places to eat and shop. I loved the glass wall between the bedroom and the bathroom. The problem with glass, however, is that it can crack and both the bathroom and shower door showed signs of this. I had read that there was no tea/coffee making facility in the room and I agree that this is surprising for a hotel of this calibre. The minibar - well, let's just say you won't get drunk on i! it's mainly water, coke and a bottle of beer. But I don't really drink so it didn't bother me. The bed was fantastic. So comfortable, wish I could have brought it home with me. The only real negative I would say is that there was a slight smell of 'eau du sewer' that lingered in the toilet area which seemed to get stronger as the hotel got busier. But then, there was sometimes an odd smell in the general area (if you're flying into Girona Airport, it might smell like the middle of a farm!!) If you want to be in the middle of everything then this is not the hotel for you. But it is so easy to get to 'action' from here that I don't even see it's location as a negative. Overall, would I stay here again? Most certainly!!

Reviews.Title: “It's a Convention Centre hotel and nothing more”
Reviews.Author: S6blr
Reviews.Content: What a bland and uninspiring hotel this place is. You wait on average 5-7 minutes for an elevator to come, the rooms are either boiling hot or freezing and the beds are like sleeping on a board. The free breakfasts are tasteless, vending machine coffee, but the fresh orange juice divine. Bar prices are pretty decent -- and very cold beer help offset some of the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vor visiting the CCIB.”
Reviews.Author: Arv0
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference at the CCIB. Perfect for that, it is across the street. One thing to complain about is that the room I slept had very thin walls...I could hear my neighbour talking to someone on the phone..and the replies too! Apart from that: good sized room, though a bit worn out on the edges, if you're critical. Breakfast: I've had better breakfasts in lesser starred hotels and B&B's. Location: as I mentioned before perfect if you have to visit a conference at the CCIB, and it is conveniently located near a tube-station. And close to the sea. Staff: friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Manunu
Reviews.Content: I got a special offer on lastminute.com for this 4 star hotel in Barcelona. It's not in the center but it's at the end of Av. Diagonal, however there's a metro stop just 1 block away which gets you to the center in 20 mins. We were given a room on the last floor (26th), the bed was huge and confortable. The bathroom has glass walls that overlook the room, and there's a shower with a wonderful jacuzzi (excellent after a tiring day of walking around town!). As read on other reviews the bathroom does have a weird smell at times, which you don't expect in a 4 star hotel. The hotel also offers free minibar (1 refill per day), a small jacuzzi and 2 pools. The breakfast is far too expensive (€ 19), you can find places that offer a cappuccino and croissant for about € 2.50! Overall, considering we found an offer and paid a ridiculous € 70/per night, which for Barcelona is quite cheap, I would recommend this hotel. However, if the normal price is around € 120 - 130 per night I would look for something closer to the center, although it isn't easy to find 4 star hotels at this price in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenchanted
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in September with a friend and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms are cleaned everday and there is a free mini bar ( it doesnt have much in it). Loved the shower but the rooms are a bit too open. Def need to use the blackout blinds!! Great selection for breakfast. And the bar on the 3rd floor is lovery. The hotel is right beside a shopping centre so go ther for a better selection at night time. Great location as the hotel is bedside a merto station and the tour bus also stops outside. Even though it was a bit outside the main area its worth staying here as the area felt safe and secure.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4* Hotel that's got it's eye on design. Shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: sonnywaheed
Reviews.Content: Overview Barcelona Princess is slap bang alongside the new convention centre (at the most southern point of the Ave. Diagonal) and adjacent to a good sized shopping centre. That said, if you're not in town to attend the conference centre, I'd give this location a miss. It reminds me of London's Docklands area; it's soulless and lacks any of the colour and energy that Barcelona has to offer. The Good The hotel looks quite lovely. The bedroom has an open plan design - there's a glass wall separating the bathroom from the bedroom and within the bathroom area the toilet and shower areas are separate frosted glass cubicles. There is a large blind that can be pulled down to create some privacy in the bathroom, should you wish to have that. All the surfaces in the bathroom and the sinks are made of glass too. The result is a pleasure to the eyes and creates a wonderful sense of space. The room's not small, but not the most generously sized room I have stayed in. The bed was firm and had nice crisp linen and a duvet. The TV worked perfectly well too. There's also a free mini-bar int he room which has complimentary soft drinks and beer. There's Internet access, but only via a cable connection (so annoying if, like me, the iPad is now your travel PC!). The wardrobe includes slippers and a robe. There's also a small desk and chair in the room. The not so good. Most annoyingly (for a business hotel) there's no iron in the room and, as mentioned above, no WiFi (two things I consider essential for a business hotel). Whilst there's a nice amenity kit (with toothbrush, toothpaste, shampoo, soap, shower gel, and shower cap), they didn't bother with a razor or body lotion. Summary This is a nice hotel that is wonderfully designed. Unfortunately a few essentials have been missed, but that's a minor quibble. The one thing that lets the place down is the location. Unless you're visiting the conference centre, I'd probably go for a hotel more in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hegooooo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for weekend. Rooms not very big, but very well laid out, lots of glass. Little extras like slippers, free minibar and dressing gowns. Very friendly staff, free internet area beside reception. Not on the tourist track, but well worth the taxi fare into city. Air show was on at the time so great views......

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star!”
Reviews.Author: RPMol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week during our conference at the CCIB and for that reason, it is situated well. Lay-out of the rooms is not very nice with a massive glass wall between the bathroom and the bedroom. The window was open when I first came into the room and could not be closed because the handle was broken. The furniture is old, no wireless connectivity in the room, the ceiling above the shower was leaking and the television was positioned ackwardly above the cupboard. Breakfast was ok but poor machine coffee and too few tables. I'd recommend ou try the AC accross the road!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of luxury away from the tourist hot-spots”
Reviews.Author: xina1981
Reviews.Content: I got a last-minute deal on this hotel having moved from a terrible hotel in the city centre. The hotel isn't in the best location for exploring the city, but I would much prefer to stay in luxury and make the effort to travel in than be ripped off with a dump hotel in the prime tourist spots. We had a beautiful room on 16th floor with a sea-view. The hotel has everything you'd expect from a modern business hotel - bathrobes, multi-jet shower (which yes, did leak - but that's the cleaner's problem!), electric blinds, huge beds, mini bar (soft drinks were included in our deal). The pools, gym, sauna and jacuzzi are also a nice bonus which you rarely get in a city centre hotel. Transport links generally seemed pretty good, we used the tram and metro during the day (although we didn't realise there was a metro station right outside until the last day!) and taxis in the evening which cost about 10 euros to get into the city. A few minor negatives with the hotel.... it has two pools: roof-top and 3rd floor pool which are both nice but both pools are positioned so that they only get the sun in the morning. So don't expect to get in from a day of exploring the city and sit in the sun round the pool. Taxis could be a bit of a nightmare at peak times ie. Friday and Saturday night. There is a taxi stand outside the Marriott opposite but rarely any taxis in it. We asked the hotel to order us one on a number of occasions which they did for us. Breakfast in the hotel is extortionate at 19euros pp and there didn't seem to be much else around the hotel in terms of cafes/restaurants so would advise trying to get a deal with your booking or travel into town for something a bit better value for money. In summary, I'd recommend the hotel if you're looking for luxury in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but next time I will stay in another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katherina1
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general nice, but I would not stay there again. Breakfast for such expensive hotel was very poor- 2 kind of had, scrambled eggs and cooked vegetables. No fish, no beans, no fruit salad, no cakes or other desert as you can find in other 4* hotels. My husband and I were checking out early in the morning and asked the give up a packed breakfast. We were unpleasantly surprised to find only 2 sandwidges and a pack of chips in a huge breakfast box. Very bad image for a hotel to give a pack of chips as a breakfast for guests. Pool on the 3rd floor is nice but it's location on the 3rd floor is awful !!! Jakuzzi is located on the same floor and it's opened. Lot of dust and noise from the street and people from the hotel opposite, can see you sitting in Jakuzzi, and you have a feeling that you sit in Jakuzzi in the middle of the street. There is a 2m wide swimming pool on the 23 floor but we didn't use it because my husband used sauna as well and it was only on the 3 floor. Sauna was always very cold, only +70C, but I think you can ask to put it up. We simply didn't bother. Rooms with the sea view don't worth paying extra. The area between the hotel and the seashore is very ugly and looks more like an indisrtial area. View over the city is much better, expecially at night. The rooms are of good size and design, except that of the awful glass wall separating what supposed to be a bathroom from the room. There is a black shutter to pull it down but I still felt very uncomfortable as there is no door in the "bathroom". Beware, that the rooms have to tea/coffee facility and no iron. I took everything with me as my husband drinks a lot of coffee and it's more convinient to make your own any time you wish rather than calling room service. The location of the hotel is good, only 10 min walk to the nearest beach, huge shopping mall with nice restaurants is next to the hotel. Metroline and tram that takes you to the city centre and hop-on hop-off but stors in front of the hotel. 3 elevators are very fast. We never had to wait more than 1-2 min and the view from the glass elevators over the city is very beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: naturelover1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night but loved the room and amenities. All employees were helpful, kind and professional except for the very first person we encountered upon arrival at reception. We weren't able to check in early, which was certainly understandable. Unfortunately however, we weren't provided with any options or suggestions. We did however ask about the facilities and were given access to the pool, which made the wait not much trouble at all. The service at the poolside cafe was very good and the room was great!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rishigudka
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, next to a shopping centre, 5 mins from metro, 1 min from the tourist bus stop, 3 mins from a tram stop, 7 mins from the beach, next to few restaurants, bars etc. It's about 15mins on metro to lasramblas but that was not a problem at all for us. The hotel itself has one restaurant, 2 bars, 2 small pools and nice funky rooms with great views from upper floors. We had booked cheapest room but got sea view rooms on 14th floor. Rooms Were nice with big picture windows, flat screen tv but no coffee making facilities but that was not a problem for us as we were out all day. I would recommend this hotel to anybody looking for good superior accommodation in a good location. Service was good too. Took a bit longer at check in but check out was a breeze. Breakfast was good but no omelettes. However adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nichjiggle
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very easy to get to by metro, bus and tram, also the tour bus stops right outside, its a little out of Town, but it suited us. You can walk from the hotel along the beach to Port Vell, its a lovely walk, there are bars and tapas places to relax and enjoy the beach. The breakfast was yummy, with a good selection, we didnt have the same thing, each morning, when we went to get more food, our table was cleared and some people sat at our table, so we had to find another table, so if your going for more food, make sure, your table doesnt get cleared. The pools were small, but did the job. We had lovely views over the city from the 15th floor. The lifts were slow at peak times, which was abit annoying. The shopping centre was great, its attached to the hotel, wish i took a bigger suitcase, so i could buy more things. I liked the gift bag, and the free mini bar. There was also a tapping noise coming from the bathroom, with the door closed, we couldnt hear it. The walls are quiet thin, we heard chairs scrapping and coughing. Would i stay there again, Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views!”
Reviews.Author: Resident1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of May start of June 2011. This hotel is situated across the road from the beach and next door to a very large shopping centre-Diagonal Mar. Las Ramblas is about an hours' walk from the hotel. The metro stop is across the road from the hotel and the tram stop El Maresme Forum stops on the road directly outside the hotel. Once you have map, commuting around the city on public transport is a breeze. A tourist bus stops directly outside the hotel which makes for great site seeing. Rooms are not huge but designed cleverly making a great use of space, we got a double room (large double bed) and the room was bright with large windows with a blackout blind for night-time. We requested a room with a view and we certainly got it - on one of the top floors with a fabulous view of the city and Sagrada Familia . A glass wall separates the bathroom from the bedroom and the shower and toilet are in cubicles. There is a blind on this glass wall for privacy. The showers were superb power showers and will not flood the bathroom if the nozzle is placed correctly. Breakfast was plentiful with a brilliant choice to suit all palates and replaced quickly with the exception of pastries (once they were gone they were gone). Brilliant gym facilities, access to internet is in the computer room above reception but the pool on the top floor is small and narrow. All in all we had a very comfortable stay at this hotel. Dislikes included the wood paneling in the corridors and bedrooms which give a modern style hotel a very dated appearance. We were lied to by the reception staff of there being nowhere to eat in the vicinity other than the hotel restaurant. As it was a rainy day and we didn't fancy travelling back to the heart of Barcelona we stumbled upon numerous eateries in Diagonal Mar shopping centre next door to the hotel which is less expensive. Pickpockets are plentiful and extremely light fingered in Barcelona as we experienced so be extremely careful with personal belongings.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baliaddict
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well worth the trip for being out of town as peaceful Here. I would recommend as only 15mins on metro to las ramblas but very quiet on a night to sleep . Beds very comfy and pool although small does it's job . Good all round hotel . If you are going to Barcelona watch the pick pockets I have never seen so many !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the beach and the city away from the madding crowds and on good transport links”
Reviews.Author: Juvejon
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for the beach and the city away from the madding crowds and on good transport links. This hotel has bus stops outside, a 2 minute walk to Forum tube and a tram stop so can be in the centre in 15 minutes or so. The beach is just over the road and if fancy can walk along the beaches all the way to Port Vell. The pools in the hotel are small but are a great asset and e views from the rooftop 23rd floor one are great. Indeed they are throughout the hotel - our room had a view of La Sagrada Familia in the distane. The free minibar drinks each day (1 coke, 1 lemonade, 1 beer, 1 sparkling & 1 still water) and the toiletries GiftBoxes were nice little touches to make you feel welcome and looked after. The reception staff were incredibly helpful everytime we asked them for advice too. All in all a great place to stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Holding up well”
Reviews.Author: benhuczek
Reviews.Content: 4-night stay privately booked. Every member of staff smiled - except the security guys, which is to be expected! A small hiccough in housekeeping with a missing bath robe was sorted by the time we got back to the room. We didn't go for the breakfast, so I can't comment on the catering. There were 5 drinks in the minibar and they were free. However, be warned, if you drink the replacement bottles, you DO get charged. You are probably 100m away from an Al Campo hypermarket which is the adjacent building, so stock up there and use the fridge if you want. It does work better if you leave the cupbaord doorr open to take the heat away. 17th Floor room with sea view was a worthwhile upgrade and the a/c worked fine and was quiet. The sound-proofing between rooms was efficient, unless there was nobody either side! It is a very busy hotel with guest checking in at all hours. But none of that disturbed us. The lifts deserve a mention. 264 rooms on 26 floors served by three lifts. Yes, there were some longish waits and sometimes, none at all. So, if the other guest didn't press the up buttons when they wanted to go down and vice vesa, the waits would be significantly shorter. In any case, there are great views to enjoy while waiting. The TV offered us BBC1, C4 and E4 in English which was an unexpected bonus. Late checkout is a possibility but you need to enquire on the day. If they can't do it, the concierge will store your luggage and you can grab a later shower on the 3rd Floor sauna rooms before your return home. So, that's not too bad. Before our arrival in Barcelone, the front desk responded swiftly to our enquiry with clear and detailed instructions to get there from the airport. They worked perfectly. 7-10 mins easy walk from a well-run sandy beach with bar, toilets, showers, first aid and lifeguards. If you didn't fancy the beach, there is an unmanned, outside lap pool onthe 23rd floor with views out to sea and another pool with bar service on the 3rd floor. Bottom line, sure it could do with a lick of exterior paint but the welcome smiles and cheerful response to solving minor guest issues make this a definite repeater.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, unhelpful management, not great location”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty372
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the princess as a suprise for my birthday from my partner. Hotel impressive from outside and rooms nice. First night our room was stifling hot.... air con is on a timer and Windows could not be opened!! I asked reception for a fan or to open the window (which the manager overheard) both of which was rudely refused. The manager was extremely rude and basically told me to lump it! Pretty out of the way from town centre & ramblas as hotel is right at the bottom of diagonal Mar. Walked home from Nou Camp (1.5hr) not recommended!! Upside is Tour Bus stops right outside hotel... however as this finished at 9pm it proved difficult to get home at night. Hotel seems more for business use rather than tourists. Would recommend Olympic Port & Port Vel both gorgeous. Sagrada Familia and the parks also great sights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice away from downtown”
Reviews.Author: meganwesley
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona Princess Hotel is a great option to consider when planning a trip to Barcelona. It is located on the eastern side of the city in the Forum District. The public transportation (buses, TRAM and METRO) is easily accessible and only about a 10 minute ride to the city center. Access to Barcelona's beautiful beaches and board walk is less than 1/2 a mile away, or about 10-15 minutes walking. The room we stayed in was very comfortable and spacious. The hotel offers a complementary mini bar that is restocked daily. The breakfast buffet contained the typical European spread of cold cuts/deli meats, cereals, pastries, fruit and some egg quiches. There are two pools at the hotel, one on the third floor and the other located on the roof top. Both pools are fairly small and offer limited seating so if the weather is favorable recommend heading for the beach and enjoy the sun from there. There are plenty of small huts that line the beach and offer food, drinks and can even rent a lounge chair for about 5 EUR a day. The fitness center offers a couple adequate treadmills, stationary bikes, and a stair stepper. The universal gym probably needs to be upgraded and the free weights are limited. Again, head for the beach/boardwalk if you are a runner, cyclist, skater, etc looking for a nice open place for a cardio workout. The hotel staff was very welcoming and friendly. Over all we would not hesitate to stay here again and definitely would recommend it to other travelers. You are definitely getting a lot more for the price when staying at this accommodating hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Away From The Madding Crowd”
Reviews.Author: Al450
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a city break and it was just ideal for us. Easy to get to any location by the metro and handy for the tour bus too. Amenities in the hotel are ok but room was very nice and didnt spend too long anywhere else as we were out exploring the city then enjoying the beach and a great way to walk back to the hotel if you like a stroll. Not sure i would pay full price but excellent value if you can get a deal. Didnt bother with breakfast as you can enjoy the experince of buying out which is cheaper and a lot more fun

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kpmommy
Reviews.Content: After a 7 night Mediterranean cruise, we were supposed to fly home when Hurricane Irene changed our plans. Disney cruise lines put us up in this hotel (after one night in a less desirable location) for two nights. It is close enough to downtown to get around, but not in a congested area. The beach is within walking distance, and there is a shopping mall next door with lots of restaurants. The hotel itself was very clean, modern looking, with great service. Breakfast was great with many buffet choices. There are 6 PCs available for guest use for free, although the wifi is limited to the lobby area only. The only drawback was that there are only 3 elevators, and on our last day, due to a convention at the Marriott across the street, there were so many people using them that we couldn't get on the elevators with our suitcases. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel, shame that clothing went missing from room”
Reviews.Author: MrBenUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this four star rated hotel for five nights at the start of August. The hotel is conveniently located near a tram stop and about five minutes walk from an underground station. There is a shopping centre next door that has a number of stores including a supermarket (Al Campo) where we purchased fresh bread and fruit for breakfast and snacks during the day. The hotel provides free soft drinks in the fridge in the room. This consisted of one bottle of Coke, one lemondade, one beer, one still water and one sparkling water. These are replaced each day if they are used. The fridge wasn't very cold but we found it worked better if you left the cupboard door open. There are also bath robes and slippers which are useful for walking to the pool etc. The room does have air conditioning but it doesn't work very well. We found it was better to leave the blackout blind shut along with the door to the bathroom. The blackout blind was excellent so much so that when we woke up one morning at 10AM it was so dark we thought it was still very early. For the British visitors the TV has BBC1 and E4 or Channel 4 (I can't remember which). There are two pools at the hotel. One is on the 23rd floor and is the deeper of the two. It is rectangular and you just about wide enough for two people to swim side-by-side. There are about 6 loungers next to the pool. The other pool is on the third floor and is only about 80cm deep and is triangular in shape. It is next to the bar/restaurant and gym. There is also a jacuzzi too which has space for three-four people. The hotel is fairly clean but we noticed that it took up to two days for other guests room service trays to be collected from the floor outside of their room which had all their dirty plates and glasses on them. There are 6 computers on the first floor that have free internet access on them. There are also a couple of printers so boarding passes can be printed for flights etc. In the public areas (bar and lobby) there is free wifi - this is going to be extended at some point in the future. There are only three lifts and there can be a wait sometimes for them particularly around the 12PM check out time. They can also get very hot during the day. The staff all spoke English (most very well but some not so well). We weren't very impressed with the beach nearest the hotel. There was a lot of debris including broken glass and a knife. The sand was also not very nice it had a lot of small stones in it. The beach at the Olympic Port was much nicer and had a better crowd. It was quite easy to get there using either the underground or tram. The tram from the hotel terminates at the Olympic Port. It is then about a 5-10 minute walk from the underground and tram stations to the beach. We were pretty impressed with the hotel until the penultimate day when a pair of pyjamas went missing from our room. We reported this to reception who said they would check with housekeeping to see if they had collected them by mistake. We checked with reception later that day who after much difficulty trying to explain what had happened, contacted housekeeping only to find no-one had been in contact with them. The reception staff took our details and advised we contact the next day to see if anything had turned up unless they contacted us in the meantime. I actually left if 5 days. It took four days for the hotel to respond only to say they had been unable to locate them. Disappointed with the response I replied to the hotel suggesting that they could compensate me for the loss. After 10 days I had not received a response so I contacted the hotel again. I received a reply almost immediately to say that it takes time to contact people because everyone is away on holiday during August but they are not able to help. This is not the sort of customer service you expect from a four star hotel and this has now completely soured my view of the hotel so much so that I would not recommend people stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, close to beach, well out of city”
Reviews.Author: liamr
Reviews.Content: I will start this review with the hotel location; it’s in the forum district, which is a long way from the city centre of Barcelona. If you really like being in the middle of things this hotel is not for you. However the metro and tram system’s are right outside the hotel making it very easy to get into the heart of things in 10 mins from leaving the hotel, the metro system is very good and frequent. Taxi’s to city centre are about €10, to airport about €30. Both hop on/hop off bus services also leave from outside the hotel as well making it a very accessible hotel even though it is so far away. Onto the hotel, the free mini bar is a nice touch, breakfast was ok, not brilliant, wouldn’t pay extra for it. Our room was on floor 20, the room was very good, pillows were bad and the bed was ok. View of the city from here was amazing. Didn’t really try the pools as they are small and claustrophobic, you feel like you are in someone’s back garden rather than a hotel. The rooms are well laid out, automatic blinds block out the light and the sleeping area is enclosed, limiting noise from the hall. Air-con & shower were great as well. The staff were brilliant and a delight to deal with, every request greeted with a smile and a helpful response. I can’t say enough about them, check in and check out were fast and when I asked for late checkout to allow sometime to recover from a bout of food poisoning (not hotel related) the only issue they had was they could only give me the room until 2 as they were fully booked. There is also a shopping centre and huge supermarket inside so all manner of things can be gotten there, wouldn’t eat there but good for supplies. One bad note is there is a smell outside the hotel (some sort of processing plant close by) which is one of the worst smells I have ever encountered. Avoid heading straight across the road for any reason as it’s just beyond the event centre. If going to the beach walk to the Hilton and cross the road there, the smell doesn’t seem to make it down to the beach but makes walking outside a daunting task. Overall given the price we got the hotel for which included breakfast and the ease of using the public transport this hotel is well located for beach access and a quiet retreat after a night in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cathy B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Barcelona for a short break. The room was clean with a great shower. The hotel is only a 15 minute walk from the beach and a 5 minute walk from the metro station which brings you into the city center in about 15 minutes. Would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: gforces69
Reviews.Content: Good Check-IN service. FRIENDLY STAFF.. Hotel located at end of this Diagonal street.. 4 Stops from Famous AKBAR (glass lighted) building.. Hotel on FORUM station on LRT line(green Line)... Metro line is MARESME FORUM( YELLOW LINE). 1 Min to Hotel. Free.. yes free Internet in Lobby 2nd level.. and WIFI.. Bathroom vanity belongs in Museum , not in Hotel. Sink has no Back Splash, , so you will get water on the floor. Not sure only this room or all rooms were designed same..... Hotel room SAFES are not mounted.. you can walk right out from the Hotel, with the Safe. Long waiting time for Elevators, only 3 elevators for a large 25 story hotel. Upgrade rooms are $39. Euro per night. Take the METRO Line to visit Downtown area.. fast and convenient. or buy T-10 pass valid for 10 trips aprox 16 Euros..each. Take Airport Buses to Catalunya Station-Plaza and transfer to (Red) metro to Urquinaona station. then (Yellow) line all the way to Hotel.. Airport buses 5 min frequency from Catalonia Square(Main Square of City) ( M4 Red line) 3-5$ Euro to T1 -T2 Excellent Metro system. in Barcelona.. have traveled to Atlanta, New york, San Fran, London, Germany.. Okay Room maintenance service( asked staff to check the bed lamp, no one ever came back to fix light.. Room doesnt have VERTICAL BLINDS.. ONLY HORIZONTAL ROLL DOWN.. TOTAL LACK OF PRIVACY AND VISIBILITY..

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeffrey d
Reviews.Content: room was nice, had a little balcony had gluten free breakfast, very very good! couple of cons valet parking is idiot, doesn't work at all. the elevators are not so great, you have to wait way to long not enough international tv stations

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some bad, Overall pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: milez1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelona Princess for a 4 day get away to the amazing city of Barcelona. The hotel is a bit out of the way if you only want to site see. I am the type of person that likes to experience the city for more than the tourist traps. When I booked this hotel it was a toss up between it and the Hilton(right across the street). I decided to go with the the Princess because it provided free internet. The internet works great if you are using a laptop that has the ability to accept an ethernet connection. If you don't you will have to go to one of the common areas to use the free wifi. Most hotels in europe do not provide free internet, so the Princess gets major points for this. When we arrived to our room we were greeted by a bottle of Champagne with a small assortment of deserts. The breakfast at the hotel is pretty good, and the staff was very friendly. The tourist site seeing buses stop right outside the hotel, and if you would prefer to catch a cab they are posted up outside of the hotel. If you skateboard, inline skate or like to run the hotel is located near the beach and there is miles of smooth pavement to utilize. Some bad points: The elevator is a bit of a pain because there are so many people that need to use it. The pools are really small and I almost felt rude to get in and swim because the people sun tanning around the pool acted like they were to good to have a little water splashed on them. The hotel did not have any irons in the room or for use anywhere else. The rooms did not have face cloths. The dinner selection is limited, but if you walk across the street you can dine in the Hilton's restaurant !!! Overall, if you you want a place to stay that is near the beach and you don't really care about pool time, then you should give this place a shot.

Reviews.Title: “we would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: sak8
