Reviews.Content: very good hotel situated a little outside of main town centre, but nearer the beaches. so you could have a beach holiday as well as a sightseeing one. transport is excellent as trams, buses metro and the tourist bus[which really is excellent] are all nearby. BUT be very very carefull on the metro , pickpockets seem to target tourists. hotel has 2 small pools and excellent breakfast. 2 small cafe/restaurants opposite to sit outside and watch the world go bye. also right next to gigantic shopping mall , so you are fully occupied even if it showers.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel ! Will definitely come back !”
Reviews.Author: Tony_LAO
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with its wonderful view from the 26th floor ! I enjoyed to pool on the 3rd floor and the massage ! Definitely the hotel to be in Barcelona !

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way, Uncomfortable bed...”
Reviews.Author: Rockeymoore
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because it looked to be a modern hotel overlooking the beach. Indeed, it is modern compared to the 16th century buildings in Las Ramblas but it had a weird 70s dated feel with a lot of wood paneling. That being said, our room had a neat glass wall separating the bedroom from the bathroom (which my husband promptly closed citing his need for privacy) and our view included the roof of a history museum and water in the distance. For us, the "king" bed was the deal breaker. It was really two beds somehow taped together and during the night the beds would split in two if either of us rolled the wrong way. It was uncomfortable and inconvenient. Despite our dissatisfaction with the room, the staff were pleasant and went out of their way to be accommodating. Word of caution: in order to get anywhere you have to take the nearby metro or a taxi. My husband and I were coming out of a metro when a guy "pretended" to drop his keys. I was slightly ahead of my husband so I was able to see the entire incident. He bent down to grab his keys and pushed my husband backwards. His affect was so odd that I told my husband to check his wallet (which was in his back pocket). Sure enough, it was gone! The guy had been working with another guy who stole my husband's wallet while he was being distracted by the first guy. I cried out and started after the guy. Everyone stopped and AMAZINGLY the second guy gave the wallet back (and all of my husband's credit cards were still there). I suspect that he flipped the wallet open and saw that it contained no cash and decided to give it back instead of cause a scene. Be careful of pickpockets!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room!”
Reviews.Author: Gifu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is approx. 20mins from the core by metro. Free wifi in common areas. The room is amazing! We got the sea-view room on the higher floor. Big room and bed (2 singles combined). Power blinds and great shower/bathroom. After a week of so called 3* and small rooms in France, this hotel/room is a huge upgrade. A solid 4* with a free minibar, few 5* can boast that. The rooftop pool needs some maintenance but offer good sea-view. Not many loungers available (maybe around 8) and the pool is small, can't really swim. There is a little wait for elevators, but since we are on vacation, it didn't bother us that much. The hotel is next to a mall. I recommend Cafe Viena for breakfast/lunch. Free mini-croissant with coffee. We enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Princess when you want to feel like a princess :-)”
Reviews.Author: emxtje
Reviews.Content: Tnx for a great vacation and the view was amazing! (26st floor) I miss Barcelona :-(

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Kate C
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, rooms were immaculate and cleaned to extremely high standard each day, we had a nice balcony with one of our rooms and the other 2 had nice veiws of Barcelona. The beautiful beaches are just a short walk away, which was a massive bonus as we loved spending time down here (apart from the beach bar/restaurant which was the first one we came to, the waitress was so rude to us and made us feel so unwelcome, would definately avoid this place in future!) The Marina is a bit further away but well worth the walk or taxi fare, as we loved it down there - amazing restaurants and atmosphere, nightlife was great! The hotel is quite far from La Ramblas but there are lots of transport links around. Breakfast at the hotel was very good, loads of fresh fruit, different breads and cheeses (which is good for me being a veggie!). Was difficult to get anything to eat at night at the hotel, no food delivery or takeaways nearby, room service is quite limited and rather pricey! Swimming pools are on the small side but still lovely, and we had such an enjoyable time here, would definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Next year again”
Reviews.Author: michael151995
Reviews.Content: I went there with 5 friends and we really had a nice week there. The stuff was very friendly and helpfull, the rooms were perfekt, clean and we had a incredible view to the beach and the skyline of Barcelona. The pool on the top was small, but again we could enjoy a nice view. The roomservice is also very good, but a little bit expensive. But alltogether we had a perfekt week at the hotel and we'll come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “We went back, and will do it again.”
Reviews.Author: Verner S
Reviews.Content: Two years ago we spend a lovely week at the hotel. When we booked our second stay in Barcelona we wanted to experience the hotel once again. If you want a stylish hotel, with professional staff, a very good breakfast and do not mind to stay outside the city centrum, Barcelona Princess will be perfect. We used the metro in and out of the city. It is a perfect beach a 5 minutes walk from the hotel. And the metro goes all the time, so we will not hesitate spending our next Barcelona trip at the Barcelona Princess. It is no doubt in our mind, if you book room at Barcelona Princess, the stay in Barcelona will be better. There is only one hotel in Barcelona, the Barcelona Princess!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with amazing views. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: paokhab
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights for fiance's birthday. It was a very nice way to relax. Room was beautiful with gorgeous view of the sea from 18th floor. Shower was very nice with massage type settings. Loved the modern style of blinds and lighting. Very clean room and bathroom with complimentary bathrobes. Safe worked well. Underground parking was convenient (fee). Only downside was that this hotel had no wireless internet. Quite surprising for the quality and modern style it portrays. If this is added to the package then it would definitely be a 5/5 for me. We did however have access to wifi in the lounge and cable internet in our room with our laptop. We never got to enjoy the rooftop pool due to bad weather on the day we were going to, but it looked amazing. Hotel suggested an excellent restaurant for a nice birthday dinner. Very much appreciated for the tip. Overall the hotel had great service with constant refills to our (free) minibar. Location is very nice as well. Not too far or too close to the craziness of downtown barcelona. Just what you need for a relaxing visit of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Break”
Reviews.Author: BillericayBaggie
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night break at The Princess with my wife and youngest child aged 6. Really enjoyed the time spent at the hotel, great room with a balcony, helpful advice from the staff. 15 minute walk to the beach, 5 minute walk to the shopping centre and metro with a 20 minute ride to the city centre. Drinks were good value and a cocktail happy 2 hours! Fantastic breakfast - excellent choice and plenty of room. Would recommend the hotel - very clean and usefull 2 swimming pools but sauna needed to be hotter. If you have children make sure you get the free coach at 9.20 from outside the hotel to Illa Fantasia water park.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is Absolutely Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Dalziel1172
Reviews.Content: I Stayed here last week and i was completely blown away! i booked it through easytobook.com just leaving my bank details to secure my reservation and kept in contact with the hotel itself to make sure it was secure. When i arrived we were put on the 15th floor with a city view THIS IS DEFINITELY worth it! a full view of the city at night and in the morning was the best thing i had ever seen! well worth it if your taking a romantic getaway. Also loved the fact most things were free, free internet, free spa, free gym, free swimming pool, topped up minibar daily, i was expecting to have to actually pay for something besides the room. There is a shopping mall right next to the hotel if you want to eat on the cheap everything is so cheap in there especially alcohol! :) The hotel itself is right by the beach and transportation is right outside tram and metro straight to the beach or the city takes about 10 minutes, or a taxi that takes about 8 minutes and costs around 6-8 euros. if you come to barcelona STAY here! you will not be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was pure awesomeness !”
Reviews.Author: HanFlamez
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed at this hotel for 6 nights during our summer holidays. We have enjoyed ourselves thanks to the friendly staff that was always able to help us with whatever questions we had. Also the breakfast buffet was top notch ! A lot of variety and a lot of choices, which made our breakfasts very delicious and enjoyable. The room itself was very cousy and big and had a nice view over the city. Our room was cleaned daily and our minibar refreshments were also replaced on a daily basis. This was really really nice to experience. We have used the swimming pools ( on both 3rd and 23rd floor ) and jacuzzi on a regular basis and enjoyed every minute of it. However i must say that the towels replacement at the swimming pools should happen more than just a few times per day, because sometimes we went to take a swim and there were no towels present ... But overall i am really really satisfied with the services this hotel had to offer, it's staff and the hotel itself. I would recommend it to anybody ! Thank you all for a nice summer holidays, all thanks to the Barcelona Princess Hotel. Regards, Han Flamez

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fungus-feet
Reviews.Content: A little out of the main centre,seemed to only have wired internet in the room (complementary), there are only 3 lifts so sometimes you have to wait a bit, but give credt where credit is due. This hotel was excellent. Staff were friendly and very helpful. We stayed in a room with ocean view and it was worth it. There is a hop-on hop-off bus stop outside the hotel. It is attached to a shopping mall so there are a number of resturants. Did not eat at the hotel resturant so couldnt comment on that, but their prices seemed resonable. I would have no problems statying here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location for beach leisure”
Reviews.Author: Katya81
Reviews.Content: Sevice wasn't excelent but the staff was friendly, english-speaking and helpful. Room was quite small, not functional layout and poor sound proofing. No sound insulation between the restroom and the main space, wifi is not available in the room. The location is nice for those who spend much time on the beach and very close to public transport stations. The pool on the 23d floor didn't work. All nice restaurants were far. Overall the hotel was clean, not so expensive and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Just after booking again!!”
Reviews.Author: KaBell777
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice and absolutely adore this place!!! It's clean, safe, modern and so central ( beach, town, metro, shopping centre) all within walking distance! The rooms are big and bright... bathrooms were very clean aswell. The views in this hotel are absolutely spectacular, you can even see the Gaudi Cathedral as it's being done up! can't wait to go back in a few weeks, I know myself and my partner will be well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel a litle outside of the center”
Reviews.Author: daebischer
Reviews.Content: we have spent 3 very nice days in Barcelona princess. staff is friendly and professional. the hotel is quite a bit outside the city but only a few steps away from the Metro. we have particularly appreciated the nearby beach. Our seaview room was spacious and very modern. only downside: there is no balcony. you must check out the roof-terrace pool , this was one of our highlits

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: R0derik
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and i loved the shower. The swimmingpools were a little bit small though. Totall experience good!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, great beach location!”
Reviews.Author: Clusk86
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & I stayed in the Princess for the last 2 nights of out week in Barca. After doing all the usual sightseeing & feeling the great buzz of the city, this hotel was perfect to finish off our stay in a luxurious & in a chilled athmosphere. It's only a 5 min walk from the beach which is absolutely beautiful. A sunbed will cost you only €5 & there are plenty to go around! It's also located right nxt to a huge shopping mall which houses all major brands & has a lovely courtyard area with a selection of nice restaurants to choose from. The hotel itself has sone really impressive views (We booked a special sea-view suite on special through the hotel website), the staff were extremely friendly & helpful and had great English. Overall, our stay in the Princess was fantastic & I would highly recommend it to any of my friends travelling to Barca.

Reviews.Title: “Chilled escape out of town”
Reviews.Author: MollyPearl
Reviews.Content: Most important thing to say about this hotel is that it's further from the centre of Barcelona than it may appear on the map. I was a little disappointed when I realised, but as someone who'd already travelled the city proximity to a more chilled beach actually made this the perfect location. Room was excellent, view was awesome. The pool was average. Approx 20 mins from the centre of town, close to a metro and most importantly, a relaxed beach. If you don't mind being away from the buzz for some downtime, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel but staff only helpful if you force them”
Reviews.Author: in-situLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. The rooms are much nicer than shown on the internet. They are quiet, functional, attractive and roomy. The minibar (free) is re-stocked every day as are the miniatures. The shower is amazing and the views stunning. The location is wonderful - 10 mins to a nice beach and 15 mins to the centre on the underground (close nearby). The hop-on hop-off bus leaves just outside the hotel. I read several reviews complaining about the service and they are all correct. The staff did not seem to know much about Barcelona. One woman told us how to get to the airport (after a grilling from me asking specific questions) but she omitted to tell us important facts like changing from the underground to the overground requires a 15 minute walk and you have to re-stamp your card. The only information I could squeeze out of her was specifically what I asked for ("how do I get to the airport using the train did not cut it - I then had to specify "which train, how much, how often etc etc) and this was not the only instance. They are very slow, carry on with personal conversations and do not seem bothered about you. I would still give this hotel a 5 star rating - I love the princess chain but I would beg the management to do something about the interest levels of the staff in the customers at the Barcelona Princess and to educate them in their knowledge of Barcelona. Also, this is the 21st century and only having wifi in the rooms if you have a cable is not acceptable for a business hotel! Go there if you already know a lot about Barcelona and will not have any requirements of the staff, or be prepared to ask very specific questions and wait in line

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Princess: Best view, best staff...”
Reviews.Author: angobango
Reviews.Content: From the 22nd floor of the Barcelona Princess, the view southward is spectacular: a wide, tree-lined boulevard; the Gaudi spires; surrounding hills and mountains, and even ocean. And at night, it's even better...like a carpet of twinkling lights rolled out in front of you. We love this hotel and have stayed there twice. We enjoy the cool, crisp, modern feel of the room and bathroom, and the vast panorama that plays out from the huge window. And we especially appreciate the staff that is always courteous, helpful and friendly even when little things (air-conditioning issues) go wrong. The location is not ideal for everyone -- for us, it is, though. A short metro-ride from Barcelona's heart, the hotel is positioned right next to a high-end mall that features some outstanding restaurants, coffee houses, and even an Iberico ham store that sells authentic, whole hams for 'take-out' or for shipment. This is a terrific place to which to return after a long day of touring Barcelona...the perfect spot to sit on the window seat with a glass of cava and take in Barcelona at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - good location near beach/shopping centre”
Reviews.Author: loveditUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of friends for our 40th Birthdays. Hotel well located for the beach - 5 mins walk - a 10 min tram ride into city centre. Tram stop nearby. Hotel staff not overly friendly, but not rude - just do their job! City open top bus tour leaves from just outside. Good hotel - used as a base - well placed next to huge shopping centre which includes lots of places to eat/starbucks/ etc etc. We didnt eat breakfast at the hotel but found a good place (coeliac friendly!) in the shopping centre next door. All round a good place to stay. Beware Barcelona pickpockets - it really is rife! x

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for beach and sea”
Reviews.Author: hazinheira
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelona Princess Hotel in the beginning of June for 3 nights. It is located by the Forum neighborhood, very to close to the beaches. However, it takes around 30 mins. by metro to get to the city centre. Rooms are modern and spacious with daily distribution of amenities. The mini-bar is free and restocked daily. There is a business centre with free access to the internet. Breakfast is varied and high-quality. We were definitely impressed by the quality of the breakfast! On the negative side, the hotel was understaffed during our stay and we often had to queue at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel not in the center but close”
Reviews.Author: kobi f
Reviews.Content: great hotel' we asked for high floor and got it almost on the roof, breakfast great, and the metro is not far away, room very clean' but the proble, was that we wanted to open the window and it was close, asked for it but they told me it must be close, i think that was the only trouble with this nice quiet hotel

Reviews.Title: “barcelona, what a beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: aurelian77
Reviews.Content: in this hotel, you feel like a princess or a prince! It is just lovely in every way! and Barcelona is just the perfect place to spend a holiday, or two, or more...yes, i want more of Barcelona. this town is wonderfull, you have everything: beaches, culture, nature, mountains nearby! i am in love with Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “OMG! FIVE STAR, DID NOT WANT TO LEAVE”
Reviews.Author: happy6_11
Reviews.Content: I looked about for months for the right hotel to go to in Barcelona and i definently chose the best, As a young couple we had never been to Barcelona, I like nice things as many do so we wanted a top hotel but not right in the busy centre so we chose the Princess. The hotel is located right next door to the massive shopping centre Diagonal Mar, which had great shops from Mango, Zara to Primark. We were so impressed with the hotel its very modern and contempory style was a winner with us. We got a high floor overlooking the sea which was sensational. The room is average size, very clean and modern with electric blinds, plasma and free mini bar. The bed was so comfortable and big and the black out blinds were a treat. The pool is on the 23rd floor overlooking the sea and amazing views to the city. The pool was a delight and heated so perfect after a day out walking about the town. The hotel also has a gym and sauna and another pool on the lower floor - very immpressive. The subway is only a few mins walk and takes you into the centre in about 10mins. We ate out most nights at the shopping centre which sounds crazy but the restaurants are amazing you can sit out in a lovely court or eat in. From chinese to spanish they have everything to choose from. The beach is only a ten min walk away and is really worth it with a lovely promenade, clean and trendy is what comes to mind. You can walk a further 30 mins to the marina where there is plenty of bars and restaurants to choose from. We really loved this hotel, it made our trip perfect and i would not let the distance from the centre put you off, we would DEFINENTLY go back. We give it a five star.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and have been twice”
Reviews.Author: Swizzle11
Reviews.Content: Just fantastic and glamourous. Apart from all the little things like the wall needed to be painted and the air con was a bit rubbish in our room it was very very good. Would go back again and again

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, fantastic view and easy access to city”
Reviews.Author: Rohanred
Reviews.Content: I went with my son for his 18th birthday.....and we were not disappointed. The receptionist was very helpful, suggested a city view and we were not disappointed...kept the blind open at night, no problem sleeping and we woke up to a fabulous view of the city in the morning. Breakfast is terrific...lots of choice.....and free mini bar in room. All the staff were really friendly. Spa and swimming pool were just what was needed to relax before hitting the city again for the evening...totally recommend this hotel. Two minutes from Metro...takes 30 mins to get to centre....Get a T10 ticket at any Metro station for 10 trips. Surrounding area also stylish.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money! I loved the room!!”
Reviews.Author: gaounette
Reviews.Content: I was in Barcelona for a 3-day business trip and was booked a room at the Barcelona Princess hotel for the first time. I got a room at the 23° floor, the same floor that the (small) pool. The room was spacious, extremely clean and comfortable, with a nice view on the city and "La Sagrada familia" in the distance. one of my colleague got a room with see view which was still more impressive. The staff was pleasant and helpful, and the situation a few steps away from the beach and the underground very convenient. I'd certainly stay again at the Barcelona Princess next time I'll stay in Barcelona, for personal or profesionnal reasons.

Reviews.Title: “The eye of the storm”
Reviews.Author: AudioSmear
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Last year, I had the trip from hell. Lost luggage, scandalous taxi rides, hiking with luggage through about 5 m through the BCN ghetto in the middle of the night, landlords who were 2 hours late letting us into our first apartment - you name it, if it was bad, it probably happened to us. After getting really sick of the lack of response from our landlords at the apartment we rented, I rented this place on the last day of our trip, sight unseen. When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. The establishment was much more than we expected. Albeit, being from Detroit my standards aren't sky high. I don't expect to get something for nothing, but I do expect a level of cleanliness, cordiality, functionality. When we arrived, we were greeted by a smiling clerk and bellhop, who kindly arranged taxi service to the airport for us the next day. The taxi was on time (which is impressive since almost everyone in Barcelona uses desai time)! After we made it to our room and tooled around with the gadgets like automatic shades, 0 depth shower, etc., we went to the mall attached to the hotel to get some souvenir stuff for friends and family. The the mall isn't usually my favorite place to go while I'm on holiday, but I can see how this would be very convenient for a traveler whose luggage has been routinely mishandled by BCN. The beds were comfortable, but I didn't get any sleep due to the stress load accumulation from the other parts of the trip. The pool is very nice, but a little small. I absolutely love that the sun deck faces the ocean. The room service is impeccable! The only downside is that this is on the northeast end of Barcelona, by the olympic port, so it is out of the way and cab rides are pricey -- like $60 USD for the airport. However, it is a nice change to be an outlier when relaxation is a priority because "downtown" (Ramblas, Barri Gotico, Barceloneta, Eixample, Placa Catalunya) is very, very loud. We are staying here again on our vacation in 3 weeks, and I can't wait. We are also staying a few days at the Hotel Silken Diagonal and the Hesperia Tower for the night before our departure. I hope they can hold a candle to the Princess!!!

Reviews.Title: “Swimming on the 23rd floor is AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bagpuss1971
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! This hotel was stunning, the staff were helpful and efficient, and it was a pleasure to stay there. Mum and I requested a city view which was amazing. It was deceptive though as the sights look a lot closer than they actually are! The metro is clean and efficient (london could learn a lot!) and is also accessable for those less able as there are lifts at every station and no step into the trains. The trams are good but i wouldnt want to go to some areas after dark as they looked a bit rough. These were well away from the main city though. If you are travelling independantly it is worth investing in a day ticket as this covers bus, tram, metro and train out to the airport too. If it is your first visit to Barcelona i would recommend the tour bus which you can join from outside the hotel. It has 3 route covering most of the important sights. Stopping at the MNAC building is a must as is a visit to the Olympic Stadium. The la Sagrada Familia is also a must. Although it can feel crowded with tour groups, the architecture is amazing. There is also a museum underneath that is worth a visit too. Although the food in the hotel may seem a bit expensive, i can recommend the salmon sandwiches from the corner bar! They are well worth the money. Breakfast is on a buffet style and is always well stocked no matter what time you arrive down. The swimming pool on the 3rd floor is really only suitable for lounging in. The one on the 23rd floor is much better although you can spend so much time looking at the view out to sea you may not actually get any swimming done!!! It was lovely and warm at 8am when i went in it though it was a bit windy out. All in all this hotel is the best i have ever stayed in and i would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant business class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raynetopham
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed here over the royal wedding bank holiday ... we just had to get out of London. The hotel has a great location situated at the beach end of the Avenue Diagonal in the Forum area, with a large shopping mall next door and with the Barcelona Bus Touristica green route stopping just outside, which is incredibly handy. We stayed on the 23rd floor which has the infinity pool and amazing views over the city and the Sagrada Famillia... Just wonderful. The rooms are standard business, but with an edge of luxury. The bar staff in the hotel's Corner Bar made the trip for us, where every morning ( over excellent coffee) they would recommend sites to visit and the best way of getting there and in the afternoon over an Estrella Damm they would recommend great places to eat and drink. A cab from the airport to the hotel is about 30euros and it is about 10euros for a cab to Las Ramblas. The nearest metro is a 3 minute walk away. Great place and cant recommend highly enough for travellers who need a practical , efficient and comfortable base from which to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel - if a little remote”
Reviews.Author: VipVad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic if all you are looking for is a relaxing time. My girlfreind and I stayed here for our first visit to Barcelona. Just across the road there was a huge local festival with all sorts of local dances (samba, flamenco etc) and people of all ages participating. Also there was a massive funfair, and from our hotel room (23rd floor) we had a great view of the fair rides and ferris wheel lit up against the backdrop of the ocean. Rooms are large, clean, well replenished. There is a minibar which is restocked everyday with a beer, water and coke-cola. The shower is brilliant, very powerfull with little spraying nozzles...and big enough for two! The bed was large and comfortable. The room is well airconditioned, there is no opening windows in the room at all, but the temp can be controlled. There is a huge shopping mall next door where you can get all your shopping done. There is a shop opposite the road which sells cigarettes very cheap (including english brands). There is a lovely cafe which makes a mean egg on toast (cooked very well). If you are not bothered to wake up early for the hotel breakfast then this is the place to go... and its cheap! Downside of this hotel is that it is a little bit far from the city centre.... definatly a cab ride... although the locals will tell you its walking distance...it isnt! Cab from the airport cost €30 but on the way back cost €36... all on meters so cannot argue the cost. Cab to city cost about €15. Cab to Sagrada Familia cost €15. Cab to Icaria Beach cost €12. Cash machine in hotel gives a good exchange rate from £'s to €'s. Outdoor pool on 23rd floor was nice, but was a little cold weather for us to make use of it...

Reviews.Title: “Make the Princess urban concept your life style!”
Reviews.Author: Tambriko
Reviews.Content: A great, innovative hotel located in Barcelona’s new business district. Everything you see as you enter the room is suitably arranged. You move around comfortably among furnishings warmly designed in gentle tones. The bathroom is also cozy. My partner and I really enoyed our stay here, the staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: emmylou302
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic for us and exactly what we were looking for. Our room and the hotel facilities were really clean and modern. Rooms had blackout blinds, flat screen TV, free mini bar and amazing views. My only gripe would be the pool area on floor 3. There are two different sunbathing decks, the one open during our stay of floor 3 had limited room and the sun went behind the buildings from 2pm onwards. There was another larger area though on floor 23 I think it was, however this closed at the time of our visit. That said, the beach is literally a 5 minute walk away and well worth the visit! The metro station is again only a few minutes walk away and is so easy to use. It's a colour and number based system and station names, where to change and the lines are really simple and very tourist friendly. Even I could use it!! Barcelona is an amazing place with so much to see and do, everything is very easy to find and the hotel is just far enough away from the hustle and bustle to relax at the end of the day. The staff are lovely and more than happy to help. I would certainly recommend this hotel and even location to friends and family and if I visit the city again I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “interesting architecture and lovely views!”
Reviews.Author: hayleyrose93
Reviews.Content: I went with my mother, and we were idiots abroad, i found some of the reviews really unhelpful as everything is alot closer than some people made out. Hotel is fantastic, the way it is designed is great, friendly staff, and lovely cocktails! Rooms were well designed. We were on the 21st floor over looking the city it was lovely at night. Shower was great, helped my aching shoulder alot. The metro called El Maremse Forum, is just around the corner from the hotel and costs just under 3 euros for a return, which can take you to Jaume 1 which is in the centre of barcelona, and takes just 5-10 minutes. Much cheaper then a taxi or the tour bus. Dont be afraid or put off by the metro! We were at first but found it so easy and convenient. We didnt feel like eating out in the city centre every night so we walked to the Diagonal Mar Shopping Centre which had some great resteraunts indoors and out and great shops including Sephora which is like a very mini Selfridges. The beach is also a very short walk away from the hotel around 5-10 minutes. Overall we had a fantastic stay and would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable weekend away.”
Reviews.Author: Keanybeany
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelona Princess for three nights (fri - sun). The rooms were clean and well equipped- we even had a free mini bar which was refilled every day (even though it wasnt part of our booking). Wifi was rubbish though, we never really got a great connection. The breakfast buffet was good with a large selection, but you had to get your coffee from a vending machine . Would have been expensive though, if it wasn't part of your deal. Location was great, very close to a metro which we used constantly (both day and night). Other areas would have been nicer but so would have been the price! Booking in and out was easy we arrived early and our room was ready, but it was clear they had somewhere to keep your luggage for you if this was not the case. Overall a great weekend and we would go back again (if i got a good deal!).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with great facilities in a good location”
Reviews.Author: GKH2011
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the hotel, definate 4 star. Beautiful sea view room which was also very comtempory and modern. Although the hotel was a bit far from the airport, the metro is on the hotels doorstep so very easy to get round. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel but some niggles and away from the city centre.”
Reviews.Author: M_Didius
Reviews.Content: Standard room smart but not luxurious. Reasonable size although a lot of the space occupied by the double bed. Only one (upright) chair provided. Bathroom acts as lobby to the bedroom with window between that can be covered with an electrically powered blind. Small, frosted glass stalls for the toilet and shower open off this bathroom/lobby. Shower very fancy but difficult to turn on without getting soaked with cold water or soaking the bathroom floor. Disposable razor, toothbrush, and slippers provided with the normal shampoo, body-wash, and soap. Air conditioning seemed to work but it was not that warm outside so no real test. Everything very clean and fresh. Flat screen TV was mounted too high on wall so not comfortable to watch from the bed. No English language channels at all that I could find (not even CNN or Eurosport!) and no instructions provided so not sure. Wired internet connection available (Ethernet cable available from Reception) that worked immediately but then just stopped. Again no instructions available and no IT support available overnight. There is a business centre with internet connected PCs and printers to use next to Reception. A free mini-bar was provided with a bottle each of sparkling water, still water, coke, lemonade, and beer. The cold water was very welcome during the night but the absence of tea/coffee making facilities was a shame. Excellent view along Diagonal to the Sagrada Familia and on across Barcelona from the 17th floor. Only stayed a night so did not use the pool or spa (the small pool on the 23rd floor has stunning views out to sea). Location at the end of Diagonal is some distance from the centre but close to tram and metro stops. Very close to Diagonal Mar shopping mall, the convention centre, and Forum plus the new offices blocks and businesses in the area. Not really a tourist area although the sea is close by. There are a range of restaurants in the Diagonal Mar shopping centre that stay open through the evening. Reception staff spoke good English and were helpful in sorting out problem with our booking. Very good value for the room as we got a 30% discount with a further discount on the day. The breakfast was excellent with a wide range of food – cold meats, little Spanish sausages, bacon, scrambled egg, cereals, pastries, rolls and toast etc, etc, - but would work out expensive if all you wanted was a coffee and croissant! Overall good value for an overnight stay on business but might not be ideal for a longer holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaraM07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It's not in the city center or downtown, but its near of lots os transports, including a metropolitan station, and you can easily get there. The rooms have a lot of space, are clean and have beautiful panoramic windows (mine was over the mediterranian sea). The elevator is also panoramic and you can have a lovely sight of the city if you go to the 26th floor (our room was there). We only took breakfast at the hotel, and it was really good, it had a lots of options, since the traditional coffee and bread, juice, fruits, cereals, to the eggs, bacon and beans.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent services”
Reviews.Author: kliakos
Reviews.Content: I stayed four days in princess Barcelona hotel and i have only nice memories from my accommodation in there. We 've been given exactly what requested ( room on top floor, view on the sea). The room was very clean, comfortable with free mini bar and very nice view to the sea. The view from the elevators was also amazing as you could observe from the 25th floor Barcelona's landscape. The hotel has all facilities both for business & leisure varying from business meetings to SPA facilities, bar & restaurant( quite small but there was such a good treatment that you ignore it) . Personnel was very kind at all times to provide any information requested. Personnel could speak fluently english , so communication was very simple. The location of the Hotel is not in the city center ( deliberately selected), so this guarantees a very nice sleep, & is very modern. , Metro station is only 50-70 m away and you can find yourself in the city center in less than 15 minutes. not many things around the hotel exist but as said metro station is so close that you can be in the desired location very fast.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable hotel although far from the center”
Reviews.Author: diam0nd_traveller
Reviews.Content: Reasonable hotel although a bit far from the center. 2 tips, don't order an airport pickup, which is 3x the cost of a taxi and don't purchase breaskfast there, as you can find breakfast cheaper elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience during check-out”
Reviews.Author: Johann02
Reviews.Content: I had a very unpleasant experience with one of the ladies (Romana?) at reception when I checked out on Sunday the 20th of February at approximately 11:45. This bad experience made me feel very unhappy and left me with a very poor perception of the hotel. When I checked in at the Hotel on Sunday the 13th of February I informed them that my wife will not be staying there for Tuesday and Wednesday as she will be visiting her brother in Belgium. The lady at the desk said sure they will adjust the invoice accordingly. When I checked out on Sunday morning however, I was greeted by a very obnoxious person at the front desk that swiped my card while I was still checking my invoice and asking questions on some of the items. I had to request her to listen to me as she was pre-occupied doing other stuff. She then replied on my query regarding the two nights stay that it was booked through Huawei and she could not make any adjustments. The objective of this email is to make you aware of this lady’s poor customer relations.

Reviews.Title: “Truly helpfull & great value for money”
Reviews.Author: LeenLi
Reviews.Content: Due to some unexpected changes, I walked into the hotel in search of a room. Though there was a huge congress ongoing in the city (and thus high occupation rate in all the hotels), the staff was extremely helpfull to accomodate me. I appreciated that they did not misuse the situation: I was offered a well equiped room offering excellent value for money. The next morning I enjoyed a swim in the heated pool (at the right temperature which is not always the case in wintertime). If you're looking for great value for money, this is the place to go to! PS. Have often stayed at 5*hotels less comfortable & stylish than this 4* hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff & nice and clean but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: shazz20
Reviews.Content: So the hotel swung my decision to stay here information on its SPA facilities. do not make this mistake, as you may not even use it. I took one look at the 'jaccuzi' and walked away very upset... its a tiny pool with luke warm water, outside on a balcony in the wind.. the 2 swimming pools also had luke warm water and were quite small. I did change my mind about them however, and did later go back to take a dip in the pool. they are ok, but do not make this the deciding factor 4 ure holiday. Sauna was very nice, but small also. Anyway, staff were very friendly, and helful and spoke english.. room was nice and clean, but not as spectaculat as I thought it would have been.. a simple double bed, clean sheets and a nice city view (24th floor)... electrical window blinds and curtains which were quite cool.....shower was amazing though, with very powerful hot water, and massage effects.. the room was clean with a lcd samsung tv ( i brought my HDMI cable just incase and this worked fine so could cnnect my laptop and watch my films on the tv) free mimibar and safe, with a bottle of beer, coke, water and lemon juice for free in the minibar... everything in the room was fine, except the toilet started to smell the 2nd day of sewege.. not nice, but could only smell it inthe toilet..I tried to connect my internet via wireless, but no signal, so simply called reception and they asked me to come down and get the internet cable, and this worked straight away no problem- and was free... Breakfast buffet was $19.99 pp very extorinate, considering i didnt eat too much of it.. a variety of juices, runny scramblled egg, very nice potent saussages, pizza typed things, yougart, fresh fruit, yougart, bacon/ham slices, fresh bread... that was the most of it.. it may have suited the tastes of others, but not my self, and it is probably best to eat somewhere else and to get more for you £ also , definetly.... The hotel is not far away from the city (Cantaluyna* / las Ramblas at all).. its about 6 stops, and then one change for one more stop and ur there.. takes about 20/25 mins on the metro, and the metro stop is right accross the road from the hotel which is fab - about 30 seconds walk..so nice if you dont want to stay in the city, but i would definetly prefer to next time. especially as there nothing close to the hotel at all, just a few tiny cafes.. there is a mall right next door though, with Zara and primark etc in there.. but i dont figure you would go in there as it is not a 'spanisy tourist place' more like a standard London / americian shopping mall. The tram also stops right outside, and the beach is supposed to be nearby but we didnt go as we didnt really have time, and it was a bit windy.. We got to the hotel from Barcelona airport by getting a transfer bus from terminal 1 to terminal 2 where we could get a train , which would then take us to a metror stopp, and we then got the metro to the hotel station stop.. station workers will tell you what stops etc to get off at etc, and definetly most of them spoke good english so it was simple to get around.. that journey to the hotel took about 2 hrs almost!! very long.. but on the way back we decided to take the Aero * bus which leaves La Ramblas and goes strait to terminal 1 for only $5.05 very quick, taking about 25-30 mins.. definetly should have done that on the way there - simply then taking the metro form la ramblas to / from the hotel. Over all, hotel was fine, but more like 3* to me, clean and a very nice building though. Would definetly stay in las ramblas next time though, but bare in mind that I am 22 years old, and my boyfriend is 26...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - okay service”
Reviews.Author: eviepie-10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean with a big room and bed. The area is new and still being constructed. The ocean is very close but does not have a bathing beach but a beautiful marina. We battled with the aircon, the air was very hot and dry. We did not eat at the hotel so cant comment on the food. We put a sign on the door saying to clean the room both mornings and they only cleaned it the first morning and not the second. The staff are quite friendly and most speak English. The area is new and feels safe and clean but you need to catch a tram to get to the main part of Barcelona. Cost about 35 euros for a taxi to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Princess”
Reviews.Author: CScharer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, but the internet connection was horrible because I think they had one server for the entire hotel. I was able to read about 3 - 5 e-mails the first day or two and then could not connect at all.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, modern rooms with retro wood paneling, and great Mediterranean water views”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlPunk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Princess Barcelona mid week. They kindly accommodated my request for a room on high floor with sea views. The building is split into 2 towers, one with 26 floors, the other with 23 floors and a rooftop pool. Some rooms face suburbs, some old Barcelona, some the sea. Only three glass elevators serve all those rooms, so give yourself an extra 5 minutes to check out. The hotel is about 6 metro stops away from the center, (for example, Las Ramblas or the 13th century gothic cathedral). I would have preferred to stay in the Gothic Quarter to skip the Metro altogether, but this hotel is only one block away from bus stops and the yellow Metro Line 4 @ Forum stop. There are a few suburban restaurants and bars directly across the street, if you'd rather pay one euro for your coffee instead of 3 at the hotel lobby/ bar. Hotel is next to a shopping mall. Also directly in front of the hotel is the Tram which you can board with your Metro card. I stayed on the 24th floor, and was very pleased with the relaxing sea view. Window practically runs floor to ceiling, but you cannot open the window. We called the front desk to get it opened a crack, but they shut it the next day. The window shades were run down, but the bed was the most comfortable I experienced during my two weeks in Spain. I had to be vigilant that my door to the hall shut properly. We couldn't get the t.v. to work but didn't really care. My companion was quite irritated that we could not get the Wi-Fi to work anywhere - yes we did complain twice to no avail. There are two computers behind the front desk, on the second floor of the lobby, and they're often occupied. The shower stall has a fancy shower head that blasts so much water I nearly flooded the bathroom. Of course if the water had drained more quickly there wouldn't have been a flood... There was only one towel / bathrobe hook. No bath tub. They supplied most toiletries, but you'll have to bring your own hair conditioner and wash cloth. There's a mirror near the sink, and the closet door is a full length mirror. There is a small desk and one chair near the window. There are about half a dozen light switches. Two switches to control window blind and shade, and one to control the bathroom shade that covers the glass wall separating the bath area from the bedroom. There is a wonderful free mini bar with Cokes, waters, one juice and an Estrella beer bottle, refilled daily; such a treat. Bottle opener included. The staff at the front desk was always quick to approach when we walked up to it. We were able to check in half an hour early, get transportation info, a map, and get a loaner plug adapter easily. I did not try the gym. Water at rooftop pool seemed lukewarm, but at times one could see steam rising from it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bit far from city center”
Reviews.Author: IrelandHappytravels
Reviews.Content: Lovely, modern hotel. Really nice room and views. Room was v. clean and modern in style. Great shower. Hotel staff very helpful. Room service generally inexpensive and tasty. Only drawback is the location which is approx 10-15 euro taxi ride to city center. Possible to take a tram too which is outside the door, but we never figured it out. Great shopping center close to hotel. We got a good deal on the hotel. Nice place to stay, but not at the center of the action. If you are okay with this, then the hotel is good. If you want to walk out onto the action of Barcelona, then maybe not so good. But overall a luxury hotel..lovely. Good spa as well.

Reviews.Title: “It's worth we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Maybe68
Reviews.Content: My friends and me we are used to read reviews before choosing city and hotel it is very interesting . We liked the location not downtown but next to the sea and a mall very near several options for a a light meal, only two minutes from a subway yellow line and tram and busses plus tourist bus just next door. Nice rooms Excellent views good breakfast no irons but laundry service Thanks all staff for your kindness we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Staying in Barcelona - some tips to share”
Reviews.Author: sokomax
Reviews.Content: Earlier this month I was in Barcelona, Spain for business event and was staying in Princess hotel. Overall I would rate that stay as solid 4 (on a 1-5 scale with 5 being the best) - the staff is friendly, nicely decorated/designed rooms are clean, spacious enough, breakfast was very good - lots of choices and fresh stuff but there are a couple of things that caught me by surprise (at least I wouldn't have expected them from such relatively expensive place): 1) there are no irons in the hotel WHATSOEVER! So imagine yourself arriving in the afternoon and trying to get ready for business meetings tomorrow. Now you can forget about searching the room for hidden places where iron with ironing board are stored or calling to front desk to get those gears to you. The only choice is to get express laundry service (to get a couple of shirts pressed) which will cost you 50% over already expensive service (e.g. next day service to press shirts was ca.7 EUR a piece). So the advice is - either get ready for huge laundry bill or have your portable iron with you when you come to Barcelona :). 2) Don't expect that if you request something at the front desk over the phone, you'll get that immediately. It took me about 3 call to front desk and 6 hours for handyman to show up and unlock the safe box which was locked when I checked in. I frankly hope that this just the case with that particular hotel shift in that particular hotel on that particular day, but just in case, have your level of expectations set properly and be prepared to follow up. 3) The number of elevators is not enough to service all guests of that multi-store building - whenever you call the elevator, it can take anywhere from 3 to 5 minutes until car arrives. So slow down your pace there as well and account for 5-7 minutes just to get to the lobby from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Dijon39
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in June, great place the rooms are just amazing great towels . We had a room on the 16 floor I think, we could see the sea and all Barcelona, would definately go back if I found some good deals online!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Modern, Clean, Great Service, Loved it :-)”
Reviews.Author: Joannelouise55
Reviews.Content: My partner surprised me with a trip to Barcelona to propose to me and he chose this hotel. It was fantastic, the rooms were modern and unusual with a glass wall between the sleeping area and bathroom. The view was amazing from our room and the service was great. We had breakfast included which was really good with lots of choice. The location was perfect, we were near to a metro stop which linked us to everywhere in the city. The staff helped my partner to book a beautiful restaurant on the night he proposed which overlooked the city. The pool on the roof is lovely too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to discover the city”
Reviews.Author: travellerch63
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in this hotel. It has 16 floors and is very easy to reach from public transport. The hotel offers desinger rooms - eventhough the situation of the shower is a bit strange. Right next to the hotel is one of the biggest shopping malls with good restaurants. So I really recommend this hotel as a base for excursions - and if you want to do some shopping - it is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE>>>>>NOT SAFE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jojoc70Ontario
Reviews.Content: Returned from a trip for my 40th birthday, our laptop was stolen from our room, and the only occupant were houskeeping and maintenance and ourselves! The manager was arrogant, rude and disrespectful to women. He could care less about our loss, and I think that says a lot about customer service!!!!! After reporting the theft someone went through our room and belongings and left our safe open, which we know was 110% locked due to the recent theft. The manager denied doing this, like it would be far-fetched to assume they have a master to open the safe. The hotel is mediocre at best...uncomfortable beds, and I agree with previous reviews of sewage dripping on your head in bathroom! If you like being treated like crap, enjoy water all over the bathroom floor, sewage dripping on your head, a manager that doesn't give a crap(probably got a cut from the laptop!), and terrible customer service in general then you should stay here!!!! Seriuosly do not stay here and if you do take all of your valuables with you at all times!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: karenacheryl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just across the road from metro and right next to a large shopping mall and 2 minute walk from the beach. The hotel has a small gym and pool on the roof but beware the lift is a glass one so if you don't like heights, ask for a low floor when booking. If you like to run/jog, make sure you take your trainers as everyone loves to exercise next to the beach. There are great beach bars if you want to stop off for an afternoon cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing, uncomfortable and exaggerated description.”
Reviews.Author: Bally67
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend break and read the reviews and remained open minded. We have never written reviews, as generally have not felt the need to. My husband and I both work really hard and booked the trip as a treat to us both. First appearance, the hotel appeared cheap and tacky. The welcome from the front desk was very factual. Yes there is welcome drinks offered, this is done by a receptionist giving a voucher and pointing in the direction of the bar! Again, the lift is pointed out and that is your welcome. Our room was basic for a superior room, it was on the 15th floor, which overlooked a fair ground, which we had to listen to until 4am everynight. The double bed is made up of 2 single beds put together., The toilet door, had a mental strip hanging off it, which screeched everytime the door was opened or closed. The shower from the room above us, poured into ours, everytime the people above us used it. This we reported the first evening. It was still leaking when we left 2 days later. The pools are a let down and very well marketed and the spa, is really not worth promoted. We can't review the breakfast etc, as we did not feel we wanted to spend much time there. Who ever designed the website etc, has really done a fantastic job! Sadly, we would never recommend this hotel, we booked this hotel for a relaxing spa break., which we did not find.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, lazy, and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: WilliamShakespeare1
Reviews.Content: If the front desk has trouble finding you, they will disconnect calls. They lose faxes. They are rude to guests and people calling in to speak with you. Nice facility, but lousy service from the front desk. They lack very basic courtesies.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona business trip”
Reviews.Author: haperappe
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and neat but the breakfast is rather standard. Especially the coffee machines could be improved. The view from elevator and partically rooms is spectacular. There is even some sort of sky walk between the two buildings that is als quite interesting. The hotel is very close to the conference center. WLAN is only usable in the lobby area but the LAN in the rooms was quite fast.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great room, delicious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: smilingsar
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to this hotel for a five day relaxation and sightseeing break, having found a great deal. We couldnt have been happier! On arrival you get a welcome drink- cava- which you can enjoy in the trendy corner bar at your own convenience. Our VERY comfortable room (with a huge double bed and tv with english channels such as e4 and bbc) was cleaned regularly, and had a view of the seafront. it also had air conditioning, and electric blinds(great for blacking out the sun if you are in need of a lye in), along with the most most powerful shower full of jets! It also had free minibar with water, coke, lemonade and beer- very refreshing after a hot day sightseeing, brilliant. We forgot our adaptor, which was no problem as the very helpful reception staff had one for us to borrow which we did for the duration of the stay. The metro is very close, and so is a very convenient 24hr shop, a shopping mall, and a selection of restaurants. The hotel also has a main restaurant-which we didnt visit- but we did visit the rooftop bar to enjoy drinks and tapas whilst overlooking the sea view, which was very enjoyable. We visited the beach a few times on the metro which was very clean, and a great way to relax after seeing all the sights. The lift has a glass wall, which is beautiful too look out at the skyline.. although you do often have to wait a few minutes for the lift to arrive. We made full use of the sauna and jacuzzi/hot tub, but the pool was a little too cold. The breakfast was absolutely amazing... coffees, fruit juices cheeses, fruit, bread, pastries, spanish omelettes, hams, and even pizza and grilled veg! a very wide selection! We checked out at 12, and our plane was not until 8pm, but the hotel let us safely store our luggage all day until we left. Overall we loved this hotel and loved Barcelona. We would reccommend this hotel to anyone looking to balance a relaxing beach escape mixed with full days of sightseeing, and a GREAT hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location. Friendly Staff, Very good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: LarahEgypt
Reviews.Content: As our first time in Barcelona, having booked this hotel via internet without checking out much about it I must say we were very pleased with our stay. The hotel has Very high standard in cleanliness. Small pool but just perfect for kids and for those who are lazy to take a walk down the beach just a few meters a way. My family and I will definitely go back to princess hotel. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay - architecture a bit cumbersome”
Reviews.Author: chocolat61
Reviews.Content: A bit out of the center, but with the good public transport still well reachable and near the big shopping mall "diagonal mar", this hotel has nice facilities (two swimming pools: one for laps, one for refreshing) and a very good breakfast buffet. The tables in the dining area don't really offer the privacy one would want, as a couple you most certainly sit close to another couple; generally the space seems to be an issue, also the rooms are not really very functional spacewise, however nicely done. For joggers and swimmers the beach is near and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more pleased!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoKyria
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this hotel is fab. If all you want is an HONEST review (bear in mind that I am a little fussy & do not like dirt/bad locations/bad service etc) - here it is: Went with my boyfriend for 6 nights for a little getaway. On arrival the hotel was in a great location, right next to a big shopping centre & metro & bus literally over the road. Staff were professional & check-in was efficient, answered all our questions. The room was brilliant with a quirky design & electric blinds etc, quite a dark finish but fine because of the huge window that lets in so much light. Please note that the shower is a little crazy & some water does seep through the bottom of the door, but it's actually really fun!The bathroom is visible from the bedroom through a glass divide but the toilet and shower each have a door & you can lower a blackout blind so no one can see (if you're prudish). The view from the lifts of the hotel are actually breath-taking, you can see the Sagrada Familia & Mount Tibidabo etc! The free minibar is also a great added extra, who cares if there is not much selection - it's free!!! Some tips - take advantage of the shopping centre next door (sometimes we actually went to the supermarket in there to bag a very cheap baguette for lunch - 1Euro 60cents each). Buy a T-10 travelcard from the metro which you can use on bus/train/tram/metro throughout zone 1 (which is all you really need). The metro is so quick into the city centre and is not jam packed like the Underground!!! Also if you choose to go on a Tour bus, check out the Red unofficial ones which have a 'green route' which actually stops right near the Princess hotel, it's about 30 Euros for a 2-day ticket which is hop on, hop off as many times as you like when the bus is running. Don't bother getting a taxi from the airport, get the aerobus (5Euro each) and then get the metro from Passeig de Gracia to El Maresme Forum (right near the hotel) with your T-10 ticket. My ONLY criticism is probably the pools, the one on the 3rd floor is overcast by the building and did not look that well maintained as did th jacuzzi (I didn't swim in either) and the pool up on the 23rd? floor is very pretty but very very small so get out there early if you want a sunbed. However I did not go to Barcelona to sunbathe or swim, there's SO much more to do, and there's always the beach if you want to lie down all day! That is my HONEST opinion of this hotel, PLEASE trust me, and all the other positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: C0rinne22
Reviews.Content: We started our trip to Barcelona at a different hotel- Gran Hotel Torre Cataluna for one night, as we could only get 5 nights at The Princess hotel. We tend to be pretty easy to please but were initially disappointed by the first hotel because of it's location and lack of out door pool. We were glad we weren't staying there the whole time and were looking forward to getting to the next one....now we wish we had stayed there! The location of The Hotel Princess was good, we were close to the nice beaches, shops and metro. There were lots of nice restaurants and bars about half an hour walk along the beach or a short ride on the Metro which is easy to use and pretty much right outside the hotel. The first hotel had been more within the city centre apparently, but the surroundings weren't very nice to look at. When reaching Hotel Princess the check in was fine, very efficient. We were on floor 11 which is not what had originally been quoted to us on our booking (we should have had 20th floor), when questioning this we were told the hotel was fully booked. The room itself was fine but lacked a personal touch. It was quite small and pokey, very dark and the window wouldn't open. We were told the window had to remain locked for security reasons i.e so no one fell out or got in and robbed the place. We thought this was a bit ridiculous...yes the hotel is obviously very high but I have been to loads of high hotels that have balconies, or at least windows you can open a few inches!! We liked the free mini bar however you don't get much (which to be honest we expected with it being free) and also everything is obviously put in there cold, but warms up through the day as it the fridge itself isn't cold! They put some ice in there but by the time the evening came and we came to use is it, it was dirty water. There were no nice touches like tea and coffee making facilities or an iron and ironing board, or bath robes, which you tend to expect in most decent hotels. We had all of these at the first hotel which was the same price....I don't think it's much to ask when you've paid this amount of money! The main disappointment was the non existent spa area. Our first hotel, to it's credit had a lovely spa, really relaxing. The hotel Princess had two very, very small cold pools. We knew they were going to be small from the photos, but the photos actually make them look bigger than they are, in reality they are tiny. There are only about 5 sunbeds, however the view is nice from the one on the 23rd floor.... The jacuzzi was nothing more than a hot tub shoved in the corner and it was disgusting, so dirty. We were really disappointed by this as we came for a relaxing break. Over all I wouldn't recommend this hotel as you can probably tell....it is a business hotel at the end of the day and nothing more. It's fine for someone on a business trip who needs a half decent, clean room. From this review I probably sound like moaning old woman, but me and my boyfriend never complain, we are usually happy with a few simple, personal touches. I read bad reviews about this hotel but ignored them as they were few and far between, i thought people were just being petty and pedantic but I'm sorry to say they were right.....

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: roxy12345
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned home from staying at this hotel. We were very impressed with the hotel, check-in was efficient and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. We asked to have a room next to each other and they happily obliged. Rooms were nice and clean, the bathroom was modern and spotless, nice touches of free bath goodies, and a free mini bar. The power shower was amazing. However we did not have one in our room so we used the one next door as we booked 2 rooms. Now the negatives, location was not the best, however if you don't mind public transport then staying here won't be a problem. We arrived at the airport and didn't book a transfer to the hotel so just a warning, do not ask how much it is to the destination as we made that mistake and were stung with a 40 euro fare which we stupidly accepted. taxi to hotel should be around 25-30 euro tops. Buffet breakfast was very expensive we paid around 19 euros each which in my opinion overpriced. the cooked food was not good, the egg was like powder egg, just avoid, but it is a must even if you do go once as the views and variety of food was good. There are 2 swimming pools in the hotel, one on the 3rd floor and one on the roof top, both were constantly busy as they were very small, there were not enough sunbeds so we ended up laying towels on the decked floors. Big fluffy towels were provided for use on the beds which was a nice touch. We didn't get a chance to use the rooftop swimming as it was crowded everytime we went to check. Gym area is small but adequate. There was 2 computer for use, but very slow and always occupied. The shopping mall next to the hotel is very convenient, there is a massive supermarket on the ground floor to stock up on drinks etc. There are loads of restaurants and fast food areas so you wouldnt have to go far for something to eat. Overall a very pleasant experience, would definitely recommend this hotel as we enjoyed our trip and would return here if we ever had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “a fijian in europe”
Reviews.Author: JasmineA3
Reviews.Content: the service and staff were very professional. i was impressed by the views and clean environment...definitely on my wish list of future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: hmiller99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend over the bank holiday period and had a fantastic time. The hotel is very quirky, with many original features. We bought the buffet breakfast whilst we were there, which was great value for money with a wide variety of choice. The rooms are spotless and very spacious. The only negative was staying on the 18th floor as my boyfriend is scared of heights. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from a gorgeous beach and only a tram ride away from Las Ramblas. We even managed to walk to the Nou Camp, which was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor, you and this hotel let us down!”
Reviews.Author: DrSchmincke
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews on Tripadvisor, we and other couples booked at Barcelona Princess Hotel July 14-16 2010. We were in Room 1812. We had stipulated when making the reservation that we were traveling with our daughter, and thus we expected a cot for the 3rd person. We confirmed our needs at check-in and were assured that they would be met. However to our initial amusement, the hotel provided a crib for our 14 year old. Amusement turned to frustration when the hotel manager indicated that there was not a cot in the hotel, nor a sofa, so she would need to share our bed in our 166 euro room for 3 nights. The manager pleasantly and politely insisted that any European hotel would assume that a "child" would fit into a crib, although this is not our experience in many many trips to Europe. The hotel is flashy but poorly built. We were not pleased with the public-washroom type toilet in our room, providing little privacy (since sounds were not muffled and the stall door would not completely shut). The pools are tiny. The food is good and most of the staff are very pleasant. It got worse. The first night, I thought that water was dripping on me in the bathroom, in my hair, on my face and clothes. To my disgust it was sewage from the room above, from the shower in the unit above us. We complained to the desk and they sent someone who opened the ceiling and stuffed white hotel towels into the ceiling space. The second night after midnight, our upstairs neighbor took another shower. Waste water poured into our bathroom again, so loud it woke us. The hotel sent a worker the next morning who spent a lot of time in our unit and the one above. Unfortunately he left the towels from the ceiling, soiled with dark brown debris, on our bathroom floor, and I had to push them aside to take a shower myself before my meeting. I did not feel clean! The staff did clean the bathroom thoroughly later. The third night - AGAIN the water pouring and dripping through the ceiling awakened us. Unfortunately there was also a large loud live concert in the nearby Forum after midnight until about 4AM, and these rooms have poor sound insulation, so we got little sleep. At checkout the next morning I lodged my 7th complaint with the front desk, but got little sympathy. Not recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern and close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: MelocoJacob
Reviews.Content: After searching for a while for a reasonably priced hotel i came across this one which looks great in the photos. However the roof-top swimming pools are very small and there is only sun on the sunbeds during the morning and after that the pool area becomes extremely windy. Just a few minutes walk to the beach which is lovely and clean and wasn't too crowded. Metro is also very convenient, again just a two minute walk away to go to the central part or Barcelona. The views from the hotel rooms are great. There's a nice big shopping centre adjacent to the hotel with a few good eating places. We booked the hotel on Thompson Holiday and got a reasonable price. There aren't any tea making facilities in the room, the room service was over €11 for two cups of tea so went and bought a kettle from the supermarket - truly British!! Overall was a convenient hotel which is close to the beach for a nice relaxing hotel and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service from arrival to departure”
Reviews.Author: Knobs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 5-9 July, from checking in to checking out this hotel was excellent. All the staff were extremely welcoming and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was very good with a wide selection of choices. Would recommend this hotel to any traveller who doesn't want to stay in the centre of the city with the metro station being a 5 minute walk away. Recommend an open bus tour around Barcelona which covers 3 different routes for one price, the bus stops right outside of the hotel. The hotel is also located next door to the Diagonal Mar Shopping Centre. Excellent beach is approx 10 minute walk away. Would recommend this hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Posh and modern”
Reviews.Author: John-family
Reviews.Content: This is one nice hotel with a train station near and bus stop near too. 40min walk to main barcelona. Resturant was costly though. We were lucky to have an awesome view

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayLover026
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Barcelona Princess for a long weekend last September, and loved every minute of it! The Hotel is lovely. Clean and modern and so close to the metro station and shops. We had the bed and breakfast option, which I reccommend booking, as I can remember the price of the breakfast was very expensive (people were coming then turning away due to it). The room I can safely say was the best hotel room I have ever stayed in to date. It was so modern, and the full body jet shower is very impressive! There is even electric blinds, operated by a button at the side of the bed, so you don't even have to move to open them in the morning! :) And the room had a free mini bar, stocked up daily which was an added bonus! The metro is easy to follow (easier than the London Underground even), so it doesn't matter that this hotel is just out of the main parts of the city as the sights are not hard to get to. I am a bit afraid of heights, if you are, make sure you keep your back to the back of the lift as I did (it is just glass!) The pools are pretty small, but on a city break, thats not really what we were there to do so it didn't matter to us. The 'spa' is not much of one, and we had to have someone come and put more water in the sauna, as the facillities there are pretty much left unattended, and also on the downside the jacuzzi was a very odd colour, and not warm at all! Wouldn't reccommend this part to anyone! But overall, a nice hotel which definatley contributed to a lovely time away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: DubaiDreamers
Reviews.Content: Just had a week at the Barcelona Princess whilst attending a conference at the CCIB (literally across the street). I am not sure where the previous reviewer stayed but the Barcelona Princess I stayed in was in a great location, it is adjacent to the Diagonal Mall (with many F&B outlets and a huge hypermarket), 5 mins walk to the metro station and for anyone who likes running there's a 5km circuit straight up the Avenida Diagonal which is perfect, wide, safe and great for people watching. My room on the 17th floor had a city view which I requested following the reviews on Trip Advisor, and it was fab, I could see right out across Barcelona and La Sagrada Familia. The breakfast was good & varied plenty of fresh fruit though I don't know the cost. The gym was small but adequate and always empty and their two pools were very nice.I liked the free mini bar, which was re-stocked every day and thought the shower was fab. I did have to order room service one night and this was pretty basic and expensive, I had a very lame ceasar salad for EUR17, so do not recommend this unless its the last resort. I would certainly recommend this hotel for those who want to be close enough to the city centre to see all the fantastic sights but who want a good and quiet nights sleep (my parents stayed on La Rambla and got no sleep at all). I would definitely return and this time take the family.

Reviews.Title: “not a nice hotel by the water”
Reviews.Author: jwilliams88
Reviews.Content: If you're hoping for a nice hotel by the water, this isn't it.. The room smells like mildew because the shower sprays water all over the bathroom and never dries. The air conditioner barely works even after they sent someone to fix it. The telephone in the room was dead so I wasn't able to call the front desk about my problems. However, they did respond quickly once I let them know there was an issue. The beds are on wheels so it's impossible to sit up in bed against the wall and watch TV. There's nothing to do anywhere near the hotel and if you stay out too late the Metro shuts down.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable... Few metro stations away from the center”
Reviews.Author: Mesmar
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and the decisive points in choising the hotel was that it got a pretty high rating here and on booking.com, a great price and next to a metro station. We were not disappointed. The hotel is pretty new, well furnished and extremely clean. Some rooms have a good view over the city or on the seaside. The hotel is also right next to the Diagonal Mar shopping centre which makes it a convenient way to get a cheaper breakfast than at the hotel or to do some shopping. Of course, this is more of a business hotel and one should not expect the experience to be too fancy or too personal, but if we have to go back to Barcelona and get the same price for the room, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: chop144
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. My wife and I stayed hereffor 3 nights and loved every minute of it. It is a little off the beaten path but it is very plush, modern and clean. The hotel is trendy with a rooftop pool that over looks the sea. Our room had a view of the Sagrada Familia. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Kaja_t
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was OK, but the hotel didn't meet our expectations at all, and I don't think they deserve the 4 stars they have.. When we arrived at the hotel, the staff were friendly welcoming us during checkin, but we didn't get any information at all. We'd booked a junior suite for our stay with a kingsize bed.
