When we got to the room, the total size of the room was good, but half the suite turned out to be a room we coudn't really use (just one bad coutch), so it was more like a normal sized hotelroom. The bed wasn't nearly as big as a kingsize bed, and neither the AC nor the fridge for the minibar worked at arrival (but both were repaired quite fast).. The TV in the room was very small, and they only had 3-4 channels that weren't spanich. We also had to ask for connection to the high-speed Internet, which were only available with a very short cable. The view was nice, but the room was very dark (unlike the other rooms), with black walls and ceiling - very different from what the pictures indicate. We were supposed to have 25 minutes of free massage for one person pr day with our room, but no information were given about this, and we had to argue with the hotel management the second day to get it - we only got two days with massage out of 4... The minibar was also rather lousy - they announce a free minibar, but all you get pr day is 1 beer, 1 CocaCola (200ml), 1 still water and 1 sparkling water (both also very small).. The breakfast were OK, but extremly boring with the same, small selection every day. The hotel restaurant where lousy, and the food was not of high quality.... The two swimmingpools at the hotel were OK, but small.. The cleanliness were good, but the last day we only got one bathrobe and one towel.... Also the hotel employees kept coming into our room several times pr day, wich were rather annoying. The location of the hotel was not to bad thoug, lying on top of a nice, rather modern mall, we had axcess to food and shopping within a short distance. The City guide buses also stopped right outside the hotel, and was a nice way to see the city. To get downtown, we took a taxi, not to expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel/Great Service”
Reviews.Author: littleoneleahmcb
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with Lastminute.com and cannot recommend this organsation highly enough as we were caught up in the volcanic ash mess & they sorted everything out with the Priness who kindly agreed to move the booking to alternative dates even though we booked on a non cancellation basis. I have just returned from Barcelona on the 24th after spending three nites in the Princess with my 3 sisters and can confirm that this is a beautiful hotel with lovely contemporary spotless rooms with all mod cons. The only small comment I could make is they need a mirror near an electric socket for us girls! The staff are extremely helpful & friendly & do an excellent job in this hotel with regards to customer service. The breakfast room was really lovely and the selection & presentation of food was a pleasure to come down to in the morning. The location of this hotel maybe an issue if this was your first time to Barcelona as you are out from the main tourist attractions but the metro station is in front of the hotel behind the red brick building and a 10 journey pass on costs you 8 euros and takes you to Passieg de Gracia for shopping, Las Ramblas for the experience & the Barceloneta for the port, marina & beaches. (L4 line) Although the hotel states that it is near the beaches at the moment there are ground works in progress so to acess the beach it is a good ten minute walk from the hotel. We all had a massage whilst we werethere and the bath robes & slippers provided were really useful for this. There are two pools the one on the 3rd floor is lovely but was in the shade most of the time whilst we were there. The one on the 23rd floor is small and made for swimming lenghts but it is in the sun most of the day. The bar makes fantastic cocktails & they are no dearer than anywhere else & a lovely way to end the evening. Beside the hotel is a really good shoppin centre with lots of shops to choose from. The food court is on the top floor but there are also restaurants on the roof of the building which can be accessed from inside the shoppin centre or via steps from the outside Top tips: At the Barceloneta try Zahara, a great little bar that serves lovely simple food at a great price with a great view and friendly staff. On Las Ramblas (facing the entrance to the food market) is a little bar that serves 3 tapas & a glass of sangaria at the bar for 4.90 euros. This is a real spanish experience with happy staff that wont break the bank. All & all we really enjoyed our stay at the Princess & I would book it again. Enjoy LOL

Reviews.Title: “This out of town hotel is not central and not worth the extra time it takes to reach it.”
Reviews.Author: mariposa-mo
Reviews.Content: We were put off this hotel the minute we arrived from the port, by lady receptionist (Marta) who very abruptly and coldly told us we could not enter our room until 3.30pm and then turned her back on us. Rest of reception staff were friendly and helpful. Room of good size but water from shower spilled out into bathroom area. Bad drain smell from sink. Didn't like the lack of privacy from bed area into bathroom area. Nice views from 23rd floor over sea and marina. Wouldn't go back and would find somewhere more central. Surrounding area under re-development and local shopping mall excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Princess Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crenguta
Reviews.Content: Nice view, good breakfast buffet, very nice staff. Good location, near the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel far from Barcelona centre”
Reviews.Author: lakes99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as Barcelona was busy and we could not find a hotel closer to the centre. The area is under development and a popular conference location but it is some distance from the centre so I could not recommend the location. The rooms were ok but the service from the front desk was fairly cold. Nice area to walk around during the day but limited options for quality dining. Distance from centre made this a poor choice for me and I would not use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and nice hotel, some areas in the need of improvement though”
Reviews.Author: SwedishExplorer
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very trendy a modern design and look and feel. The rooms have a design set up in where you basically enter and have the bathroom just where the hallway is and it's connected with the living room. I did personally not really appreciate this design as I would feel a distinction in between the living room and bathroom has its advantages, especially for reasons of privacy. I found the quality of the room good and the design as mentioned very modern and the room was spotlessly clean but what disturbed me was an awkward “body” odor in the room from previous guests that had stayed and left the smell behind I guess and I am sensitive to this. I have to call out that the whole experience of the room was negatively impacted by the uncomfortable odor. The hotel should start using odor neutralizers while cleaning for sure, it makes such a difference. The breakfast was very nice and basically offered all you could wish for and a lovely selection of the tasty Spanish sausages and ham, really something to look forward to every morning. The staff at the hotel (front Desk, Room Service and the Restaurant staff) were very, very professional and super friendly. This is for sure a plus! I loved the location in the area of the convention centers and just a few subway stops away from downtown. There is a huge shopping center just nearby with lots of dining and shopping options. I ordered room service one night and was a bit surprised I did not get any salt or pepper to accompany my meal, a little detail yet important I think. One thing that is just crazy and we all talked about this is they don’t offer iron and ironing boards for the guests to use. This I have never come across before and was negatively surprised by this. I had two shirts I had packed that needed to be ironed and the only way to do this was to pay them 8 Euros per shirt and wait for one day. Also, the hotel has a free minibar with some water, coke and a bear and that is very generous however they don’t offer coffee or tea facilitates and I have not in the last 15 years stayed at a 4 star hotel that did not offer this. That was surprising. The bathroom amenities were very nice and from the American company H2o+ that also caters to the Walt Disney team park hotels. So to summarize: Stay here if you like modern hotels with a good location although not downtown and with great and friendly staff, superb breakfasts and if you don’t bring clothes that need iron and don’t mind a slight odor in the hotel rooms :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but far from city center for tourism”
Reviews.Author: Chaymaa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel because we organized a conference just in the front building where the big conference center is. This is the big advantage out of it. it is a nice hotel, very big but a bit old wooden style. it is not a problem if you do not speak spanish, the receptionist speaks good English. The rooms were ok, but, somehow not comfortable specially if you will be staying with a colleague. the bathrooms are divided into 2 parts (shower and toilet) with a transparent glass wall. you can always drop down a black curtain, but still non comfortable. i have found the double rooms not so big, in contrary i have visited some other colleagues in single rooms with very big rooms. they have free internet which is very good and high speed. the only advantage of this hotel is the conference center and the shopping mall nearby. i have founded it very far from city center (almost 30 min with metro from placa catalonia to avenida diagonal) but it is near to Olympia, and the neighbourhood is very nice for a walk. Taxis are very eaasy arround, with 3 metro stations. also try the tram is very nice. if you are interested to stay in the area, i would recommend the Zero hotel, we have somem participants there, and we never had a complain.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Dazz83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barcelona Princess for 3 nights at the end of April and had an amazing time. I travelled by train and metro from the airport with had no problems at all and the whole trip taking about an hour. Check in was very quick and after reading reviews on the great views surrounding the hotel I had requested a room on the highest floor possible and was given a room on the top floor (26th floor). Luckily it was a room on the corner overlooking the pool on the 23rd floor so I had a view of both the sea and the city which was impressive enough during the day but at night was amazing! We were lucky enough to be there while a month long festival was taking place just across the road so at night we were treated to all the lights from the biggest mobile fair I have ever seen. The fair went on until the early hours of the morning each night but with the window closed you could not hear it and could get a great sleep on the very large and comfortable beds. The rooms were quite spacious and with the blind lifted on the all glass bathroom it definately made the room feel even bigger. The shower was very nice with 3 different spray settings, although every now and then the temperature could be a little unstable but nothing too alarming. The room has cable tv and I was very pleased to have some english speaking channels which were not just news channels (BBC1, Channel 4 and E4). The rooms also come with free Wi-Fi Internet access, but if you do not have your laptop there are two computers on the first floor where you can use the internet and printer for free. The hotel has two pools, one on the 3rd floor and one on the 23rd floor. The 3rd floor pool is the larger of the two but is quite shallow at only 0.85M deep and because the hotel towers above it after about 2.30-3pm it is covered in shade making it quite cold. The pool area on the 23rd floor is great with amazing views while you soak up the sun. Both pool areas were kept very clean and were always stocked with clean towels. There were about 5-6 sun beds in each area and with the hotel being quite quiet we never had a problem getting a seat however with 300+ rooms I could imagine it being pretty busy when the hotel is full. I read in some reviews that the location of the Barcelona Princess was quite isolated, and this is not totally incorrect. However I found the metro ride into town quite a nice experience, and the metro line which is just across the road from the hotel (Line 4) connects to a lot of the main areas of Barcelona such as La Ramblas and the Marina without any changes. One thing to note when travelling on the metro around Barcelona is that if you are changing from one line to another you can expect an epic walk so you should try and keep any line changes to a minimum. Overall I had a great time at the Princess hotel and it really made my first trip to Barcelona very special. I highly recommend it and hopefully will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “average hotell”
Reviews.Author: parton01
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very average, definately not the luxury you pay for. The jacuzzi was very dirty with what looked like tar all over the inside, the pools were very small and not heated. However the rooms were nice and clean, with great views from the hotel. Service was okay but not excellent. The gym is hardly a gym, with three fitness aparatuses and very small. The location was good, 2 minutes walk from the metro linking straight to the center, taxis available and very close to the beach. There is a shopping area right next to the hotel with everything ranging from food, entertainment and many shops which was handy if you do not want to eat in the hotel. To conclude for the price i would definately not recommend, it is an average hotel charging too much for what it is worth, however if you are not interested in the pool or other extras then the hotel should be quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Standard business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sully001
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, fantastic helpful staff. Was very pleased with my stay here, but it was for a business conference. Hotel facilities are great, swimming pools, basic gym, sauna, bars...etc. Great view from swimming pool at top. Great shower in bedrooms. Well equiped rooms. If you are asked, ask for a room with a city view (not beach!). Was lucky enough to be on 17th floor with city view and could see whole city (and the sites). Beach view is building sites! Air-con was broken in room, but that was just unlucky (i just opened the window instead!) There is no beach near-by. It is all under development, so go else-where if you want the beach. Not much in this area (couple of cafe's near-by). Metro/undergound is 5mins walk and will take you straight into centre (2euro's single). There are several hotels round this area and if you had to choose one for its location for conferences (e.g CCIB) this is definately the best. If you are on a city-break, would strongly recommend getting a hotel in centre. Metro is convenient but does take 30mins or so getting in and back from centre and stops at 1am. Plus no bars near the hotel. Overall: Great hotels with facilities. Great choice for business. If site-seeing/holiday, go to hotel in centre

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - but don't take our word for it - go find out for yourself.”
Reviews.Author: Roxy-Popsy
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here in 2 rooms for 5 nights in early April. Brill! We caught the aerobus from the airport to Plaza Catalunya (8.65 euros each, return), & then the local no.41 bus (1.40 euros each) which stops a few paces from the hotel. Stay on the local bus until the end of the route. From departing the aircraft to entering the hotel was one & a half hours. Check in was efficient & views to take our breath away as we whizzed up the outside of the building in one of the 3 glass lifts. We had corner junior suites on the 'Wellness' promotion on 20th & 22nd floors. The views were amazing be it daytime or night time. The suites were spacious with a sitting room with sofa & easy chair & clear perspex occasional table. The bedroom was spacious with floor to ceiling windows, double bed, bedside units, table & chair & built in tv unit . The mini fridge was very useful & free mini bar fantastic. Every day we had complimentary bottles(1 of each) of still water, sparkling water, lemonade, coca-cola & beer. The balcony was wonderful to admire the views over the sea or back towards Barcelona itself. We could have sat there all day. The bathroom was very clean & again very spacious. I like a magnifying mirror on a bracket from the wall but there wasn't one - minor detail. The breakfasts were excellent with a great choice every day & empty dishes & tables very promptly cleared. The waiting staff at breakfast worked quietly & very efficiently & were always very pleasant. They removed used crockery & cutlery on a trolley with a cloth placed over it, as it should be done. Thank you. Our promotion included a massage for each room. We had interpreted this as one massage per room per stay but in fact, it was one massage per room per DAY, & excellent 50 minute masssages they were too. We all really enjoyed the saunas & jacuzzi too. It was so hot for a couple of days of our stay, that we were able to enjoy the pool on 23rd floor & admire the views at the same time. We didn't use the pool on 3rd floor but we could have done. The 2 free computers on the mezzanine level were really useful to check emails & check in for our return flights & there was a printer to print out our boarding passes. Really liked the funky lips red sofa! We ate in the hotel restaurant one evening & it was a lovely meal. We enjoyed the attentions of a New Zealand waiter (can't remember his name, sorry) who was very efficient, friendly & courteous. He made our evening an evening to remember for all the right reasons. When he learnt that we were celebrating our anniversary he produced a bottle of Cava & 4 glasses. Thank you so much for making our evening even more special than it already was. We ate a late lunch one day in the bar & it was very good, again with good service & pleasant staff. If you are there at a weekend or holiday do visit Tibidabo because the views are spectacular. Also the Magic Fountains (free) but check what evenings & the time as it depends on the winter or summer schedule. We used the buses & metro with no problems & always very efficient. Buy a pass that suites you as it certainly saves money. We had a great holiday so our thanks to all at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: DerbySarah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelona Princess for 6 nights. On arrival we were greeted warmly by the Reception staff who gave us the option of a room overlooking the sea or the city. We took the advice of the Receptionist and opted for the city view and were allocated a room on the 17th floor which was wonderful. We could lie in bed at night with the whole of Barcelona lay twinkling before us. Three glass lifts on the exterior wall of the hotel give great views as you ascend to your room. Our room was clean, comfortable and of a modern design; lots of glass, orange and black colour scheme. A window seat with desk/table unit gave us the opportunity to look out and admire the city landscape. The bed was large and comfortable. Storage was a little limited with wardrobe space and 3 drawers. The separate toilet and shower area was well laid out and the shower was a powerful one with range of jets etc. Toiletries, bathrobes and slippers were provided and there was a free safe available. The TV picked up BBC 1 as well as a few other English speaking channels . The free mini bar allowed us one beer, one coke, one bitter lemon and one water each day. We were a little disappointed by the breakfasts. There was quite a range of foods on offer but sometimes staff were slow to replenish various items so you took what was there at the time. We loved the orange juice - not the usual bland hotel quality. Dining room staff were helpful and attentive. The internet area was free to use which was great although the Salvador Dali design with the plastic lip sofas was exactly that...design NOT comfort! We didn't use the hotel bar but sat in reception which is next to the bar: it is very retro, very 70s style orange with the furniture showing some wear and tear; perhaps in need of some refurbishment. There is a porter on duty at the entrance to the hotel but he was more like a 'bouncer' than a doorman. He didn't meet and greet in a friendly way but just looked menacingly! The location of the hotel is quite a way out of the city centre but we did walk it a couple of times as the weather was sunny. The walk took about an hour and allowed us the opportunity to see the five or six beaches leading into Barcelona. There was a lot of construction work happening on the beach closest to the Barcelona Princess but an accessible and suitable bathing beach area was within a 10 minute walk. Metro station,tram and bus stop were all close by and the Bus Turistica (hop on/hop off) stops immediately outside the hotel. We used the swimming pool and spa one afternoon as the weather was good. My husband loved the sauna and although the pool is very small, it did allow us the opportunity to lie out on a sunbed and soak up the rays. The Diagonal Mar shopping mall is adjacent to the hotel with a good range of shops, food court, restaurant terrace, large Alcampo supermarket and cinema complex. Would recommend the hotel - it has a young feel and the view from our room was really stunning! Would certainly recommend Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Super clean & modern”
Reviews.Author: cverduchi
Reviews.Content: Not right in the center of everything, however we didn't want to be. About a block or two from the subway to get us wherever we needed. There's a mall right next door too. GORGEOUS hotel, however if I was to nitpick..the only thing that wasn't great would be the paella restaurant recommendation from the concierge (it's an overpriced place that is less than a block away at a restaurant court type place). The paella was SO not fresh (not real saffron either) and tasted nothing like my grandmother's who grew up in Spain. Regardless- the hotel was beautiful, the room was beautiful and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: fatboyonadiet
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, near to a metro station, the beach and next door to a shopping centre! It's a little out of the way from the centre of Barcelona but guess it's more of a business hotel which makes it nice and quiet on the weekends. Breakfasts are plentiful with a nice choice, there's free internet and 2 decent pools but they do get a bit busy unless you're early. You can also catch the open top tour bus from the side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Free mini bar!”
Reviews.Author: Iscand
Reviews.Content: I don't know whether it was a special temporary condition or it is still like this, but the minibar was for free! It was not the richest I've ever seen, but you could find some beer, coke, juices and so on. I think this only reason is enough to give it a try. But how not to mention the breakfast buffet? And the amazing view from the highest floors? I hope I can go back there as soon as possible...

Reviews.Title: “Great balance between Value, Shopping & Proximity to Beach”
Reviews.Author: Mayo_Family
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for a week end. We had a lovely relaxing 2 day break. Day spent shopping in the City Centre (15 Mins away by taxi) and day 2 on the beach(10 min walk away) and drinking sangria outside in the sun. The pools were small and cold so we swam in the sea nearby. Very happy over all. Very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Amazing leisure equipment”
Reviews.Author: Silvermoosee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty amazing. It is very design and the rooms are spacious. The most amazing thing about it is the equipments : it has super nice swimming pools, decks, whirlpool and sauna. It is a little apart from the city center but it is close with the tram and close from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, everything 100%”
Reviews.Author: aash23
Reviews.Content: We felt very lucky to have found such a great hotel. Out of the centre but this was not a problem as the hotel was really close to underground station. Stayed two nights and took the car which was charged approx £12 per night - quite expensive but you expect this in a city such as Barcelona. A great, modern and stylish hotel - would recommend 100%!!!

Reviews.Title: “barcelona princess”
Reviews.Author: WendyK3
Reviews.Content: great hotel with friendly staff. the only draw back was the beds were hard as a rock

Reviews.Title: “A little far out but good service”
Reviews.Author: Ambi-Rhea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barcelona Princess with my elderly parents. We got a good deal on last minute for rooms and breakfast and stayed there for 5 nights. Positives: A smart, clean hotel. Rooms are comfortable and clean, the buffet breakfast is excellent. The hotel was pretty full but food was replenished quickly and regularly so even if you turned up 15 minutes before closing you could still have your pick of fresh fruit/cooked breakfast etc. There were plenty of staff working and I must say I haven't witnessed an as efficient "buffet" operation anywhere else. Big plus. There is a subway station around 7 minutes walk from the hotel and a shopping mall down the road if you need to buy anything you may have forgotten, plus Starbucks. We quite enjoyed the area as it was a quiet place to come back to in the evening. The open top bus stops just outside the hotel (we didn't take this as this was a return trip.) Negatives: A bit far out from the town centre and the airport so we had to take a long subway ride everywhere. For anyone not familiar, Barcelona's tube stations go on and on underground so what looks like a short stop or one stop on a map may mean walking for 15 minutes underground, up and down stairs to change train etc. Room service selection wasn't great, but we didn't need to use it. This may be a point for Barcelona in general but someone tried to mug us on 2 occassions. Once on the subway escalator a man had his hand in my mum's shoulder-bag and we caught him. The second time 2 men posing as police accused us (2 elderly people and a heavily pregnant woman) of purchasing drugs and insisted we handed over all of our cash. I was surprised as Ive travelled all over the world on business and for leisure and haven't been in a situation where someone is quite obviously trying to rob me. Just a warning to be very vigilant. A good hotel if you want a smart clean place to put your head down, a good breakfast and to be away from the drunken bustle of people on stag-do's in the main town.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views - modern and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: the_adj
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are far more polite than those at the AC opposite. The rooms are large, confortable and have superb views of Barcelona. One of the biggest breakfast choices I have ever seen. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: K60PAD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess with friends and had a fantastic time. It's a little way out from the city centre but public transport is fantastic, so no problems with sight seeing etc. As others have said, Breakfast buffet was excellent. Roof-top pool and Jacuzzi are nice.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Souzan
Reviews.Content: The BARCELONA HOTEL is the new reference of Princess Hotels & Resorts in the center of the city of Barcelona. With 4 stars superior, situated near the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel and view of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: auroredesavoye
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a weekend spent at the Barcelona Princess and absolutely loved it! Had booked though lastminute.com (room only) but noticed on arrival that the breakfast had 50% off : 9.50 euros instead of 19 euros. The breakfast was amazing! A lot of choice and great quality food . Stayed on top floor of the hotel (26th floor!!!) and the view of Barcelona was stunning! A shame the weather was not great the past weekend... The hotel is ideally located near a massive shopping center and to get to the city center or other areas, you have the choice between taking the tramway or the bus or the subway. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not great location”
Reviews.Author: carcats
Reviews.Content: The rooms are modern and lovely. The breakfast is great. It is close to the beach. But there is almost nothing in the area, and it is about a 20 minute train ride to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: nusia26
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with Friendly staff. Perfect connection with most of the Barcelona attractions. Beautiful views. Massive bathroom and massive bed. The only bad thing was broken air condition. They’ve sent someone to fix it but it still didn’t work. I’m sure they would have changed the room for us but we stayed for 2 nights only so we didn’t bother

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lythamwindmill
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend to Barcelona, flew Easy Jet from Liverpool (our 1st experience of same). Had a brilliant time. Hotel is excellent, very clean, the staff were very friendly and polite. Buffet breakfast caters for all appetities, only minor complaint was that that cooked breakfast was not piping hot! Well located just two minutes from 'Arc de Triomphe' so within easy reach of major attractions by foot. For those not so energetic all other means of transport vitually on the doorstep!

Reviews.Title: “Spain, a must see”
Reviews.Author: AndriAA
Reviews.Content: Trip was a great one. When sight seeing to all the attractions. Was really impressed had a wonderful time. Will definitely travel there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern contemporary”
Reviews.Author: Wonderlust79
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, had 24th floor room with beautiful views of the city and were treated to an awesome sunset. Will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Noisy Street”
Reviews.Author: TravelDupont
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful, the convention center across the street is not. The staff speaks English, and is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is walking distance to a metro station, a huge supermarket and a 20 min walk to the beach. The room was wonderful, huge bed, great bathroom, great view, and fast internet. My biggest problem was the noise from the street, at night it was very quiet, but come 7:00 AM there were buses and trucks and alarms going off. It was impossible to sleep through... ... if you can make it to Spain and not be jet lagged and don't want to sleep late this place is great, if you like to sleep in, I'd stay somewhere else. I am returning to Barcelona soon, and will not be staying at this hotel, only because of the street noise in the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely somewhere special”
Reviews.Author: gazcam
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the Princess has the wow factor. It is simply stunning both outside and inside. There are great views over the city from the glass lifts as you go up to your designer room. Ours was a good size with a lovely view towards the sea and the Forum building across the road which has a sheet of water on it's roof. There is a glass wall between the bedroom and bathroom but the electronically operated blind can be used to give privacy. Free safe and minibar too. Preferred taking the tram rather than the metro. The stop is 2 mins from the hotel and it goes up Av. Diagonal to Marina in the Eixample district in 10 mins then back down to the Olympic Port. Tried the pool on the 23rd floor. Slightly cool but still ok and it was November after all. Views from the pool area are again great. The buffet breakfast was lovely with a really good choice on offer. Staff throughout the hotel were professional, corteous and attentive. Probably as good as it ever gets!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Devonbabe
Reviews.Content: A group of us 6 ladies, stayed at the Princess for 3 nights. We all thought the hotel was great, clean friendly with a fantastic buffet extraveganza of a breakfast. We were in a corner room with a little balcony, our bathroom wasnt glass, but the room was very spacious. Only fault was as a female, we would have loved to have a mirror in the bedroom so that you could see to do your hair when using straigtners (impossible had to use the tv screen)!! You have to like glass and heights to fully appreciate this hotel, as the interconnecting links were glass, floored and sides, large floor to ceiling glass walls and the lifts run on the outside of the building and are glass We were all on the 21st floor, fantastic views over the city and the sea. It was too cold to use the pool, but we looked around and it looked great and agin very clean, worth We managed to stay in the bar on all 3 nights till after close at 1am. enjoying a large jug or 2 of sangria for 21 euros. Bar staff were attentive and friendly. The postion of the hotel was great, a metro ride into the centre, which took no longer than 20 minutes, the metro is spotlessly clean and efficient. A ticket for just over 7 euros gives you 10 trips, a bargain. We would all definitely use this hotel again, and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Home from home.”
Reviews.Author: lullable
Reviews.Content: We booked flight & hotel through Opodo and got a fantastic deal. Although the literature clearly stated that breakfast was not included, this was upgraded on check-in at no extra cost. We had a junior suite on a corner site. This meant that we had views out over the ocean and also down the promenade. We also had a balcony. The bed was superkingsize. The bathroom was in a wetroom style. No bath, just one of those multi-head showers that "pebble-dashed" you. The bathroom was mostly windows and no wall but there were pull-down blinds in case you were worried about your modesty. The week we arrived the temperature went up from 12 degrees to 28. However, the air con in the hotel wasn't set to come on until later in the year. Although, the staff were really good and they complied with our request that the windows be left open every day...this meant it was nice & cool when we came back in the evening. TV was much better than we expected. We had a fair smattering of the freeview channels from UK including C4, ITV, BBC1 and E4. The breakfast was superb... the fresh fruit and home-baked (or should that be hotel-baked) breads were among the best I've tasted anywhere in the Northern Hemisphere. We got the train from the airport & changed to Metro to get to the hotel. DON'T DO THIS. It's much easier to get the bus from the airport to Place de Catalunia, then get the 41 bus. When we were there, we got the 41 bus outside the Hard Rock Cafe. But double check this when you go, just incase they change the bus routes. The bus lets you off 10 steps from the Hotel entrance. There is a large shopping centre next to the hotel and the usual mall type eateries on the top floor. The Ramblas... what a tourist trap! Overpriced and over-rated. The only thing worth going down The Ramblas for was the fantastic St Joseph's fruit and food market. Please beware in The Ramblas we saw numerous teams of pick-pockets at work. They seem to work in 3's and usually a pretty girl involved. We spent half a day wandering around Sarria (the stop before Barcelona FC on the hop on- hop off bus trip). I really enjoyed this. Virtually no tourists. Reasonably priced food and coffee and much better quality than off The Ramblas. All in all. we really enjoyed our stay in Barcelona. If we go back... we are definitely staying in the Barcelona Princess.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidayhelen88
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. We stayed b&b and breakfast wass fantastic. Outside pools far to cold to use when we were there. rooms fantastic. Very clean. Good service. Located quite far from centre of barcelona but not far from metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price, stylish but impracticle decor, Metro across the street.”
Reviews.Author: NHBookworm
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very modern with a lot of glass and views of either the city (better view at night) or the sea (better view during the day). The quality of the linens was superior. The room was quiet. The service was good except that the desk staff's English was just fair. The bellman spoke very well and helped out a lot with info on the Metro, HO HO bus, etc. Some negatives are that the bathrooms have no towel bars... there aren't enough elevators for the size of the hotel - only two - so you usually have a wait... and the location isn't near any of the sights. We knew about the location when we chose this hotel and wanted to make use of the metro, which worked out well. The hotel is attached to a modern shopping mall. The hop-on - hop-off buses stop across the street and run until November 1st, after that they switch to winter routes which are shorter and don't include the Diagonal Ave. We ordered room service one night & it was quick and good. We ate in the restaurant the last night. We were the only ones there so were a little worried but the food and service was great. We had the front desk arrange for a cab to be waiting for us to take us to the airport after checkout (6:30 am & they were waiting for us at the curb). This is an unusual hotel with all of the glass. Even the bathroom had an entire wall of glass overlooking the sea so you could see the cruise ships go by while you brushed your teeth. I thought the rates were very reasonable 145 E /nt for a suite. The suites have a glass balcony, kind of scary at that height, but fresh air is always nice. The regular rooms have a large window that opens.

Reviews.Title: “Best views in the city”
Reviews.Author: stanmoreblokey
Reviews.Content: We are currently in room 1904 of this hotel. We booked it as one of those deals where you don't know which hotel you are staying in, but we are not disappointed. Others have mentioned that this hotel is not in the city, and it is in the new business district that is not within walking distance of the main sites, but the Metro from El Maresme/Forum is quick, cheap and safe, and only one street over from the hotel. The rooms are very clean with great views and extremely helpful staff. Our original room had an odour coming from the sink, but we were shown a number of rooms to choose from before we moved. Try to get a city view and you can see La Sagrada Familia in the distance. The blackout blinds give you a great nights sleep and the free mini bar is a nice touch, a beer, lemonade, water and Coca Cola each day. Some of the showers do flood, but put some towels down! Avoid eating on the Ramblas you WILL be ripped off, if on the Ramblas go to Carrer Del Carme, it is a street off the Ramblas and then go into 'Fresco' salad, pizza, pasta, drink, desert and coffee for less than 10 euro, you can eat as much as you like, and they let you go back for more. McDonald etc are all more expensive on the Ramblas. Be careful of open bags, someone tried to get into ours once, they seem to see it as sport! The AA Key guide is a great book to use, and get a Barcelona card to get discounts into museums, free travel and a lovely free boat trip! Bring a student card if you have one, for some good discounts. Typing this looking out of the window from the Barcelona Princess, simply stunning. Wish you were here.

Reviews.Title: “Fab views, lovely rooms and reasonably priced food”
Reviews.Author: LondonGiggles
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel was a bit of an effort on the metro from the airport, but we were not disappointed once we arrived. The reception staff were very polite and helpful in telling us how to get about and not to ensure we did not get lost again! The rooms were very clean and fabulous black out blinds ensured a good nights sleep. We would definitely recommend this hotel and although a little way out of the main buzz of the city centre it did not eliminate any of the sightseeing possibilities.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: Celica190
Reviews.Content: We don't often have the good fortune to stay in a hotel of this calibre but the price was right and, having read the review on this site, we booked the trip. Even though we had seen pictures of the rooms, we were amazed when we got to our room, which was at the top of the hotel on the 26th floor with a city view as requested. We could literally see the entire city from our bed. The free minibar was a nice touch, although it would've been better to be able to specify which drinks you wanted. The shower was exceptionally good and we had no problem with leaks. The TV had a selection of channels in English, French, Spanish and German. Staff were very helpful and were quick to offer us another room when we had a problem with the first one we were allocated. One minor gripe - our rate was room only and we were obviously not the only clients who found the price of the breakfast a little too much to swallow. There was a steady stream of people crossing the road to the cafe every morning. Maybe if the price was more reasonable, more people would be inclined to spend their money in the hotel? The hotel is literally two minutes from the metro, which we found to be reliable and safe. Overall, thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “luxury near the beach/shopping and transport links”
Reviews.Author: JoBurgers
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on this hotel,just for one nite as we were travelling on down the coast.we purposely picked to be near a beach and it was 5-10 min walk from the closest one which was fine.it is right beside a shopping centre and across the road from the metro.the room was lovely and some great freebies like free mini bar and slippers!!!view was amazing and even the glass lift had an amazing view.pool was cool too on the 23rd floor looking out over the coast..id recommend this hotel to be near the beach and transport links.u wont be able to walk to main st las ramblas BUT there is a metro across the rd which links up with all the different routes to the city.only 10euro in cab back to hotel if ur coming home late at nite.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CliffAscot
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days in Barcelona for my birthday, picked this hotel as it was out of the city centre and near the beach(which we never went too). Very pleased we did as it was in a quiet area with great transport links into the centre. Hotel is very modern and comfortable with large bedrooms and as most other people have said "great showers" Good shopping centre next to hotel, with plenty of places to eat breakfast or dinner if you want a break from the city. Staff very helpful with directions etc. One barman not very friendly when we asked for coffee at around midnight, but the following evening a very nice young guy on duty, he got the "tip"

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: PrettyPollyDublin
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, very clean, quiet, professional, staff helpful and polite. Room was large and had large balcony though to avail of the 'sea view' we had to stretch out over side of balcony and look through cranes and half constructed buildings. Location was not great - about €10 in taxi to Las Ramblas. Large shopping centre with bars and restraunts next door though. Breakfast was delightful with plenty of choice and seating/tables. Pools were lovely to look at although a little cold and very small. Gym consisted of one treadmill.... Overall it is a choice hotel. - it really depends what you want from a hotel. I would suggest staying here if you want to be away from the city in a quieter location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: millosun
Reviews.Content: The room was big and tastefully decorated with a beautiful view of the ocean. The rooftop pool was nice and they had a nice selection for breakfast. We had some trouble communicating with the staff at times as some were not so good at english. The hotel is one of the nicer one I´ve stayed at but it was too far from city centre for me to stay there again, but I would deffinetely recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “did the job”
Reviews.Author: johnandTine
Reviews.Content: little bit outside the city but everything was so accessible by metro, bus and very reasonable taxi that it was no problem. Spotlessly clean but a bit impersonal. typical city hotel. The design of the room flattered to deceive but on the whole did the job at a resonable price with the added benefit of a short walk to fabulous beaches not inhabited by tourists. The bar opposite "The Rambla" was fab for cheap food and drink as expensive in the hotel. Right next door to extensive shopping mall. Breath taking views from the upper floors especially if you get city side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great sea views, far from centre but good transit systems!”
Reviews.Author: Jooolz1976
Reviews.Content: I was there for three nights in July as part of a large global gathering for my company. The Barcelona Princess Hotel was very clean and comfortable and very unique in its design - especially the washroom where one door seperates it from the bedroom part. It is enclosed within the room by glass that you can cover with an electronic black drape. We sometimes forget to put the drape down so there were a few visual surprises between my roomate and I. hahah! The beds were very comfortable but rolled a bit every time I sat down. To be silly we ended up have a bed race. The hotel itself is nice and clean and the staff were friendly. The breakfast room was great but some odd choices of food for breakfast. I am always up for an adventure... The location is good for business travellers but may be a wrong choice for tourists as it's far from the centre. However, it is close to the beach and sea which is a bonus as that's something you need to experience Even though it isn't a centrally located hotel the transit system is pretty fantastic Barcelona. The Tram drops you off infront of the hotel and the metro stop is only a few blocks away. There isn't much in the area of the hotel except for a large new mall that will have some food options - including Burger King and McDonalds. I would recommend the hotel - I did enjoy it and it was comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: AmyJoLondon
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I booked into this hotel for our last night of our holiday. The hotel itself is very modern and has fantastic glass walkways between floors. When we got to our room which was on the 12th floor we were amazed by the view!!! From our room we could see right the way across Barcelona and couldnt believe the value for our money. However after taking a shower cracks began to show as the entire bathroom flooded with water as the seals had gone around the edges of the shower. We were moved rooms however lost our fantastic view... but we did have a small sea view so there was no reason to complain! But once again it was clear the bathrooms were badly deisgned as the toilet door was missing its the panel that it catched onto... if your fussy regarding these kind of things this may not be the place for you... however the rooms and beds were so comfy that they made up for this! We also discovered that unless you specify on your booking that you require a MARITAL BED the bed will come as a twin (of which all we had to do was push together..).. There was no breakfast included in our rate, and its 20 Euro's for their breakfast ... if this is too steep for you then dont worry as there are plenty of restaurants in the mall nearby. The location of the hotel though is fantastic! It felt very safe and was a 2 minute walk to the metro, theres also a shopping mall directly infront of the hotel which offers plenty of options for meals out! However it is about a 20 minute journey into the centre of the city.. with a couple of changes on the metro, however if your not worried about this the hotel is fantastic! If you want somewhere a little less touristy and busy then i would definately recommend this hotel! The local area is relaxing in comparison to Las Ramblas. We also had access to the sauna and jacuzzi but never got the time to experience them! so we will most definately be coming back here we loved it! I'd definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Blajk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights after spending 3 nights at the hotel opposite. It was everything the other 4 star wasn't! Bright, cheery and friendly staff. So glad I decided to move. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels around the world and would most certainly return to the Princess. I cannot comment on the food as breakfast wasn't included in my deal and was rather pricey at 19 euros. The shopping centre next door was able to provide me with breakfast for 3 euros!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BeratV
Reviews.Content: Excellent service by the staff at anytime. Very good and modern standard on the rooms. The view and the pool in the 23´th floor is very nice, here you can work your tan - overlooking the beautiful city of Barcelona. Will also recommend the pool on the third floor as you have more sunbeds here and a bar by the poolside. Location is a bit outside the city centre, but no problem as you have metro and tram station just across the street or you can take a cab for around 10 - 12 € each way:-) Will definitely stay here the next time i visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “"Top Class"”
Reviews.Author: Wolfie14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from the Princess and must say it is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. We were on the 7th floor and the views from both the balcony and the lift's were breathtaking. We had breakfast included in our deal which was well worth it, do book before or you'll end up paying 19 euros per person!! So much choice and it lasted us until our evening meal, so fill your boots! I must agree with the "small" pool area's they look very attactive from the pictures but very different once there, would not let this put you off. Metro, Trams and Buses are easy to use and all within a 3/4 minute walk from the hotel, Metro was a little tricky to pick up at first but once we got the hang of it we used it all holiday. You must get a T10 from the bus station, cost 7.70 euros each and you get 10 passes to take you anywhere you like on all lines. All in all a top hotel, great facilities, brilliant buffet breakfast, location is a little out of the city but so easy to get to and within a 10 min metro stop away. The staff were very friendly and helpful, we would definatley recommend and would return again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay in Presidential suite, absolute luxury...Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: afterglow69
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend stay in the hotel. Paid (a little)extra for the Presidential Suite at the Hotel through Expedia. The booking was messed up and we were offered a Junior Suite, but an hour later we were in our Presidential Suite with 40metre terrace and our own private jucuzzi! Absolute luxury...We took our breakfast on the terrace (room service) at no extra charge - perfect views and at least 4 or 5 courses - fruite, yog, meat, cheese, pastries, ham, etc, etc - Wonderful. The hotel is a couple of metro stops away from the action, but the chance to watch a distant thunderstorm over the mountains from the 26th floor was just unmissable. Staff very friendly and professional, but i would recommend booking over the web as the in-hotel deals don't appear to be great. This was a 10th anniversary treat for my wife and I - great choice

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience - only a short, relaxing journey from the main city.”
Reviews.Author: GeminiTravels
Reviews.Content: I have to say, my recent stay in Barcelona was made amazing by the incredible staff at the Hotel Barcelona Princess. They were attentive, and helpful through everything, including setting me up with internet in my room, free of charge, as well as borrowing me an adapter so that I could charge my camera to keep taking my hundreds of photos as I toured through the city. They even helped pay for my taxi when I arrived at the hotel, walletless after being pick-pocketed on La Ramblas. They were friendly and remembered me, even with the large conference that was going on in the hotel, making me feel right at home - no matter how many people had looked at me strange as I attempted to speak Spanish! The food in the hot breakfast buffet was incredible, although slightly different from what we are used to over here! Cold cuts, cold toast (it's the way they eat it over there), fresh fruit (rather than fried breakfast items) and a large selection of juices were only a few of the things that were there, ready to tempt the taste buds and keep me going for my long days wandering. The rooms were incredible, with comfortable beds, black out blinds that made sleeping incredibly easy, and some of the nicest showers that I have found through all my European trips. It even made my shower at home look weak in comparison! I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a hotel in a quieter part of Barcelona with excellent metro access, and a fairly affordable taxi ride home. A 5* in my books all the way. (As per other reviews on TripAdvisor, the hotels are remarkably slow, but this is a small price to pay for the incredible service and amazing accomodation.) - GeminiTravels -

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful~”
Reviews.Author: ONJULIE
Reviews.Content: The interior of room was very good and all staffs are also very kind. And breafast was good~

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel I've Ever Stayed At - Just A Bit Too Far From City Centre”
Reviews.Author: niamunna
Reviews.Content: Just back from this hotel and WOW! It is STUNNING!!!!! We went to the city to see Madonna at the Stdia Olympica (which is incidentally on top of a mountain - the only way to get from there after a concert is to walk or get a cab as the metro closed at 11!). We checked in at this hotel and asked for a sea view and were given room 1111 on the 11th floor. A great view over the Med! The check in staff were a little impersonal, but I didn't mind that. The room was amazing. It had some lovely touches - the electronic blinds, the TV with loads of channels, the free drinks in the minibar. It was very modern and reminded me of a room on a ship! The beds were comfy and the air conditioning was a very welcome touch when temperatures reached the 30s. Superb shower, which took a bit of fiddling with to work out but has now made me want one of these at home! The rest of the hotel was just as sumptous. The views from the lifts and the top of the hotel are unrivalled. The pool, hot tub and sauna on the 3rd floor were lovely, with plenty of big clean towels to use. Surprisingly, they were never too busy either. the best part of the hotel though had to be the 23rd floor pool. The pictures you see on this website and others really don't do it justice. It is breathtaking! Although a little narrow, it's lovely to relax in there looking out over the sea with nothing in your way. Maybe not too suitable for kids, but for relaxation seeking adults, you will be in heaven! We had a good bargain too, booking through hotels.com we had an extra 10% discount from a code we found online and stayed for 4 nights for £260. The only one drawback was how far out of the city centre the hotel is. We mis-read a map when booking as the Avenguida Diagonal is miles long. There is a tram stop practically outside the hotel and a Metro stop 5 minutes away, but there is a good 15 minute train ride to any of the main attractions in the city. If I stayed in Barcelona again, i wouldn't stay here simply because of how far out it is, but that would be the only reason.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice in the area”
Reviews.Author: JLTravels
Reviews.Content: We were not impressed with this hotel. We had a room on the 5th floor with a small balcony overlooking the pool. Our room was a bit small and very dark...the lighting was not great. A light fixture and outlet did not work (although they fixed the light fixture). No irons were provided, but the hotel staff ironed a shirt....for TEN pounds! All of the rooms have twin beds pushed together....it didn't work for me. The most annoying feature of the room was the bathroom....it had a shower w/ no bathtub and a very small splash guard so that water went everywhere when someone took a shower. Moreover, there was no place to put soap or shampoo...it was really bizarre. We left early and went to a different hotel. Having said that, the housekeeping staff was super nice and did a great job!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel, great views!”
Reviews.Author: jambuster
Reviews.Content: We booked this via lastminute.com as the rates were very reasonable. This hotel is not in the centre of Barcelona so it's nice and quite, but close enough to jump on the metro when you want the shops and nightlife of buzzing Barcelona. Our breakfast was included and was of the highest standard. We really felt like we were being pampered. Great room (as for a city view!) and great pool & gym. We liked it so much we would book it again next year and stay for a whole week!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: eyedoc333
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barcelona Princess Hotel (July 7-13) for a conference at the convention center across the street. I checked in around 10 AM and thanks to the advice of another reviewer, went to breakfast immediately before it closed at 10:30, even though the staff did not inform me of the option. Breakfast was included with my room and it was terrific. They served breads and pastries, cold cereals with milk, fruit, cheeses, breakfast meats, grilled vegetables, eggs, yogurt, coffee and assorted juices. For lunch and dinner, a quick food option is the large food court on the 3rd floor of the Diagonal Mar shopping mall next door to the hotel. There were many choices of interesting restaurants for asian food, pasta, tapas, sandwiches, as well as the usual Burger King, Subway, Ben and Jerry's, etc. There was also the Al Campo grocery store located within the mall for other food items. Although some previous reviewers mentioned signs posted about not bringing food back into the hotel, I didn't see any signs during my stay. Maybe the management has relaxed the policy. The room was a nice size, with room-darkening shades, as well as a shade to cover the bathroom area for those who mentioned the see-through glass partition. I was traveling alone, so it was not a concern for me. The free mini-bar had Coke, beer, a carbonated lemon drink, and two bottles of water. There was no mention that the mini-bar was free, but thankfully I read the reviews on this website before I traveled. I would tend to agree with the other reviewers that the staff could certainly be more helpful and friendly. There was no mention of breakfast when I arrived, no mention of the free mini-bar, no warnings about pick-pockets in the area (they are rampant). I was OK, but many of my colleagues at the convention were pick-pocketed. I also agree with others that the elevator was slow. A couple of times I took the stairs down from the 4th floor, but the stairway was very dark and had a large table blocking one of the landings. It's clear that the stairway is not meant for everyday use. I was on the 4th floor, but took a trip up the elevator to the 23rd floor for a fantastic view of the city. There is a pool there, as well as on the 3rd floor. For those interested in using the internet, there is wireless available in the lobby and business center on the first floor, but it is extremely slow. There are two desktop computers and a printer in the business center so that you can check in and print your boarding passes for your return flight. The server went down once during my stay, but eventually came back. The Metro stop is close to the hotel and it's a short trip to the downtown areas of interest. You can purchase a 10-trip ticket, which was very useful over a period of several days. The beach is a short walk away from the hotel. All-in-all, I enjoyed my stay there. It really helped to read a lot of reviews on this website for important tips before I left.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: BirdieStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed overnight at the Barcelona Princess Hotel before our cruise. Although we had a special rate as it was a Sunday the room was excellent we were offered sea view or city room. Breakfast was one of the best we have eaten in a european hotel. Although it was out of the main town taxis were called by hotel staff very quickly. Also close to a good selection of shops in a shopping arcade. Beach within walking distance. Good outdoor pool with bar. Would definitely use this hotel again. We booked though Last Minute.com.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, probably won't stay again though”
Reviews.Author: BrightonBelle
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Barcelona Princess, fantastic views from our room (corner suite on the 23rd floor) of both the city and the sea. It was lovely waking up to the sea view. The location was good - very well connected to the tram service, the metro, the buses and the tourist buses. We had no problems getting around very easily to all the nice parts of Barcelona; the Born, the Barri Gotic, the beach by the Arts Hotel, the Sagrada Familia. Tip: get a T-10 card from the tram stop for cheap travel - ten trips for 7.70 euros which you can share between two or more - just validate the ticket in the machine as many times as you like. You can change stations (tube to tube, tube to tram, etc.) and it will count as one trip, as long as its done within 75mins. Wish London had as efficient a system. Back to the hotel - it was extremely busy when we were there; the hotel has nearly 400 rooms and was pretty full - there was a queue for breakfast (great quality, lots of choice, replenished frequently by friendly, helpful staff), then a queue for the lifts (just three lifts to serve all 26 floors). However, this aside, it is a great, well run hotel, super clean and comfortable. Anyone with a fear of heights may want to think twice before booking; the lifts have one completely glass side (amazing views over the city) and there are also glass corridors with glass floors between the two towers of the hotel, which although an amazing design feature - its a really interesting design - but not for the faint-hearted. Although we enjoyed our stay, and I'd happily revisit again - would be great for a conference, I'll look for a smaller hotel next time we visit beautiful Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to the convention center.”
Reviews.Author: pandah88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Princess while I was on business travel for a conference at the convention center across the street. It was very convenient for working at the convention center, and there are a number of other hotels and the mall in the immediate area for restaurants, shops, etc. The pros: quiet room, great ocean view (from my room facing that direction), very friendly staff, king-sized bed, free hard-line connected internet (although a little slow). Cons (minor): slow elevators, cigarette smoking in neighbor's room made my room smell like smoke, no personal irons anywhere in the hotel (you need to send out/pay for any pressing you want done). The hotel staff was very friendly - checked me in right away when I arrived at about 9:30 a.m. on a Monday, answered my silly American questions (how do I turn on the lights? oh, put your room key in the slot by the door! is there an iron?) and sent someone up immediately when I accidentally blew a circuit in the room at 11 p.m. I was in my boss' room at the Hilton down the street and overall that seemed like a nicer hotel, although the views aren't as nice and my colleagues' rooms mostly had twin beds. The Princess' room was a little smaller, but still comfortable for one or two people.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aimee101
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at the Barcelona Princess. Arrived at Girona and travelled to city centre via bus which cost 16 euros each return. Figured out metro journey before arrived at hotel, closest metro line to hotel is the el maresme forum on the yellow line, 2 mins walk away from hotel. Hotel is very clean and modern, when arrived were told breakfast was included which we didnt expect. Room was on the 22nd floor with a sea view. Rooms are lovely with fantastic view and have both blackout and normal blinds as well as blinds for the bathroom area. Shower only leaked if the door was not closed properly so as long as ensured this was done we didnt have a problem. Slippers and dressing gown provided as well as minibar which included water lemonade and beer and was restocked daily. Plenty on offer for breakfast though wouldnt have paid for the breakfast if hadnt been included in the price of the room (£230 for 3 nights). Travelled around barcelona on the metro, using a T10 ticket which gives you 10 journeys on the metro. Ate in the food court in diagonal mar (the mall next door to the hotel) the first night where there are plenty of different restaurants to chose from and were still busy past 11 on a sunday. Had a lovely night in las ramblas on the final night which was surprisingly the cheapest meal we had. In all a lovely holiday, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: mosip
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful and the views were amazing. We had a standard double room but I cannot imagine how the superior beats this. The room were very clear and looked after daily. The mini bar was restocked and this was free with the room. We had a great view of the city and the sea. The beach was a little walk away so we used the metro, which was so easy to use and the station was only about 3 mins walk away. The metro runs about every 4 mins, so this makes it very easy to get to anywhere in Barcelona. There is also a large shopping mall about 2 mins walk away. I love this hotel and will def visit again. The only negative was the hotels evening meals as the menu did not change all week, so I would have liked a little more variety.

Reviews.Title: “Bacelona Princess (Drains up, flood and my experience”
Reviews.Author: HamUk
Reviews.Content: Had a Suite with balcony at the cost of 330 euros for 2 nights. Didnt want to pay this much but though it looked spectacular on the website. We had 22 floor, which was good for distant views but the side of the hotel we were on overlooked an industrial factory with chimneys and several building sites. The area smelt of drains, possibly sewage and even on the roof top pool you could smell this. Quite overpowering when walking outside. The pools were not heated, had some dead flies in them and it was not possible to swim in them due to extreme cold temperature. User the spa 'jacuzzi- which is a 3 person portable hot tub. Sauna was fine, at 80'c. The lifts were such a pain in the morning that one day i took the stairs up 22 flights of stairs instead. My legs went number and i felt sick. I thought my girlfriend was going to wait for lift but when she didnt show i had to go down the stairwell and found her eventually panting and exhausted. As for the room. The shower in our supposedly top of the range suite didn't fit its frame and so didn't close. We had to wedge towels up to close it but there was a huge flood which not only sent waves into the entire bathroom and toilet cubicle area i had to spend the hole morning mopping it out of the adjoining bedroom too with all four towels and both our dressing gowns to make the room safe. This really annoyed me and made me angry that i paid so much for this room. I didn't have time to complain when checking out as we were in a rush to get transport. The breakfast was ok but personally disappointing as no omelettes. On second day there wasn't even croissants. The shopping centre was right next to hotel with many clothes, electrical shops, food serving places. No supermarket though. Cheapest sandwich was about £5 each and average food was £10 each so not cheap really. Hotel had a sign that seemed to appear on second day saying that we'd be fined an extra charge if we buy food elsewhere and bring into the hotel. This was very unreasonable so we ignored it and luckily had no extra charges applied but were subtle and careful. There was no in room Internet connection which was annoying as i took my laptop abroad and never got to use it. I just kept getting message ,limited or no internet connection. Again a poor lack of expected facility. Pool bar could have server warm snacks like fries etc but it did not. This was annoying. Overall I wish i'd stayed somewere cheaper as i could have booked a deal for a third of the price but was prepare to spend more for what i thought would be a real luxurious stay. Also the barcelona bus trip was extremely expensive. It worked out about £40 for two people and the recorded commentary was so dull that we never really knew what it was talking about so gave up on it. I would have expected to pay about £5-6 each but £20 was very steep for a simple bus ride. Barcelona -Girona bus service was good value for an airport transfer. Subway /metro didnt seem very logical or clear so despite intending on using it we went for the surer option of taking a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: oivindnor
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend was really happy with our stay at the Princess Hotel in Barcelona. The hotel is nicely located at the end of the avigunda diagonal, close to the beach and close to big shopping center with restaurants and everything else you would need(diagonal mar?) The lobby was great, and they had a guard that opened doors for us when we left and when we arrived at the hotel. The service of the staff was varying, but generally good. Some of the recepitonists where a bit cold, and didn't smile, but most of them where very helpful and polite. The room was simply fantastic. A big king size bed that was really good to sleep in, we heard no noise from outside. Free minibar(!), a really nice bathroom with shower and thoilet. And a very good view over the city. The room was always very clean and tidy after the maids had been there. The hotel has two pools. One at the top of the hotel, and one longer down, both having sun most of the day. Great places to chill after a long day of sightseeing in wonderful Barcelona. One thing to mention though, if you are scared of heights you won't like the glass elevator :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shady25
Reviews.Content: Me & my Husband stayed at this hotel at the end of March & were really impressed by it. I stayed here through a recommendation of a friend & I would definitely recommend this to others. We travelled everywhere in Barcelona by Metro & this hotel was perfect for doing so! we went directly from the airport to the hotel & didn't take long at all. The hotel is located away from the town centre - but took us about 10/15 mins to get to the town centre so the journey isn't bad at all. We felt very safe around the hotel even late at night. We got the tourist bus from right outside the hotel which was great & an easy way of sightseeing!! The hotel itself was very modern & a very nice room for a weekend break. The room was a very good size, great bed & bathroom was very nice also. The room has a free minibar which is very nice after an exhausting day sightseeing. I got this hotel for a very good price & it was worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place for a short break!”
Reviews.Author: buzzsolo1
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed here 15/18th April got a good deal with expedia 3 nights for £295 that was for an executive suite including breakfast. On arrival at the airport we took a taxi from the rank direct to hotel for 30 euros quite reasonable we thought . Check in lady could have been a bit more pleasant but she was ok we were in room 2207 so that meant 22nd floor if you dont like heights this is not the hotel for you! Our room had a seperate sitting room/dressing room and the bedroom had the door out onto the balcony it was a wraparound one so we had a sea view as well as a city view very nice. The bathrrom was very modern glass sink etc but no plug for when my partner was shaving , The bed was comfortable tv and fridge ok dont forget contents of fridge are free so use it and they will re-stock each day only thing i missed was not having tea/coffee in the room but i rang room service 1st morning and they bought up to large pots of black coffee and 2 cups for 6 euros. That first night we walked to the shopping mall next door where there were several places to eat we chose the italian which was just ok nothing to write home about. Breakfast next day was a good choice of cereals,breads,cheese,ham, fruit juices only prob was i found the things that were supposed to be hot not very hot at all, scrambled egg,bacon,sausages etc: but overall as i said very good choice something for everybody. That day we took the tourist bus from right outside the hotel if you want to do all 3 coloured routes then you do need to start early we only managed the green and blue but we did get of at la rambla and walk the whole way down to the marina where we sat and watched some of the luxury boats come and go. That night we caught the metro (come out of the main entrance of the hotel cross straight over the road and tram lines walk past the corner tapas bar then 50yds on your left is entrance to metro) takes 2 mins max buy a T10 ticket one go through then pass back to the other this is allowed we asked. You get to use this 10 times for around 7 euros good value. we got of in town and took the side streets to find somewhere to eat we found an Argentinian steak house my partner had the entrecot steak which was excellent i chose the special meat and realised with all the pictures of horses on the wall this was probably what i was eating bit tough as well but it was a set menu inc bottle of red we paid 45 euros for 2 couses which in this city looked to be quite reasonable. Next day we decided to walk to port olympic my god it was a long way but stopping at the beach bars all the way along for a cold beer did help! on arrival at port olympic we had a bottle of cold white wine for 8 euros again good value. Yes we did walk all the way back and yes my feet were killing me! That night we took the metro this time back to port olympic where we visited the casino which was really good lots of slots and many table games down stairs (dont forget your i.d.) it was a very populer place if you dont gamble just go to see the sights (and just how much money people are prepared to loose) I was lucky on the roulete table starting with 60 euros and coming of with 150 (i know when to quit) we took a cab back to hotel for 10 euros . next day our last day we were able to store our bags at the hotel as we had a late flight back that night . We again took metro and walked round lots of other sites parks etc all very nice. Before we collected our bags from the hotel we ate at that tapas bar opposite the hotel entrance we asked for a selection of tapas we had 2 beers 6 different tapas and 2 coffees for 20 euros and we were stuffeed. So we had a great break and would return again but i like to try diff hotels. One word of warning watch your belongings at la rambla pickpocket paradise it is.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but awfull bathroom”
Reviews.Author: AlicePantaru
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Princess for 4 nights and we enjoyed the experience... The good things about Princess: *** nice location although it is far from the city centre. It is quite, you have a mall right next to the hotel, the metro is at a 7 minutes walk and you have the bus turistic right next to the hotel's door. *** the view was spectacular especially from the elevator; *** breakfast is very good *** the best thing in the room is the bed. The bed is big, confortable *** the staff was ok, the girls from the reception were very helpfull and nice. The bad tings about Princess: *** bathroom is very unconfortable: the wc is not perfectly isolated from the rest of the room. The first morning we had the bad luck of not having water running from the robinet neither from the toilet. You can imagine the disconfort. *** the shower isn't the best quality, the water is or too warm, or too cold, you find yourself screaming from burn. *** the worse in the whole vacation was the thing that the water from the shower entered the whole bathroom, the hall and even the room. So instead of resting after a very hard day of walking through beautiful Barcelona, I had to wash the bathroom. I would come back to Princess only if I find out that they changed the bathrooms. It's a pitty because everything else about this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel but Air Conditioning not working”
Reviews.Author: sanddancer9
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a bit far out from the city centre but in quite a good location. Meaning either bus or metro rides into the centre. Privacy of the toilet and shower poor with very little room in the toilet. Storage hanging space for clothes very small so as a long stay hotel not suitable. No bath a disadvantage, no plug for the washbasin so water is wasted. AC was off for three days. A sign at the lifts appeared saying any food ot drink brought into the hotel would incur a charge! Cleanliness very good, bed very comfortable, room however a little cramped but for a short stay quite enjoyable. One thing breakfast very expensive up to £24 Eu's per person. Outside in the open air diagonal restaurant area keep way from the Chinese restaurant very poor and hygiene questionable!!

Reviews.Title: “Just go for it”
Reviews.Author: h3kamal
Reviews.Content: Nice, safe and quite location with close by easy metro excess “el maresme”. Next to shopping center with “subway, “Japanese” our favorite, ”Chinese”, “Italian”, etc… restaurants which stay open until midnight night. We had a nice room with city view at the 25th floor. We paid 124 Euros for the two of us with breakfast at Booking.com

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Comfortable Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: keithsec
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to find anything else to say that hasn't been said about this hotel. Located in the Forum area it is well away from the city centre but just a 70 cents tram ride away. Very modern rooms that are low maintenance and easy-clean. We liked the electric blinds and the blackout blind was very efficient. We booked a great deal with [--] and as well as breakfast we had a free 1 hour massage per day. Make sure you try the spa and massage facilities - very professional. Shopping Centre next door and some good bars across the road from the hotel. We used the hotel for three days pre-cruise and were well looked after. We have booked again for December!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: debar56
Reviews.Content: this is one of the best hotels i have stayed in ,great rooms great views from the ceiling to floor windows and the best breakfast buffet i have come across. Very helpfull and friendly staff.
