It is a little out from the centre of Barcelona but the metro is across the road from the hotel ,the bus touristic also stops outside the hotel and tickets can be bought at a discount from the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel C
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on lastminute.co.uk and have to say that we were delighted by Barcelona Princess. To get straight to the point, below is an overview of our experience... ~ We were offered a choice of city or ocean view... we chose the city, and I have to say that our room had spectacular views of barcelona (we were on the 24th floor). ~ The breakfast buffet is A-M-A-Z-I-N-G... absolutely anything you could possibly desire is there. It is really well staffed, so food is constantly replaced and is fresh, and it's all delicious. An abundant choice of cereals, fruits, breads, pastries, bacon, eggs, cheeses, meats etc etc etc. ~ Rooms are really modern, with floor to ceiling windows, automatic blinds (2 choices of darkness), massive bed, and brilliant shower with choice of three different nozzles. The mini bar is free (a few softies, one beer and water), and is replaced daily. ~ Although it's not right in the central of Barcelona (it's about 10-15 mins on the underground to Las Ramlas, or 45 mins walk), its actually quite nice to get some perspective of the city. It's so east getting around, that we didn't mind either walking a little bit further or utilising the very reliable public transport options...

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we've stayed in for comfort and service.”
Reviews.Author: Euroweekender50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and modern and is clean and tidy throughout. The pools are small but ideal for short sunbathing/relaxing sessions. If you suffer from vertigo the outside lifts may not suit but do give a great view up the 'Diagonal'. The hotel although at the beach end of the Avenue Diagonal is only 3 mins walk from the Metro, 1 min from the tram and seconds from the No7 bus which takes you into the city. You also have a marina within 10 mins walk and a large shopping centre within yards. Try to book the hotel with the breakfast included as it is 19 euro per person. The breakfast buffet is excellent and will suit all tastes. Complimentary mini bar excellent although not massively stocked, still nice touch though. The staff were friendly and curteous and had a reasonable standard of English (if only our Sanish was as good!). We had not booked a sea view but were given one which made the stay more enjoyable. We booked a special offer deal with the breakfast included which was a great deal, so look out for these deals - yes you have to pay up front but worth it. The Metro has an excellent service with trains every 4-5 mins. We only had a longer wait on our last days departure. Ensure you take advantage of the 10 fare ticket - you can use between two as long as you put it through twice. Get free maps and Metro maps from Information on arrival and you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience...”
Reviews.Author: Brabazon
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The other reviewers have said it all already. Very comfortable to come back to at the end of the day. It was like a modern city apartment. The view of the city stretching out below was great to fall asleep and wake up to. Breakfasts were fantastic. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Bradley65
Reviews.Content: The barcelona princess is one of the best hotels we have stayed in world wide, were frequent visitors to barcelona and always stay here. The staff are welcoming and attentive in all areas the location is great for getting around barcelona its a short distance from the metro (only 50m) and the tour busses stop outside.If you like a bit of retail therapy there is a mall located right next door it has a veriety of shops and restaurents to choose from all in all a fantastic hotel great location and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Easily the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArtoDelFunko
Reviews.Content: Stayed in several Barcelona hotels last year, plus several other euro cities, and the Princess stood above the rest. Spotlessly clean from top to bottom, bright shiny hotel, huge shopping centre (Diagonal Mar) next door and quiet enough to relax. Trams go by the door to take you straight into city centre, beach is 10 minutes walk away, friendly competent staff, great breakfast and low prices. Local restaurants for all tastes. Top class.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: philthebandit
Reviews.Content: Certainly earns its four star however is a bit souless and tries too hard to be a 'boutique' hotel which it is not. The rooms are clean and the staff are friendly. Good choice at breakfast. This hotel is good value but be aware that it is quite a way from the city but is right near the Conference Centre. We spent lots of money on taxis as my husband doesnt do trains, trams and buses. Walked miles and miles along the beach front though. Had a problem after first night as the shower leaked from the room above into our shower. Spoke to reception and they immediately offered us an upgrade to a suite so that they could repair the damage. Only disappoint ment was we asked reception to book us a restaurant as it was husband's 50th birthday and wanted to go someone special - Con Garcia. They did not do this so when we got back to hotel and asked another member of staff to phone the restaurant was full and not open for lunch on Saturday and the member of reply was 'staff were very busy that day'.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel-a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid_Traveler13
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel very much. It was hip and stylish. It was very clean. It had a decent breakfast. Fruit, eggs, bacon, sausage, a variety of breads, pastries, yogurt, juices, etc. The rooms were very nice, the glass elevators provided a great view! And it was possible to admire the views that your room did not have via the floor to ceiling windows in the corridors. They allowed me early check in, which I appreciate very much after flying all night. The staff spoke perfect English, and were helpful with directions. The room had great amenities. Nice toiletries, a plush robe and slippers. A super fun shower with jets going every which way. Great views, comfy beds, free internet *(they will provide a cable) and everything in the mini bar is FREE! ** *It's a pretty slow connection **There are only beverages in the mini bar The hotel is located on the end of the Avenida Diagonal. It's pretty far from the center of town, but there is a metro stop very near by. The metro in Barcelona is VERY easy to use, so it's really not a problem. There is a large mall adjacent to the hotel, which was handy for quick snacks or a trip to the AMAZING grocery store for supplies. You must visit the grocery store! I would suggest either taking a cab from the airport to the hotel, or take the Aerobus to Plaza Catalunya and get a cab from there. Unless you study the subway map ahead of time, you're not going to be able to find the Yellow line very easily-which is the line you need to get to the hotel. Transferring from the Red line which is located in Plaza Catalunya to the Yellow is pretty difficult with luggage. There are a lot of stairs and a long under ground walk. The cab ride from Plaza Catalunya to the hotel was about 10 euro.

Reviews.Title: “A royal good time”
Reviews.Author: COgal7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess before a cruise. We had been to Barcelona before and wanted to stay in an area away from the hustle and bustle of the Ramblas and the Princess was a great choice. It is located across the street from the new convention center and the Med. You'll have to take the Metro to see any of the tourist sights, but it is close by. We booked a suite with breakfast for around $200. The room was modern, clean, and spacious,with a wraparound balcony and a great view. Try to get high up, so you can see the whole city. The rainfall shower was awesome, good bath products, robes, slippers, even a view from the shower. It was a windy, wet night so we didn't want to venture out too far but the hotel is connected to a huge shopping mall. We got to walk around in comfort and see the locals out in force on a Saturday night strolling and shopping and eating. There were also a lot of restaurant choices, we ate at a great tapas restaurant right outside the mall. We'd read that breakfast at the Princess was great and it sure was, one of the best breakfasts we'd ever had, Catalan standards, fruits, juices, yogurts, cheeses, pastries, and hot dishes. We didn't need to eat for the rest of the day! The staff was helpful and pleasant. Free wifi too with provided cable. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbb09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the first week of January for 3 nights. The hotel is situated in the business district, at this time of the year the area was like a ghost town. The metro is 2mins away from the hotel, which made it very convenient to travel. It takes approx. 20mins to get to la Ramblas, and the metro is very easy and reliable to use. The tour bus does not stop outside the hotel in the winter months. The room minibar is complimentary, unfortunately we were not informed of this and therefore did not make use of the free complimentary drinks. The hotel boasts of it's views, however our room was faced with a brick wall and you would have to stick your face against the window and look to your right to see the seaview. There double/king/queen beds are made up of two single beds pushed together, and was told by reception all the beds were made up like this in the hotel. Not the most comfortable. When you enter the room you are immediately in the bathroom, with a see through window into the bedroom. From the bed you can see the sink and toilet, not the greatest view on either side of the room. The hotel is designed with overdone contemporary. With the low rates in January it was worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “loved the princess!”
Reviews.Author: sussexbella24
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in August and on arrival were upgraded to a suite! Fantastic views from all windows, small seating area, small outside balcony and a great bathroom - shower was amazing but did leak all over the bathroom. The breakfast was really good - a buffet that was refreshed continuously. Really good fruit selection. We were very full after breakfast! Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Slight downside was that the pool never had available chairs and the lifts sometimes took a long time but overall we would highly recommend the Princess. The mall next door was the icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: exploremore1
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. I used booking.com, they had really good rates. The price was very reasonable. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and patient about every question and request. They give you free lemonade, beer, and water in the minibar which is cool. The room was beautiful and the view was excellent. The shower was great, there were 6 different water spouts. The only problem is the water comes out on the floor, but this was a minor problem. The glass wall for the bathroom was an interesting, pretty touch. The room was very nice, it was great to wake up and go to sleep to that view of the city. You can take the metro to the hotel very easily, and you can take the tram to many different places. Just be careful, the area seems very safe and far apart from the main mix of things, but I had my purse stolen not too far from the hotel. There is a great mall right next door for shopping and also to grab food and snacks at the last minute. I loved this hotel; it's great for family or friends, and especially a romantic trip. I would stay here again definitely. They also give free robes and slippers, which they continually refresh! Also, they clean the room whenever you leave, even if it's in the afternoon (most rooms are only cleaned in the morning!).

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hali59
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels we stayed in during a holiday. The room was very comfortable, clean and modern with fantastic panoramic views over the city (my room was in the 26th floor). The reception was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was really excellent satisfying every taste. I would recommend this hotel to every one wanted to have a good time in Barcelona. The metro is very handy trnsport mean to all major attractions in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stacielea
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a package deal. We read the reviews on Trip Advisor and even though all the reviews raved about the hotel, we werent to sure what to expect. The hotel was fantastic. It was beautiful and the views from the rooms were incredible. Even though its location was out of the centre a little bit it was still very easy to get around as the train station was a 2 min walk. Because it wasnt in the centre it was a pretty quiet area which was nice, The staff were also very helpful. I would definetly stay here in the future and recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariaglyk
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona last week and stayed in Barcelona Princess hotel. I had checked out many other hotels but chose the Princess just for the city view. And i am glad i did. We were given a smoking room on the 16th floor and as soon as i got in i just loved it. Spotlessly clean, big and comfortable with a stunning view of the city. The bed was huge and really comfortable. The stuff were all very polite, no complaints at all. The hotel offers free use of the sauna and the jacuzzi, which is a great plus for the hotel and also free mini bar in the rooms. Breakfast was good, with quality products and included in our price which was only 121.5 euro per night per room through pamediakopes.gr. A very good price. The only drawback might be that the hotel is not centrally located, but this actually is not a problem because Barcelona has a really good transportation system. i definitely receommend it and if i ever go to Barcelona again, this is where i am staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great, stylish hotel; excellent view of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Bloomnormal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had 2 nights at Barcelona Princess in Nov 2008. I take the comfort in saying that I am so glad the place was my pick for our trip to Barcelona. Though the place is of 4*, it in fact deserves to be a 5* hotel. The hotel is located in an area where many other major hotels are. This is also the area where conventions and fairs take place as it seems (more like the business area). You should take the train from the BCN airport to Passeig de Gracia (this I believe is every half an hour), then change to metro L4 (Linea 4 / Yellow line) going in La Pau direction and get off at Maresme / Forum estacion to finally get to the hotel. This whole thing takes about an hour. The hotel is not located in what we would really call downtown, however, you can simply take the metro to make it to such major landmarks as La Sagrada Familia, Las Ramblas, Passeig de Gracia and Montjuic. The travel time would be around 15-20 minutes. The metro system in Barcelona is overall well arranged; do not forget to ask for a map of the city and metro system at the hotel reception. Moreover, the hotel is located right by Diagonal Mar, a shopping mall that may be of interest to those who are into shopping. Our room on the 23rd floor, very stylish, clean and well maintained, had an impressive view of the city of Barcelona including the famous La Sagrada Familia. One can also opt for a room looking onto the Mediterranean should they wish. Among the facilities the hotel offers are two outdoor swimming pools (one on the 23rd and the other on the 3rd floor), jacuzzi, sauna and a fitness center (all located on the 3rd floor). I unfortunately did not get to utilize the pools due to the season, on the other hand, the jacuzzi was a great alternative anyhow. We also enjoyed the breakfast which offered a fine array of all breakfast items. Furthermore, you can enjoy the drinks they place in your room everyday for free, this is a very fine gesture all hotels should think of offering to their guests. Overall, our stay at Barcelona Princess was great and much enjoyable and Barcelona Princess will be our choice again next time we make it to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sorrentina06
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights recently with my boyfriend and we were both extremely impressed with the hotel and the services offered. We paid a little extra for the Wellness Package which proved to be excellent value for money. We had a room on the 18th Floor which provided spectacular views over the city. The robes, slippers, free mini bar (replenished free of charge every day), toiletries (including toothbrush and toothpaste, comb, nail file etc) were very much appreciated and the included breakfast was second to none (everything you could possibly want...and more). I took advantage of the included free massage (1 per day if you want it - 1 hour for 1 person or 2 half hour sessions for both) which did wonders for my back and my boyfriend tried out the hot tub/jacuzzi and sauna. We found the staff to be always professional, helpful and friendly. As for the location? No complaints there at all. The hotel is very close to the beach and line 4 on the Metro (5 mins walk) which has many of the must visit locations including Passeig de Gracia, Barceloneta etc. There is an impressive shopping centre 3 mins from the hotel which houses a huge supermarket (should you need extra drinks, food etc) as well as many other shops. All of the above contributed to a very pleasant stay. I would rate this hotel as a very good 4 star if not a 5 star (and it's a very close call). We wouldn't stay anywhere else if (which is very likely) were to return to Barcelona in the future and would certainly recommend it to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: Carolorphil
Reviews.Content: Booked with Superbreak for £107 BB a night. Got a double room on the 26th top floor with fantastic views. The staff were as good as you can get, location 100 yards from the tube, true 4 star. Superb breakfast selection. If only British hotels could match this price and service!! You can always find little faults if you want to, but, the main thing is that this is a great hotel and for value for money you will not beat it. Barcelona rates as one of the best cities ever visited, couldn't do it all and will have to go back. Will stay here again without any boubt. Carol and Phil, Oswestry.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: BrumTravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel based on reviews on trip advisor. I was a little sceptical of the location (being on the outskirts of the main tourist centre) but I was eventually persuaded one by the reviews and two by the competitive price. Turns out that its location was its biggest pull. We were given a room on the 17th floor, opened the blind which sheilds the floor to ceiling / wall to wall window to see the most amazing view of the city. It was even better at night. The room was very trendy too. There was an amazing shower with jets and what i can only refer to as a waterfall shower. Location wise, it was actually rather good. Attractions in Barcelona are pretty spread out so it's best to get to terms with the metro system. There is a metro stop literally minutes away and you can be in the centre within 15 minutes of leaving the hotel. If you are not so keen on using the metro there was a stop for the open top tourist bus right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, geat views”
Reviews.Author: NPWParis
Reviews.Content: This hotel, which we didn't know beforehand, turned out to be a great value choice for a weekend in Barcelona. The rate was 120 euros per night for two including full breakfast. This hotel is a new tower block at the seaward end of the Diagonal, a little too far from the centre to walk but with metro, tram and bus connections, and great views over the Mediterranean and the city. Rooms are cleverly designed to make the best use of space and the warm wooden panelling is remarkably lavish given the room rates. The design in the rest of the hotel is far more convincing than at La Florida up on Tibidabo, where I stayed for the previous two nights, and at half the price. The breakfast room is fairly spartan but the buffets are unusually generous and there's something for everyone: eggs, bacon and so on, but also grilled vegetables, Spanish specialities and a vast selection of pastries. A very good base for visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Don;t Go past This One !!”
Reviews.Author: janRotoruaNewZealand
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than we had expected,asked for a floor higher than the 20th story and we got the 26th floor.free Lemonade,coke.water each day in your fridge,free wireless internet connection,the open top tourist bus stops right out side,the breakfast is amazing,very helpful and friendly staff. our rate was $220 including breakfast a night. only moan was the swimming pool was a little small.our room looked out over the ocean and we saw the sun rise each morning.Magic hotel!!Has a 24 hour check in so your room is always ready.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend break!”
Reviews.Author: LondonersUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend - loved the room, comfy beds & complimentary minibar! We were on the 7th floor so we had great views.. Our bathroom was fine & unlike other reviews had no leakage or lack of privacy! The pool areas & bars were very quiet & often devoid of any staff but we didn't use the pools anyway. As we were room only, we would go for breakfast at the little cafe snack place opposite the hotel which was very popular with guests doing the same thng, & we would sit outside in the sunshine while we ate.. The hotel isn't centrally located but it was very easy to get about on the Metro (we bought a 2 day travelcard which made it easy) & was actually nice to come back to, after the hustle & bustle of the main tourist areas. I would definitely stay here agin when I'm back in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HonkHonk
Reviews.Content: This is really a beautiful hotel. My room was very, very nice. It is a very modern design but very comfortable and warm. The views of Barcelona and the Mediterranean were excellent. They have a large breakfast spread that is part of the room price. The only weird thing about the room was the shower, which was a full body thing with multiple shower heads. Problem is that the shower design did not keep the water from blasting out onto the bathroom floor anytime the door was open, and the door was so leaky it was a flood on the bathroom floor. Water was also leaking through the ceiling from the bathroom above me. Great idea, poor design.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TM_Trademark
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Views are fabulous. Hotel staff was helpful and polite. Enjoyed the complimentary minibar and the great bathroom shower. Bed was firm but comfortable. The blackout shades on the window and glass bathroom wall worked well. Even though the hotel isn't very close to the main tourist areas, we had no problem using the subway and tram to get around. When connecting to different lines in the subway, there are often many stairs involved so this may not work well for someone with limited mobility. Barcelona is beautiful, with lots of interesting architecture. We went through Casa Battlo and saw other Gaudi buildings. Also enjoyed going to the Olympic stadium and Spanish Village on Montjuic.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: KT79
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to Barcelona for a weekend break and prior to booking spent a lot of time researching hotels and eventually selected the Barcelona Princess. The hotel is slightly out of town but despite this it has excellent transport links and is on the tourist sightseeing bus route. The breakfast buffet was excellent and catered for all tastes. The hotel room was excellent and the views both from the room and the hotel lift were amazing. The only annoyance was that the double bed was two singles pushed together and they had a habit of moving so you'd end up falling down the middle. The bathroom was quite open plan but there was a privacy blind and the shower with it's numerous outlets/heads was out of this world. We had an excellent time staying at the Princess and would definitely recommend it and would return there.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Thomh21
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at Princess hotel and had a good stay. Staff are friendly and helpful and all areas of the hotel are nice and well kept, both pools and the gym were a bit smaller than billed on their website but still ok! Room was nice with a great sea view, having free mini bar and internet in the room was fab!! Only downside was the bathroom, the door handle was broken and sellotaped on for the whole duration of our stay! We had no plug for the sink and trying to wash your face or shave was difficult due to the fact the taps get in the way and don't move and the mirror was to the side resulting in water all over the floor! The hotel location is a bit out of town but the nearby Metro or tourist bus stop made it handy enough! If you're looking for breakfast go for a place in the Diagnoal Mar shopping Centre next door plenty to choose from and much better price that the hotel!! All in all a pleasant stay, it's not a 'wow' luxury hotel it's nice, modern and clean at a reasonable price. Oh and Barcelona is 'wow' what a great city!

Reviews.Title: “barcelona trip”
Reviews.Author: katieoldman
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend went to barcelona for a short holiday to relax, the barcelona princess met all our needs, the food was great, the pools were brill and the hotel staff did every thing to make us happy. if you are looking for a quite, relaxing spot in barcelona this is the place for you, the beach is a five minute walk and is beautiful and also quite!!!! there are alot of places to eat and the staff there are also friendly and willing it help you with any questions!!! i really had a lovely time in barcelona and also at the hotel, i would defo go back to barcelona and to barcelona princess!!!! by the way watch out for money grabbing taxi drivers and thieves in the market!!!

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in Barcelona's Crown”
Reviews.Author: ash04
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner were really rather picky when choosing our hotel and settled upon the Princess due to it's positive reviews and reputation of not being very child friendly; nothing ruins my relaxing holiday more than screaming kids in the hotel pool. Although the Princess is further than most hotels from both the airport and the main attractions of Barcelona, it's proximity to a tube station, a major tram route and various bus stops meant that we benefitted from all of the advantages of being away from the hub of the city with very few disadvantages. Also, it is right next to a mall with plenty of shops, bars and restaurants should you not feel up to travelling back to the old city or to the Ramblas for dinner. The staff were courteaous and very helpful; we spent our first night in the hotel bar conversing with staff who were fluent in English and only too happy to tell us a few local secrets.They were also invaluable in helping us find our way around, even getting us a map to mark out places of interest, and the preferred routes to get there, on it. The room was beautiful and, up until then, and since, I am yet to stay in one with such a spectacular view. And we were only on the 14th floor. The shower was an experience in itself with 3 differant shower heads. The hotel was always a cool and refreshing welcome from the unrelenting heat of the day. The pools, although small, were uncrowded. Again, the views from the pool on the 27th floor were astounding. Obviously I am gushing now so I think it is time for the very few negatives: 1) the double bed was 2 singles pushed together and this can be annoying when they begin to move apart. 2) the bathroom is glass and although the cubicles are frosted glass it can still be a bit daunting to use the facilities woth another person in the room. 3) the amazing shower is more suited to someone of normal height. Thsoe alot smaller than average may find alot of powerful water jets heading straight for their face of the back of their head instead of their body. 4) The pool on the 4th floor received very little sun during the day and, owing to the hotel's proximity to the sea, it got a bit chilly, even in August. 5) The hotel had a policy that no food be brought into the hotel which was a bit annoying when you took into consideration just how expensive the hotel restaurant was for food. Overall, this is a hotel that MUST be sampled if you get the chance to go to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Away from centre though.”
Reviews.Author: mccclan
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Booked 3 rooms and all were of same high quality. Really nice furnishings and fantastic views. Amazing showers and very clean, modern layout. FREE yes FREE mini bar which included 1 beer, 2 water, 1 Coke and 1 Lemonade. We slept in for breckie as blackout blinds are amazing. There is great shopping mall next door but it is a treck into town. We did walk were knackered. Only one other point, we booked 3 rooms with two being for kids. If you book the pay per view channels the porn is automatically on the list. Full on stuff too. My eight year old daughter was agog initially as we were caught unawares when browsing the movies. Teenage boys were delighted though.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and comfortable with great views!”
Reviews.Author: moonlight_sonata
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Princess for 7 days in August. I researched a lot before choosing this hotel and decided upon this one based on the reviews, visitor photos and balcony with seaview. I was very impressed with the hotel. It is great value for money. It is a little far out from the centre but the tram & bus stops right outside and metro only 2 minute walk (20 mins into centre) Only 5 mins walk to beach and you can take a nice 25 min stroll along the sea until you reach the centre of BCN. Also taxi to the centre is only 10 euros. If your looking for a relaxing quiet holiday hotel, then this is your one. However, if your looking for an action packed holiday with little traveling to the action, then the centre is better. I would definitely stay here again. There were a few downsides but the positive points about the hotel out-way the negatives. Postitives - modern, clean and comfortable - free mini bar stocked daily (1 still water/1 sparkling water/1 coke, 1 lemonade/1 beer) - balcony w/ sea view (bit more expensive but worth it) - room cleaned daily - shopping mall w/ restaurants & supermarket just next door - close to metro/tram/bus - great views from room/lifts/top floor pool area - pool area stocked with towels - 1 pool has bar area - amazing power shower w/ 3 different types of shower heads - internal aircon, cant hear it but it does the trick! - 2 computers w/ free internet access and printer - 5-10 minutes walk to beach - located in a much more spacious area & quieter than central hotels - bed sheets & pillows soft and very comfortable! Negatives - No one offered to take our bags to our room which I'd expect for a 3/4 star hotel - jacuzzi wasn't working & had to wait 1/2 hour for someone to come & fix it & another 1/2 hour before it was fixed. - Jacuzzi lights were not working. - light bulb in room broke & room in general was very darkly lit. - Balcony was a bit small & didn't look very safe & had no seating area but we brought seats out from the room. - only had 2 computers to use internet and one was broken but fixed within the hour - bed was 2 singles put together & not one double bed!! (i hate when hotels do this!!) - pool area small / not enough sun loungers - restaurant over priced but cheaper restaurants in shopping mall next door make up for it - Close to factories/building work going on so a little loud (Esp when balcony door is open) - shower leaked out onto bathroom floor - tv didnt have many channels in english but anyway didn't go there to watch tv!

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars!!!”
Reviews.Author: Violet_Rita
Reviews.Content: Barcelona Princess is a really nice hotel for everyone who want to visit Barcelona. It is located near everything that is important for a tourist: bus stations, undergound stations, roads, a shopping centre, a large park and a wonderful beach. Furthermore, its accomodation is superbe. The rooms are really modern and spacious, the bar and the restaurants are confortable and serve good meals and there is also places for fun, such as big rooms, gymnasium and swimming pools. It is also necessary to mention the fact that the staff is very friendly, suportive and helpful. I had a medical accident there, and if it wasn't for them, I would have find trouble to solve it in an unknown city for me! Final recommendantion: book your stay to Princess Barcelona Hotel, because you will never find such a friendly and comportable hotel like this!

Reviews.Title: “This relaxing hotel complements the city hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: wise_horse
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! The location, while just a little far from the centre, was good. Close to the beach, and away from the noise of the city. Very close to the metro and tram too. Our room was very stylish with a very comfy bed. We were lucky to be high up and have a balcony so that we could enjoy the views across the city. The amount of glass walls and walkways was rather unnerving at first but I soon got used to it. Only 1 beer per couple in the mini-bar though. I loved the rooftop pool with the views out to sea. The breakfast was plentiful and varied. And the service was excellent. I think our trip to Barcelona would have been very different if we had not been in this hotel. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: rosie34
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel and perfect for exploring Barcelona. It is so easy to get around - the tourist bus stops right outside, tube line 2 min walk away which takes you directly to the best nightlife, restaurants, bars etc). I found the staff to be very helpful and the rooms clean and well equipped. It is attached to a brilliant shopping centre too if you like a bit of retail therapy! I got it at a great price, including breakfast which was well worth the trouble to find! Loved the pool and views! Cant fault it, would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: iandi08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short city break and it was fantastic! Check in was easy and we were upgraded to a junior suite. Our room was a great size with free mini bar which was replenished every day with water, coke, lemonade and a bottle of lager. The room was very clean and we were provided with clean towels, robes and slippers daily. We didn't book for breakfast and it was expensive to add on. However, we found lovely cafes in the centre to have a lazy morning breakfast so didn't miss it. The pool at the top of the hotel is long and very narrow but perfect for a short dip after all that sight seeing. There is also a second pool on the third floor with a lounge and bar area. The hotel is situated a bit out of the city but the hop on hop off bus stops right outside which makes travelling very easy. There is also a metro stop very close by and the trains run quite late, again making it easy to get about. We work in London so are used to the tube system, perhaps others might not want to use this mode of transport late at night, although we felt perfectly safe. It was only a 20 minute journey on the metro so a taxi would be quicker. There are also regular buses if you can figure them out! The hotel is perfect for the beach, just a short walk away. The beach, although man made, is brilliant. A perfect contrast to the busy city. Next door to the hotel is a huge shopping centre with lots of shops, including a large supermarket in the basement. As part of the centre there is a selection of restaurants which are outside and in a pedestrian area. They are great for eating, drinking and watching the world go by. Nice alternative rather than going back into the centre. The food here was better than that in the hugely touristy areas. Every visitor to Barcelona must get on the hop on hop off bus tour - as city tours go, it's the best I've been on. There are 3 routes and you can chop and change as much as you want. They visit all the must see sights of Barcelona and it gives you an opportunity to rest your legs! Please don't be put off this hotel because of the location - it's really great!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Arrogant Staff”
Reviews.Author: pskuse
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great, the staff in the resturant and pool bar seemed to be put out by asking for a table for breakfast or ordering drinks. Customer Care Training is in Urgent Need i would not go back because of this.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: yourterriblemuriel
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Princess for just one night during a South of France holiday. It was definately worth the 2 hour drive, and we wished we could have stayed longer. The bedroom was excellent, the bed was pristine and so comfortable, and the shower was the best i have ever experienced! Everything felt clean and fresh, penty of soft white towels, and the electronic blind was fabulous. Amazing view across the city and you felt like you were in a penthouse suite. The black out blind was great too as you could have a decent lie in if you wanted to. Great glossy guide book by the bed too. Dont get too excited about the free minibar - it was only a couple of soft drinks, and some water, but it was a great touch. Didnt rate the breakfast that much, but it didnt matter. Staff were quite rude and everything seemed to run out - that might have been because we only managed to stagger there 10 mins before it was finishing. The pool on the 23rd floor was amazing. The only downside was not enough sun longers compared to the size of the hotel, and in peak season as well so it was pretty packed. we had to make do with towels (which were provided as you reached the pool) on the floor - bit uncomfortable and they could easily remedy this. But it was brilliant up there, perfect for sunbathing. The bar at reception I wouldnt bother with. Very expensive and we were there on a saturday night and it was dead. We got a cab (10 euros) to the Harbour where we had a fantastic night. I wouldnt hesitate to go back. For £90 a room, you cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “A bit too far out...”
Reviews.Author: Holmesey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not bad, clean and well maintained. Bedrooms are on the small side and as the beds are quite large it feels a little bit claustrophobic. Extras such as breakfast and laundry are expensive. The staff seemed not bothered most of the time and I often had to grab someones attention even though I was the only person standing at the counter! However, my biggest gripe is the distance from the centre of Barcelona. Despite previous comments I found the journey arduous. The Metro is quite close but it's still a 20 minute ride to Cataluyna station. It was sometimes hard to get taxis in the evening, particularly from 8 o'clock onwards and cost about 12 euro to get to the city. However Barcelona can be difficult to get a taxi from in the early hours and I spent over an hour trying to hail a cab one night wishing my hotel was more central. The princess is not a bad hotel and the beach around teh corner is great however I would highly recommend staying more central.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: mse7827
Reviews.Content: I researched many hotels in Barcelona and landed on this one after reading multiple reviews and visiting the website. It turns out I made a great decision. A truly modern hotel with excellent amenities: free internet cable, free beverages in the mini fridge and an excellent breakfast buffet. It was a little outside of the city center but very close to the Maresme metro stop and a quick walk to the beaches. The only downside was the limited number of chaise lounges by the pool, but the rest of the hotel more than made up for it. For the price we paid and the quality of the hotel I would 100% stay here on my next visit to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nat0712
Reviews.Content: Couldn't find fault with the hotel. It isn't in the centre which may put some people off but it really shouldn't. The staff were incredibly friendly and always on hand to answer any questions. The room was larger than expected and the bed was extremely comfy. The tram stop is a 2 minute walk away from the hotel and there are regular buses to the centre too. We also took a taxi a couple of times which cost around 10 euros each way. The shopping centre next door provided us with something quick and easy to do while the rain poured down. The one problem we had was the rain, it would seem that the building didn't cope well, there were a few leaks from all of the glass. Staff were constantly making sure water was dried up so this didn't matter. I would definately recommend this hotel don't be put off by the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AudyLongford
Reviews.Content: All I can say is this was the perfect hotel to stay in. The Metro is literally 2 minutes away. There are buses and trams but the metro was so easy, didnt need taxis or any other transport. The room was fabulous. The minibar was re-stocked every day, 2 swimming pools, sauna, small gym and jacuzzi (all free). They had robes and slippers, shaving gear, toothbrush etc. In fact if you just had your passport with you, you'd have no problems here. There's a Shopping Centre right next door. There was a carnival / fairground overlooking the sea less than 5 minutes away. The view was unbelievable, overlooking City Centre. Honestly I cannot find one thing that is bad to say about this hotel. The staff were really friendly. The breakfast buffet is probably one of the best I've ever had in all of the places Ive been to in Europe. It was so easy to get around Barcelona and really nice to come back to a place that was peaceful. The airport train leaves you in Station de Franca (train was free from airport !) and go around the corner and get the metro to Forum, up the steps turn right and less than 2 minutes the Hotel is in front of you. I read all the reviews before I left and was worried it was far away from the sights but that is so not true. Enjoy it was absolutely wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “watch out for the con men!!”
Reviews.Author: JKLWales
Reviews.Content: 7th May 2008 Stayed at the Barcelona Princess hotel for a long weekend in April. Hotel very clean and comfortable with views over the city. The outdoor pool was closed as was the pool bar so the amenities were not as advertised by the hotel. The breakfast was outstanding with a wide selection although very pricey if not booked beforehand. The staff were very helpful when we had to return home a day early due to a situation at home. The metro was easy to use and people were happy to help out if you did not understand the system at first. The shopping mall next to the hotel was huge with many eating places although a bit pricey for what it was - eating in the middle of thousands of people with the accompanying noise! BEWARE of the conmen operating on Las Ramblas!!! We were conned by a gang and lost some money. The police were not interested in helping us and this soured our holiday to such an extent we won't be returning to Spain again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Princess”
Reviews.Author: Steampiper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Easter holiday. Rooms were very roomy and spotless! It was nice to have the free internet access, plus robe and slippers and other amenities. The bedroom/bathroom was separated by a door that kept out any hallway noise. It was nice and quiet...and most of all, clean. The staff was the best! One of the members of our event had a pickpocket occurance, and the hotel staff went out of their way to help him. Breakfast buffet is a bit pricey..17 Euros, but it's nice to try at least once. Diagonal Mar shopping mall is attached to the hotel. Nice boutiques and eateries there, and also a bank next door to change your currency. Metro is across the street from the hotel, and easy to use and get around town. But, watch out for the pickpockets. They were running all over during the Easter break targeting tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: B0wz
Reviews.Content: A 20 minute taxi drive from the airport this hotel is nicely situated on the outskirts of the city, near the brand new forum section of barcelona. The hotel is ideal for people looking for a comfortable stay away from the hussle of the city but close to the beach. The location for the beach in the summer is fantastic, only about a 5 minute walk. And although outside the city center a bus stop right outside the hotel means that this problem is solved within 10 minutes. We booked into the hotel late in the evening and were quickly allocated a room. The room was spacious without being too big. The minibar was well stocked with drinks and the bathroom was very impressive. We also had a balcony which overlooked the main road into the city, i had expected it to be noisey but the car traffic 15 floors below really was not noticable. The hotel features a pool which was my only complaint, the pool on the top floor was reasonably warm when the sun was on it but when the sun went over at about 4pm the pool quickly cooled down and really was a little too cold. Also the top floor pool section has limited seating and we found that all the seats were quickly taken by about 8am. The pool on the 3rd floor was even worse, i only ventured into it once and it was really unbearably cold (this was suprising because the outside temp was 28 - 35 Oc. This meant the pools in the hotel were a bit disappointing. The jacuzzi was pleasent and usually there was space to use it. Only on 2 occasions it was full. The sauna was the best part of the hotel in terms of ease of use, they have 2 seperate saunas and they were always empty meaning a nice relaxing 30 minutes was more or less guarenteed. The food in the hotel was pleasant, not too pricey and had reasonably big portions. The drinks at the bar at the front of the hotel were quite expensive but my god! 8 Euros for a jack daniels and i think he gave me the whole bottle!! Overall the hotel well worth 4 star, good bedrooms, good service near to the beach and a short bus ride to the city center. Would come back to this hotel again if i was looking for a relaxing hotel near the beach in Europes best city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyuk85
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel over the Easter weekend for 3 nights. Its a lovely modern hotel. The check in staff were polite and helpful when we checked in and we could go to our room right away at 12noon. The room was lovely and clean. I will list the bad points of the hotel first: - Kingsize bed was infact 2 single beds pushed together, very annoying as if you lay in the middle this split apart and you fell down the middle - No plug near a mirror, meaning if you had hair straitners or tongs etc you had no mirror to sit in front of (there was a hair dryer and shaving plug near the mirror though) - The shower was a nice shower but never powerful, it only went powerful if you had on scorching hot - The lifts were very slow, waited 10 minutes for a lift, and there are 3 of them!! - Breakfast was cold - Room service food wasnt nice Good points: - The selection of the breakfast was marvellous and even though it wasnt really hot, it was still good - Staff very polite - Very clean and modern - Free minibar, dressing gowns and slippers - The view from 26th floor is amazing, even if you dont stay on it, take the lift up for photos - Its right by a metro stop and next to a lovely shopping centre - Electric black out blinds, they were wonderful - Bar downstairs is very nice and relaxing This hotel isnt in the centre of the city, but i would always stay here again as was 10 mins from the centre and in the centre its a lot of hustle and bustle and i liked that when we left the city we could escape that and relax. I loved Barcelona but thought the Spanish people were not very friendly to tourists, many did not speak English. One taxi driver chucked us out of his taxi because we did not speak Spanish even though we gave him the name of our hotel, the road name and the shopping centre name, he started shouting at us and the few words i know in Spanish i knew this to be shouting abuse at us. was very scary.

Reviews.Title: “High tech hotel, great views!”
Reviews.Author: quattromonti
Reviews.Content: The Princess Hotel is located at the end of the Diagonal, just next to the Diagonal Mar shopping center (Fnac, Media Markt, Zara, Mango, Vips, Cortefields...) ; the best in barcelona! Rooms are not very big but the view makes up for it! There is a roof top swimming pool with a superb view over the sea!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sazzlestravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Barcelona Princess last March and have just booked to stay in it again in June. This is one of the nicest hotels that I have ever stayed in. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very clean. We also found the rooms very quiet and the blackout blinds are brill for a good night's sleep. The enormous window in the room is ideal for watching the word go by if you fancy a lazy evening. We didnt get around to checking out the restaurant or bar but we are hoping to try them out on our next visit. The shopping mal next door is also great for shopping and for meals. Although the Princess isnt central, its not hard to reach all the attractions if you dont mind using the Metro. There is a Metro stop less than 5 mins walk away. From here you can get on a Bus or Train to take you to the airport so no need for pricey taxi's.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: lots54
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a short break staying at the Barcelona Princess Hotel. All in all, this was a fantastic hotel. I would recommend asking for a room as high up as possible (as long as you don't suffer from vertigo!) with the city view. You get views from the huge windows across the entire city. Free mini bar was useful and the bathroom and blackout blinds were great. Although the hotel is not in the centre of Barcelona, it was very easy to get round the city. There is a metro station (El Maresme Forum I) within 2 minutes walking distance from the hotel, and you can get into central Barcelona in about 10 minutes on the metro. I would highly recommend using the metro, as it is a very quick and cheap way to get around. The shopping centre is loacted next to the hotel. Within this you can find a huge supermarket, although the restaurants are all chain restaurants so I would recommend venturing further into the city to eat. Barcelenta has some good restaurants by the port, particulalry if you like fish. Some quick tips? If your going to use the public transport, purchase a T10 ticket at any of the metro or train terminals. This costs about 7 EUROS and lasts for 10 journeys on any of the public transport options. The open top bus tours are a good way of seeing the city and you can hop on and hop off. although be carful as these can be fairly busy. All in all a great hotel in a great part of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChocolateRain
Reviews.Content: A fantastic modern hotel. Not in the centre of Barcelona but does have a shopping centre and restaurants next to it. We stayed on the 26th floor so the views were fantastic and you can see the major tourist sites and the sea. About 5 mins from the beach. Staff were friendly. Free minibar but limited drinks (one beer, one coke, one lemonade and two bottles of sparkling water.) Breakfast is not included and quite expensive - There are lots of restaurants and cafes around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: theperks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelona Princess around 18 months ago and have been very lazy about writing the review. This is no refection on the hotel, just me being lazy . . . . . The hotel is brilliant, couldn't fault it. Accepted it's not in the centre of the city but for me that's part of the appeal, it's very close (two minute walk tops) to a metro station and a tram stop to get in and out of town and being near apartment blocks you can get a feel for how the locals live in this great city. There's also a shopping centre nearby (again two minute walk) with bars, basic restaurants (Pizza Express) and a supermarket . The hotel is very modern with professional friendly staff, spotless rooms with the most amazing views of the city (as another member said, ask for a city view) and really cool features like electric blackout blinds and and insanely brilliant shower. Don't let the location put you off, this is what makes it more affordable as if this was in the centre it'd cost double to stay here, it is easy to get to the sights and we even walked it more than once. Going to Barcelona, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great Mall next door!”
Reviews.Author: mcbabe2223
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend here for his 18th birthday in March 2006, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay! Totally modern and chic, it's a perfect base that is completely luxurious. the rooms, though small are all that you need. I'm more a bath person but the showers in the rooms are just incredible! I never wanted to get out, they were like something you see on Cribs! The beds were huge and very comfortable and spacious and the help of a nice big fridge was a bonus, it meant food could be bought and kept withough going bad. Right next door to this hotel was the Diagonal Mar, a fab shopping mall with some lovely restaurants and cafes. We ate at alot of these during our 5 days in barcelona as they were inexpensive and really lovely. It helped that we can speak quite good spanish as this area is more spanish speaking than others. Try the metro for a good way to get around, it's cheap and reliable. And try the Barcleona Zoo as a fun day out, it was inexpensive and we had a good day. The only problem with this hotel was the check-in lady, who was quite rude and snotty and repeatedly started chatting away in Spanish to someone else as I was talking to her, she obviously didn't know I could understand her. Other than her rudeness the hotel is just lovely and a great place to call home for a short visit. If it's more than a 5 day jaunt you're after I'd probably say try a different hotel as the rooms are just not big enough for a long stay. Maybe a few nights in the Barcelona Princess and a few nights in another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!! can even see the Famous chapel from my room”
Reviews.Author: mickeymlai
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel, I stayed there in 2005 June, but I believe it is still good next to the beach and is not consider to be far from the city...(well spain has very good transport I would say) to reach the city centre, either by bus or tube and is really close.... Also there's is a supermarket right next to it...also restaurants.. whatelse you wanted to know... People are very friendly at the reception desk as well...and its 24 hour desk...room is nice and big...you will love it..either you are a picky person or not...high tech, luxury etc!! Just ask for a high level floor when you book it...is absolutely lovely with the price that you are paying...

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: AtlPony
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelona Princess about 1 year and a half ago and were so impressed. For the price we paid, we couldn't believe how nice it was. We were pretty tired from traveling by train for a whole day upon our arrival. The bed was amazing! Blackout shades made the room so quiet and dark - best sleep I've ever had in my life. And the hotel was just beautiful. Everything was so clean and modern. Service was impeccable. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Modern elegant but a bit out of town”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: This is a modern Hotel to the North of the city. It is in a suburb dominated by the conference centre and the largest shopping mall in Barcelona. There isnt a lot to do near the hotel, but it is right next to a tram line and an underground station, so you can be in the heart of the city in a few minutes. Its is a shame not to stay right in the heart of the city, so this would not be my first choice, but it is clean, modern with friendly staff. Overall not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel for New Year”
Reviews.Author: cornishtim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with friends for New Year 2008 and had a great time. Upon checking in it did appear that they didn't have our rooms; however I think this was more down to Expedia's fault than the hotel's and was swiftly resolved by the multi-lingual check in staff. We stayed in a normal room and it was great - very clean, free mini-bar, views of the sea and a super king bed. There was no bath. but the shower was powerful with extra jets. The only bar open when we were there was the Corner bar on the ground floor - this was probably more to the time of year - it was nice and clean with friendly, helpful staff. If you're staying here for business then you probably can't do better. If you're staying for personal holiday, then it's very nice and I would recommend it. If you're after an intimate, cosy, boutique-style hotel, then this probably doesn't quite fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but a bit far out”
Reviews.Author: loobs40
Reviews.Content: I booked B&B through Alpharooms for my son and I. Checking In and Checking Out was pleasant and efficient. Room clean with good bathroom facilites and comfortable beds, though those unused to firm beds may not consider that to be the case. There is also a free mini bar with soft drinks Breakfast was the usual extensive buffet found in many hotels, though all I wanted was a plain croissant (not available) and a coffee. Not worth the €19 it was advertised at. Dinner looked very expensive so we chose to eat in the centre of Barcelona The hotel is quite far out from the centre of Barcelona, and although there is a good Metro service and bus service (no 7 goes to Passieg de Gracia) it felt like we were forever travelling. Next time we go, we will probably look for accommodation more central

Reviews.Title: “what a cool hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shopaholic1981
Reviews.Content: This is a VERY cool hotel - I have to say I loved it. The location is a bit out of the city centre but there is a metro stop about 100m away from the hotel and a tram stop just up the road also so the distance shouldnt be a problem. it is right next door to a huge shopping centre and food court. There is also a lovely quiet beach a short distance away by foot. The views from the room are amazing. Huge big windows provide you with a fabulous view over the city. The pools are quite small I have to say but they are lovely to sit and relax at after a long hot day shopping/sight-seeing. I have recommended this hotel to loads of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: gareth78
Reviews.Content: I travelled to this hotel with my wife and son to visit my parents who keep a boat in Barcelona. From the website the hotel looks very impressive. On arrival the check in staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed on the 19th floor and our room was clean but a little small and not child friendly at all. The hotel is ultra modern and has all electric blinds, sharp edges and glass everywhere, not great when you've got a 6 month old crawling round. To visit the pool you need to have a strong stomach to cross the glass bridge on the twenty something floor between the two blocks. The pools are dissapointing and very cold, although you have the benefit of splashing people on the pavement below. I would not rush to stay here again, it lacked warmth and charm but did the job none the less.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Aquarius
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept 2007, Found the staff friendly & helpful. Hotel is located approx 50m from an entrance to the Diagonal Mar shopping centre. The centre has loads of quality shops located over 3 floors, Plenty of restaurants are available on the 3rd floor & i would recommend the Yellow Thai curry at the thai restaurant !. Transport is great from here, The tourist bus stops right outside the hotel, Recommend you buy the 2 day pass (only costs you an extra 4 euros!), Journey into the city takes about 15 mins, You have 3 routes that will take you all around the city (If you get the chance recommend the Gaudi Park on the red route, Walk right to the top of the hill for some amazing views !), Only downside is the last bus is at 9pm. The metro is only about 2 mins walk from the hotel. The rooms were great, Excellent beds & the power shower was fantastic !. The views from the 23rd floor are good, The lifts are made of glass & are on the outside of the building so grab your camera's for some amazing views frm the top of the 26th floor !. Overall i would recommend this hotel to anyone, It's just the right distance from the city....... & madness of Las Ramblas ! lol

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: T-dot_Traveller_76
Reviews.Content: I booked the Barcelona Princess for 2 nights starting August 31st through an Air Canada website and I was a little concerned that the bookings would work, but all my fears were absolved once I arrived. I thought the staff were very pleasant, and considering my wife and I were very early, they had no problem checking us in right away. The room was a decent size, and coming from North America I was a little concerned about that. All the amenities were sufficient and I really like the fact that the mini bar had a few beverages free of charge. The location of the hotel is a little away from the main hub of town, however, the public transportation in Barcelona is so good that it doesn't really matter. All in all I found the hotel to be great and definitley would recommend anyone booking their vacation here.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic stay - don't listen to all the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: TheChambers
Reviews.Content: I must say I was worried after booking a long weekend at the Barcelona Princess and reading all the negative reviews on Trip Advisor. However, we had a fantastic stay at the hotel and didn't experience ANY of the problems other people seemed to. Examples:- 1. Check-in. We arrived at the hotel about 9.30pm and were literally in our room unpacking by about 9.40pm. The reception staff were efficient and welcoming. 2. Rooms. Yes they are not huge rooms but ample room for a weekend base. They were very modern and extremely clean. The beds were one of the most comfortable beds I have stayed in with plenty of room & the pillows very comfortable. The Shower DID NOT LEAK at all into the main bathroom area. We were on the 22nd floor and had amazing views over Barcelona. The air con worked well and the black-out blinds are ideal for cutting out that early morning sun that wakes you up!! 3. Pools. In fairness we spent most of our time at the beach (a pleasant 10 min walk). We did however sit by the pool on the 23rd floor on our final day. Yes there are limited beds but the decking and pool area are very clean. I would say that the only negative was the breakfast and the cost (we were room only). Most mornings we either went into the shopping centre next door (which by the way is great and has the usual shops Zara and Mango and a lovely supermarket) for a coffee and croissant or went to the cafe opposite the hotel and sat outside for breakfast. Location wise the hotel is great. You are 10 mins from the beach as I mentioned and 5 mins in a taxi to Port Olympic and the Hotel Arts (which by the way is worth a visit for a few cocktails). You are also only 10mins taxi to Las Ramblas. I would DEFINITELY RETURN to this hotel and I hope that this review has relieved any doubts you may have about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great showers, but grumpy uncaring staff and bad location.”
Reviews.Author: baah-humbug
Reviews.Content: What a shame. This is a stunning building with great views and lovely showers. However, the staff are grumpy and there is a big problem with noise at night from a nearby club. When we stayed the metro branch that went near the hotel was closed for maintenance (which was told to us with an uncaring shrug from the reception staff) so we went by bus. Full of local colour but very slow, stopping every 25 metres or so. The area around is dead (except for the shopping arcade next door) and very unlike the rest of Barcelona which is buzzy and fun. I didn't feel like the staff cared who came and went, or whether we were enjoying ourselves or not. A very contemporary, minimalist interior. Which is great, except that it is really starting to show signs of wear and tear already. To sum up, this hotel lacks a feeling of care and attention (either to the guests or to the fabric of the hotel itself). In retrospect we would definitely have stayed nearer the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Grahamlj
Reviews.Content: After some of the previous reviews on the Hotel I was expecting a Catalna type of Fawlty Towers for the 5 night stay that I had booked . However I found the hotel to be conveniently located, the rooms comfy with good air con, the staff to be friendly from the receptionist to the bar staff and the pools to be ok The facilites were good and my wife and children thought it was one of the better hotels they have stayed in to the extent I have been puzzled by some of the previous comments made by fellow travellers. The Bus Turistic stops right outside the hotel and that is worth getting a 2 day pass to use as does a bus taking you to the 4 main beaches in Barcelona. there is a shopping mall with lots of rather undistinguished restaurants and you're better off eating near Las Ramblas or by the Olympic village where it is wall to wall restaurants. One thing worth noting Barca is a big city well spread out with no Sky scrapers so it does take a while to get anywhere. Do watch out for petty crime & don't carry a hand bag or wallet in back pocket. All in all an enjoyable 5 night stay at a good quality hotel with good local amenities

Reviews.Title: “everything you need to know about the princess!”
Reviews.Author: pippi-pie
Reviews.Content: me and my family stayed at the princess in july 06. upon arrival we had no problem finding the princess, and when we arrived the hotel looked very impressive inside and out. while checking in we were delayed though because of the gentlemen next to us complaining about the hotel and wanted the manager and his money back! i can now see why. the rooms were very spacious and nice except the shower that leaked over the entire bathroom everytime you used it. also when we were there there was a storm and the whole corridor outside our room was flooded . the pools however were very nice, but slighty to small for all the guests in the hotel. the hotel resteraunt was always empty, perhaps because it was so expensive! so we walked to the restaurants around the corner- be warned, we encountered a lot of dodgy people walking there! we even got our bag nicked right outside the hotel by two men on a motorbike! the hotel were very helpful though. there is a bus stop right outside the hotel which was very useful, and the beach is in easy walking distace. there is also a mall in short walking distance from the hotel but a lot of youths hang out here, and i suspect that these are the ones that mahe so much noise outside the hotel every night. i would say that this hotel is more a business hotel then a pleasure one, i personally would not stay here again, and would stay closer to the centre of barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “We will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: FrancesBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights on floor 21, rooms 17 &18 (junior suite). Room 18 has a balcony but if you have young children, I would not recommend letting them outside on the balcony without an adult. There is a CD player in room 18. Room 17 has a bath with a shower. Room 18 has a shower with jets which, is really nice and relaxing to use but unfortunately, the water leaks out all over the bathroom floor and I don't mean drips, I mean a lot of water so you have to shower really quickly and then use 2 or 3 towels to soak up the water. We had a view of the sea from our rooms. The drinks in the fridge in your room are free. Water, coke, lemonade and cheap beer. On Friday night, my husband and I got woken by really loud music and some guy talking really loud on a microphone. This was around midnight. The music did not stop until 6am. The music was coming from one of the buildings across the road. To put it into perspective, my husband never has any trouble sleeping where ever he goes so for him to be kept awake, well you can imagine! I went to reception the next day and asked the lady behind the desk if the music we had heard on the Friday night was a one off or did it happens every weekend. She looked at me blankly and said that it had not happened before and must have been a special occasion. On Saturday night, the music started to build up from 11,30pm and again did not end until 6am but this time fireworks were also let off. My husband and I could not believe it. Wherever you stay in the hotel, you will not be able to avoid the loud music or the guy talking on the microphone. My husband went to complain the next day. The receptionist advised him that the hotel have complained to the Council regarding the noise but have been told that there is nothing they can do, There were a number of people complaining in the hotel regarding the noise experienced. I am not sure if it is a regular occurrence i.e. if it is a nightclub or it happens every few weeks. On the second night, we even wore ear plugs but could still hear it slightly. The loud bangs from the fireworks woke my son up and not even the ear plugs could shield us from that noise. AC hotel and the Hilton hotel are close by. The AC hotel is even closer to where the music was coming from than Princess hotel! The pool on the 23rd floor was from what I saw mostly for sunbathers and adults. The other pool on floor 3 was shallow and more suitable for children. The water in both pools was very cold and we only managed to go swimming once as he water was freezing. In my opinion, not suitable to swim in. The hotel should have the water heated in the pools. We went to take my son into the Jacuzzi as the pool water was too cold. The Jacuzzi was absolutely discussing. It was a slimy dirty yellow colour. If the jets were on, you would probably not see this and get into the Jacuzzi, god knows what germs and bacteria you pick up! The gym is located on the 3rd floor in a room just off the pool, it was small but adequate. We put a do not disturb sign on our door but the maid still went in and did our room when we were out. On 2 separate occasions, she forgot to put duvet covers on our duvets. The beds are quite comfortable and are on wheels. You can put the brakes on the bed to stop them moving, something we did not discover until our third night. There is a tourist bus which takes you all around Barcelona. This costs around 19 Euros for 1 day or 23 Euros for 2 days. You are provided with earphones and can listen in various languages to interesting facts regarding sites around Barcelona. You can get on and off the tourist bus as many times as you want. You are provided with city maps and a discount booklet. Children under 4 go free on the tourist bus. Be sure to ask what time they stop running. I think it’s around 8/9pm. The metro and tram are also very easy to use. The shopping mall is right beside the hotel. There are various stores and a big supermarket. If you take any shopping into the supermarket, be aware that you have to place it in a plastic bag and seal it prior to entering the supermarket. There is a table with the plastic bags and a machine to seal it in the supermarket. There are a number of nice places to eat in the mall. The sea is about a 10/15 minute walk away from the hotel. There are no sun loungers on the beach or umbrellas. You can purchase straw mats (2.50 Euros) and umbrellas (4.99 Euros) from the supermarket in the mall. The beach has soft sand and showers to wash off sand when you are finished. In terms of taking food back to the hotel room, we never had any problems with this, we kept ham, butter, yogurts and beer in the fridge and crisps + water on the side. Personally I will not stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robitoSevilla
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! One of the best Ive stayed in. Its a little far from the centre, but theres a metro stop right outside the front door, and 20 minutes takes you into the city. I choose this one because we were going to a show which was very near it. The receptionist was very friendly at check-in and gave us extras time to check out the next day because we had a later flight. The room was impeccable, very modern, everything clean, and the views were spectacular from the 11th floor. Then there was the two swimming pools, albeit quite small, the rooftop jacuzzi and the fitness suite. And the breakfast was amazing; a gigantic buffet. I dont really have anything bad to say about this hotel really!

Reviews.Title: “Service? What Service”
Reviews.Author: thamestrader
Reviews.Content: This is a four star hotel with completely indifferent service. It is well below the 'Spanish' norm. We stayed for 3 nights for a conference. We were ignored or told incorrect information regularly. High point was getting a view of the Med lying in the bath! Breakfast at Eur17 is outrageous and does not make up for the free room bar. The 'razors edge' pool is exciting and the basic design is interesting although standard of finish is variable. Really surprised that other views here are positive at this category level. Don't go for the beach, its concrete!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Charl2509
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i went to the Barcelona princess for our first holiday and loved it. It was a little out of the centre but the tourist bus stopped right outside the hotel and the trams and metro were less than two minutes walk away. The hotel was very modern and clean. The room was cleaned every day and the mini bar- which was free was restocked everyday too. There are rules regarding taking your own food and drink into the rooms but we didnt find this a problem- we were never stopped taking our purchases upstairs. Our room was the top floor which meant a lift ride up 26 floors- great as the lift was glass and you could see for miles. This was great for views of the Sagrada Familia etc. Room was fairly big with a large comfortable bed, great power shower and blackout blinds and sky TV. Staff were friendly and always willing to help. Room service was avaliable. I would definately book the Barcelona Princess if i return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and impractical”
Reviews.Author: Karenina_7
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband honeymooned at the Barcelona Princess this past January for 2 weeks. Given the amount of money we spent on our stay, I can honestly say that it was not worth it. If the price had been half of what it was, perhaps I'd be giving it a slightly better review. To begin with, the hotel is decorated in a very trendy--and therefore often very impractical--way. The front lobby has seating that looks sleek and modern, and that feels very awkward and uncomfortable. The bedroom had a great view (we were overlooking the Mediterranean) but was VERY SMALL and cramped. I don't even know how they expect people to be able to work at the desk that was against the window because the space is so cramped. What upset me most is that we booked a king-sized bed and when we got to the room they had pushed two beds together and figured that wouldn't be a problem (it was our honeymoon for crying out loud). When we complained, they had little to say to resolve the issue. They also don't have an iron and when I requested one, they told me that I needed to purchase one from a store. No iron? Come on. When we were there, one of the saunas was broken and there were problems with the elevator, which is a big problem when you're staying on the 22nd floor. My husband dined at the restaurant there one night (he arrived one night before me) and said that the food was mediocre at best, the portions were tiny, and the price outrageous (which was my impression of lots of places in Barcelona, to tell you the truth--my least favorite thing about the city is the cuisine and its cost). The bathroom is very modern but, again, very cramped. The hairdryer was ridiculously heavy by any person's standards. As for the positives, here they are: 1) The hotel is pretty clean and the maid service is very reliable. 2) The views from the building are beautiful. 3) The train is nearby and very convenient for going downtown or anywhere else. 4) The mall next door is very convenient for shopping for food, clothes, dining out, etc. 5) The Italian bartender (whose name escapes me--sorry!) was a joy to talk to--he helped us with everything, from advice on restaurants, to how to get around, etc. He was a sweetheart and a consummate professional. We LOVED him. Overall, I don't think the Barcelona Princess is awful. It's a decent hotel, but completely overpriced, especially given that it's not downtown. I would say that it's a good place to stay if you're going on a business trip solo and the company's footing the bill, but as a couple going for a romantic vacation--SKIP IT! However, please don't let this review discourage you from going to Barcelona. Its reputation is well-earned as a remarkably beautiful city with lots of things to do and see. The architecture is breathtaking. Definitely go to Parc Guell, La Sagrada Familia, Tibidabo, Las Ramblas, the aquarium, the omni theatre, etc. My husband and I had an amazing vacation in Barcelona regardless of the hotel being less than we had hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good Some Bad”
Reviews.Author: Ericag
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay at the Barcelona Princess Hotel sometime ago and found the reviews on this site quite good, then recently checked again and became a bit concerned. Well having just returned from a long weekend thought I would give my view.
