Good Points Great Power Shower Large Bath Sheets Very Clean Fantastic View from the hotel I know it has been posted that you are not allowed to take in your own refreshments - we did and found that if we order a couple of mixers and ice, room service was very prompt. Not so good Air Conditioning in the room – very poor. What made it worse was that all power is turned off when you remove your room key, hence no cooling. The Mini Bar is also powered off so the free drinks (nice touch) are not cold. A point to note – opting for a city view does have the disadvantage of attracting the afternoon sun. So come late afternoon the room is boiling, unless you keep the blinds down, which rather defeats the idea of having a city view. The lighting in the bathroom whilst quite good throws off a great deal of heat adding to the problem. The pool on the 23rd Floor didn’t appear to be heated but certainly cooled your feet down after a day walking around. Unfortunately due to the location by late afternoon the sun had moved completely off the pool. The bar advertised on the 23rd Floor didn’t open at any time over our long weekend as already noted by others. The location of the hotel we found to be too remote, whilst it is serviced by the tourist bus, metro and tram, to get into the city required a number of changes, hence we used taxis most of the time which were reasonably priced, but trying to get one late in the evening can be a bit of a problem. Generally found the hotel a bit too modern and without atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “very trendy”
Reviews.Author: mattsta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights from 27th April 2007 and we found it to be fantastic. Yes ok there are closer hotels to the city than the location of this one, but lets be honest is it such a hassle to walk for five minutes and then get on the very reliable metro (underground) for another 10 minutes? No. Hotel had great staff was beyond clean and was very open and tastefully decorated. The rooms are awesome with great full wall windows (the black out blinds were brill), the bed was massive and the bathrooms were super cool. I would not really advise this as a hotel for the more mature as i don't think they would really appreciate the lack of privacy of the bathroom but for anyone who is a little less fuddy duddy should go for it. Be warned to make sure the body jets on the shower are turned off before you get in though, or prepare yourself for a cold soakin in your PJ's. Rooms had a free safe and a mini bar with a couple of drinks included in the price. I would highly recommend you stay here but if I was 70 years old and a bit more Victor Meldrew then I would have hated it as it was very modern.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved The Princess”
Reviews.Author: Lleucu
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about staying here after reading some of the horror stories and bad experiences. I can honestly say we had a wonderful stay in this hotel, we didn't really spend an awful lot of time here using it as a base as we were only in Barca for 3 nights. About 10 minutes ride away from Las Ramblas on the Metro and 35 cab ride away from Barcelona Airport. Great location right next to the exhibition centre, shopping centre and huge food hall. Nearest metro 1 minute walk across the road. Quiet part of town, very safe. Lovely modern hotel very clean and minimal decor. 25 floors with 2 pools and a gym. Restaurant and bar open til 1am. 24 hour room service, porter, laundry service and 24 hour reception. We stayed in a superior suite on the 24th floor. Bath, shower, bede, toilet, hairdryer, with fresh towels and robes. Shampoo, soap, razor, shaving cream, nail file, comb, toothbrush and paste. Dressing room space, bedroom and balcony. Huge windows with amazing views of the city. TV, stereo, safe, free internet access (no wifi, conection wires available), phone, mini bar/fridge. Contains 1 beer, 1 small coke, 1 small lemon fizzy non alchoholic drink, 1 small still and 1 small sparkling water. Refilled every day. Shoe cleaner slippers and shoe horn. Smoking rooms/floors and non smoking available. A/C in room controlled by yourself. We loved this hotel, found the staff very friendly and polite. Quick easy check in. Gave us handy maps of the city and metro. Our porter bought up our bags and asked us if we needed anything or wanted info on where to go. Brilliant service. Amazing view from our balcony and in the lift going up. The only thing we didn't like that there wa no iron in the room. We found this very poor. Sadly we had to pay 41.80 euros for an emergency iorning service of 2 shirts a pair of trousers and skirt. Either bring wrinkle free clothes or a travel iron (I usually do bring one). Some other things we found expensive and didn't take advantage of. A tiny bowl of crisps in the bar 3.60 euros, and this one tickled me, ice, 4.80 euros a bucket on the 24 hour room service menu. I guess this tries and stops you from bringing in your own drinks. I would recommend this hotel to couples/singles and business people. We had a lovely stay here, it ticked all the boxes for us for our short stay. I certainly would stay again. Enjoy x

Reviews.Title: “Issues with room and staff”
Reviews.Author: Curly9
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed in the Barcelona Princess on the 22nd-26th of March 2007. The hotel is a bit out from La Rambla area so if you can find a hotel a little closer for an extra 50Euro I would suggest doing so as the hotel itself had nothing to draw you that far down the metro line unless you are penny pinching. On checkin it went fine, the room seemed fine, on the first day the blind did not work so we were up at dawn with the brightness in the room, they fixed this on the second day (we were there for 4nights). On the day they fixed the blind the safe would not open so we could not get our stuff out to start our tourist stuff. He brought back the safe after about 60mins it was so broke he had to carry it away and either fix it or replace with a good one. On the arrival back on the 3rd day the swipe would not work for us to gain access to the room. We were tired as most tourists are after walking around all day and had dinner booked for that night so wanted to lie down and shower etc. Instead we had to go down to reception where the lady who seemed to be around 30 odd yrs old so should have had more sense, she decided to show a younger staff member how to do it, so train him as we waited, so they made a mistake and now they were training the staff. Held my breath and said thanks and went up the 15floors and once again it didn't work, we went down again at this stage we are not happy as we are home 20mins now and going up and down like looneys. She sent up a guy with us with some special universal key, and once again it would not work so down the 15 floors again. He said it would be 30mins before we could get into the room as he had to get a handy guy. I said this to the orginial lady who seemed to have no empathy with our situation I asked what she suggest we do for 30mins considering we have been trying for 20mins to get in at our expense (up and down 3times) she said wait I asked for a drink of wine in the bar she said no. I asked for the manager she said there was none on duty, to that I said who is in charge if there is a fire and she said there is no fire. So rather than making us more frustrated I decided to say no more and go for a walk, we called back at 21:45 and she said "It was open 10mins after we left anyway" before we even said anything so we could have exploded with frustration with the receptionist as she was not being constructive or sympathetic. A glass of wine would have kept us relaxed and quiet and you get a complementary beer and coke every day in your fridge (cheap beer) so I can't understand why she was so reluctant to see it from our point of view and give a little. So staff problems with zero empathy is a high chance should anything go wrong. Also it is a bit out making it a pain to go out after touring around during the day and back in for dinner (20-25mins on metro). Also outside of Summer period the upper bar is closed The pool is very cold. So 4Star in my mind means some empathy with residents but this does not exist. This is why I am giving it a trip advisor two stars=Okay but some problems.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern but Lacks in Other Areas”
Reviews.Author: Cage&ZG
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel we stayed at during our Barcelona trip. We arrived after a 15 hour flight and were tired but excited to be in Barcelona. Arriving at the hotel we were greeted with a lack luster attitude at reception but after reading other reviews we were expecting that. (The staff in the morning was friendly and cheerful.) After check in we went to our room and were impressed with the modern decor. The room was fresh and very clean. We didn't have much of a view as we were facing the water and different wing of the hotel. I recommend asking for a room that faces the city because the views are remarkable. Just take a quick trip on the elevator to the top floor (elevator has a window in it) and you will get a sense of the incredible view. The free mini bar is a nice touch but we found the fridge to only work when you had your hotel card key engaged in the room. I found the area not to have much around the hotel. It took me a few hours to explore the neighborhood and doesn't have the history that the inner city has. The Diaganal Mar is next door and has a great food market to shop at as well as a good food court and other amenities. This is a great place to pick up some inexpensive wine and snacks to take back to your room. However, we noticed that there are signs in the hotel that warned of any outside food or drink is subject to additional cost. Absurd! The Tram is right outside the hotel and takes you to the Zoo where you can then take a short subway ride to the city. Since the tram is above ground we liked it because we could take in the views as we heading into town. The business center has two computers with access to the internet and a printer but the printer was out of ink the three days we were there. There was also a conference going on and the elevators were extremely slow during high traffic times. I found myself waiting for the elevator for up to 10 minutes in the morning. Overall, the hotel was average. It had great rooms and spectacular views. We did find that there was not much happening around the hotel, some of the hotel amenities were hit and miss, the ride into town became tiring after a couple of times and most of all the service was average! If you do not mind the commute into town then this hotel does the trick. It has great modern rooms, a mall next door and quick walk to the harbor. If you want to be close to the action then I recommend staying in the city.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1STTIMEBERLIN
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent in every way. Very clean, very new, spectacular use of glass thoughout the hotel. Fantastic views from the bedroom. Good pools, bars etc. Free room safe and free mini-bar, re stocked each day. Excellent price of expedia Location good. Near an excellent shopping centre with good places to eat, near the beach. An easy 5 minute walk to the metro and 10 minute ride to Jaume 1 which is close to Barca Cathredal and gothic quarter, then through the gothic quarter you can walk quite easy to the rambals. (get a T10 metro ticket, 10 journeys for E6.90. you can use this on the Metro, and the bus. If back in Barca I would have no problem staying again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice decor”
Reviews.Author: KrazyKarenT
Reviews.Content: We shopped around on the internet and were able to find this beautiful hotel for less than half the price quoted on the Hotel's website. The hotel really is visually stunning! The bathroom has no bath but an amazing shower and sink. The bathroom is separated from the bedroom area by a glass wall which gives the impression of more space than you have. However, if you would like your ablutions to be private there is a blackout blind that can be lowered over the glass wall. The view from our room was spectacular, as was the view near the lifts and on the glass corridor which traverses one tower from the other. beware about the handrail in this corridor though, as both my husband and myself received electric shocks every time we touched it. The minibar contains one each of still water, carbonated water, cola, a lemon drink and beer. This is free and restocked daily. We also got free towelling slippers with the hotel logo on which are quite cute and a nice touch. The toiletries set is the best of any hotel I have stayed in containing shampoo, soap, shower cap, toothbrush and paste, nail file, comb, razor, shaving gel, and shoeshine pad. Noise travels from one room to another. We heard neighbours everytime they flushed the toilet or used the shower. This made us uncomfortable for two reasons. First we were concerned about whether the neighbours could hear our intimate time (!) and second, when flicking through the tv channels, some are very quiet and some are very loud. We didn't do this often though as there were no English channels. The hotel has a restaurant which although is expensive, well worth it. The food is exquisite! The staff in the restaurant were also very nice and efficient. The breakfast room was lovely and the breakfast sublime. They even had soya milk! The staff on the whole were distant and professional. We had no problems with the room or facilities so I cannot comment on how they would handle it. The cleaning staff were excellent. The only negative comment that I would have is that we wanted to buy a cup of coffee from the bar in the lobby and take it to our room. This however was not permitted by the gentleman at the bar. He insisted that we either drink it in the bar or order coffee from room service. Smoking policy:- All public areas are non-smoking (unusual in Spain) but you can request a smoking or non-smoking room on booking.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel”
Reviews.Author: somerley
Reviews.Content: Staying in this hotel in an experience we wouldn't have missed, views are wonderful - we were on the 26th (top) floor. I could watch from our window my husband swimming in the open-air pool on the 23rd floor. However, the bedrooms are a triumph of design over comfort - very designer-stylish but with only one uncomfortable chair, superb 3m. wide bed but with a large, square extra pillow that was too large and hard to use. ....and if you require complete privacy in the bathroom, this hotel is not for you! Reception staff could have been more cooperative but when a booking mistake was pointed out changes were made immediately. Super cleanliness in bedroom and bathroom - everything provided in bathroom you could ever need or have forgotten, including toothbrush, bathrobes and slippers. About 20 minutes from city centre by frequent metro trains.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: Stephen25
Reviews.Content: Good welcome, spotted it was my birthday the following week and upgraded us to a 19th floor Junior Suite. Room had sea view, very restful - and workspace had city view. Free internet great, free minibar, robes, slippers all nice touches. With metro five minutes walk getting to city was straightforward; pity we weren't there in summer when tourist bus comes to the door. We got breakfast included in our deal, which meant it was good value! Only disappointment was that we came down with terrible colds - but that wasn't the fault of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: manuselk
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Very modern decor, great views, nice rooms. It's out of town, but Barcelona has excellent public transport so it really is not a problem. There are some decent places to eat on the plaza behind the shopping mall. I've stayed there twice and would definitely recommend. Very good value for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oscarbud
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of this hotel I'm wondering if I was staying in the same place?. On arrival we was greeted by friendly and helpful reception staff. Our room was on the 17th floor and had fabulous views of the sea. The room was spotless, there was a very large bed with clean, crisp white linen. There is a mini bar with one bottle of coke, beer,lemon and water, which is restocked every day free of charge. There is plenty of wardrobe space also extra drawers and shelves. The glass bathroom does take a little getting used to, but there is an electric blind you can pull down to preserve your modesty if you need to hahaha. The shower is fantastic, and ours never leaked once. Plenty of towels are provided, also bathrobes, slippers and complementary toiletries. there is also a hairdryer. One minor critism is that the TV in the room only has 2 english speaking channels (euro sport and CNN), ok, I know we don't go on holiday to watch TV, but at least one more english channel would have been nice.......(there seemed to be lots of childrens channels ?). We booked room only so I cannot comment on the food, although we did have a sandwich in the corner restaurant on the ground floor which was ok. There is a lage shopping complex right next door and there are various cafes and restaurants on the top floor which were well priced. The hotel is outside of the main town, but there is a bus, tram and metro service just yards from the hotel. i must be honest and say that we used taxis most of the time, and they were reasonably priced. The hotel was busy as Liverpool were playing Barcelona while we was there but there was hardly any noise from other guests. I would recommend this hotel, but remember it is quite a way from the center of Barcelona and apart from the large shopping complex next door there is'nt much else in the area. Just a word of warning........Glass corridors join each side of the floor of the hotel and if you are in your room and the blinds are open people can see right into your room..............just because your on a high floor does'nt mean you cant be seen ?????.

Reviews.Title: “Great balconies, poor service”
Reviews.Author: carlr11
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from the Barcelona Princess. Having read other reviews regarding problems at check in, it wasn't a total surprise that the hotel had no record of the reservation despite doing so through the hotel's own website. After finally getting checked in, we were shown up to the room, which was extremely hot. The air conditioning did not appear to work, so after a call to reception we were informed that the air conditioning system is switched off in the winter. This was despite an efficient system in the public areas of the hotel. This room had some very dubious marks on the wall and was not completely clean. As a result we requested a room change. Eventually the reception staff agreed to show us another room on the same floor which was clean. The second room had a good shower although like other reviewers found, it becomes tedious mopping up the floor everytime. The room had a good if somewhat small balcony overlooking the sea. The hotel pools were open however none were heated contrary to the hotel website. Transport links were good into the city centre with a tram and bus stop directly outside the hotel although it does take sometime to get into the tourist areas. The mini bar is free however, it is only stocked once a day with 1 beer, 2 small bottles of water and a soda! The breakfast was average so no complaints there however on checkout the hotel had charged for breakfast despite the website clearly stating this was included in the tariff. We even queried this with staff on check in. After contact from my credit card company this was refunded but yet another example of poor organisation.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant if you don't mind being out of town”
Reviews.Author: LondonLondoner
Reviews.Content: Simple decision: do you mind spending 25 minutes twice a day getting to and from the city? It's a bit irritating after a couple of days (and the transport only runs to 2am Fris and Sats) but trams buses and metro all stop within three minutes' walk. So if public transport's not a bother, book this one right away and save hundreds compared with a boring place near the Rambla. The rooms are stunning: very new, smart and hi-tech and wonderful views. The rooftop pool was open even in January. Very cool in both senses. The immediate area is modern residential with plenty of cafes and a big shopping centre but probably not somewhere you'd want to spend more than a few hours. The 'beach' is mainly concrete and mechanical diggers. Little to complain about at the hotel, but the free mini-bar's less exciting than it sounds (just a bottle of beer) and the 'technican' who was supposed to have fixed our aircon evidently didn't succeed. It was much too warm.

Reviews.Title: “Awful in many ways!!not”
Reviews.Author: buzzby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days at the Princess as part of a conference group. The location is terrible. While public transportation is nearby, the hotel is quite a distance from the city center and all the sights. Each taxi ride into the city cost 11-15 Euros. That very quickly added up to much more than we had anticipated. The room was attractjve but small. The bed was very comfortable but the bathroom left much to be desired. The separate shower was next to the separate toilet and the shower leaked onto the floor into the toilet area. Not pleasant. The view was great. The signs in the lobby forbiding guests from bringing in outside drinks or food made it feel like a dorm or a hostel and not a deluxe hotel. Concierge services were non existent and the front desk staff were not knowledgeable or helpful at all. The breakfast buffet was very limited and unexciting. So it seems that what this hotel has going for it are low rates and a modern design look. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Learning to translate the service staff English”
Reviews.Author: TourismProfessor
Reviews.Content: When the hotel staff tells you in English, 'We are sorry for the problem, we will send a Technician immediately to fix it', I learned this means, 'Forget it, dummy, it's your problem, deal with it'. Our recent stay was a lesson in being treated as lab rats, with staff changing their responses to why equipment was not working every day, working their way down the list, forgeting you may have been given a different reason the day before. And after the final straw, our forgotten appointments for massages, in which we had had centered for our last day's stay, we recieved the proverbial cheap bottle of champ. after forcing the Day Manager from his comfortable hole. Forget the modern looking rooms and free daily bottle of beer in the mini bar, and look for a hotel where they treat their guests as if they can think and who prefer not to be lied to or manupliated as lab rats.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crazychic_78
Reviews.Content: Absolutly loved this hotel. Rooms were a decent size with nice clean bathrooms. The pool was clean, i cant say the same about the jacuzzi though! We were on the 22nd floor which gave aus a fantastic view. I would suggest asking for a room on the higher floors (although it does take a while for the lifts to get to you!!!). The hotel is a few miles out of the city, there is a train station only a few meters away. Also you can catch the tourist bus from outside the hotel (look out for the green bus stop, as you walk out turn right then right again). Overall a great hotel and i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back!!*****”
Reviews.Author: Muffles6012
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and can't wait to go back - we went in April of 2006. (Cold - just in case you were wondering). While the hotel is out a bit from the centre of things, I personally thought it was a good location. The metro, the bus and the tram all go right outside it and its a 10 minute journey to get into the centre. Barcelona is such a big place I think that where ever you stay you are going to have to travel a good bit to get to see all the sites anyway. The hotel is right next door to a shopping centre. It was great for when the boyfriend went to see Nu Camp - I could pop next door and didn't feel unsafe walking around as my hotel was just next door. The hotel is unlike any I've ever stayed in. Free drinks in your fridge. Magnificent views and really up to date and stylish decor!! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel top marks”
Reviews.Author: boostravel
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel, very modern, we went through check in very quickly, our hotel was on the 19th Floor and you would pay top money anywhere in the world to get the view we did, truly fantastic. The rooms are extremely modern and i think you need to like the modern/ urban chic look to really appreciate the hotels style, i know my parents would not like it at all as they appreciate more the traditional scene, i would say this hotel would really appeal to younger people. The metro station is just on the doorstep and the best way to get around, i would advise against trying to walk into the centre, we tried on our first day and what we thought would be a 40- 50 min walk is more like 2 hours and simply not worth it, particularly as the Metro is so efficient and gets you where you want to be in a matter of minutes, its really easy to use, almost identical to Londons Tubes only cleaner and air conditioned. We did not eat in the Hotel, to be honest the menu did not appeal to us at all however next door is the shopping mall with plently of places to eat and Drink, the hotel bar was good though and not too expensive that you feel ripped off, all in all a great value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: sparco76
Reviews.Content: When you first walk into the Barcelona Princess your initial thoughts are all positive. It looks stylish and has a nice ambience. It feels like a good 4* business hotel. After 90 min wait to check in because of ‘computer problems’ your enthusiasm wanes but the free drink helps the time pass by. On walking into the room I was initially impressed until I realised that it was a twin room rather than the ordered king size bed. After another wait and battle with the receptionist I get moved to a better room but still without a king size bed she promised. Apparently the hotel is full and I don’t fancy queuing another 30 mins to try and change rooms again! My new room has a balcony which is rendered useless because it has no table and chairs and over looked by the whole hotel! I have a proper bath with shower, but the cheap shower fixing has broken in a previous life and has been super glued together. Every time I turn the shower off the shower head falls off and either hits my toes or head! The sink is also badly designed…. It has no plug! Also no soap dishes… when you turn the tap for hot you get cold etc. The only saving grace is the excellent blackout blinds. Made me late on one occasion! Lifts…Lifts…Lifts! Lack of them! This hotel has 3 lifts for 26 floors. It needs at least 6. At peak times you can end up waiting 10 mins for a lift! Ridiculous Once you start seeing the cracks in this hotel they just keep on coming. It will look very tired in another 2 years time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomase
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend stay at this hotel which I booked on lastminute.com for my Mum's 60th birthday. Getting to the hotel via taxi was easy and not too expensive, around £25. Check-in time was adverstised by lastminute at 2pm and when we arrived we had a bit of a delay in checking in, but it wasnt a major problem. Leaving bags wasnt a problem though. Rooms were nicely furnished and the free mini bar with water and beer was a nice touch (only one bottle of beer a day though!). On the first day we headed into the Diagonal Mar shopping centre which has a great selection of shops, and the bars/restaurants outside on the 3rd floor offer somewhere to handy and reasonably priced to eat and drink if you cant be bothered heading back into the city after a hard days sightseeing! After trying the tram, we found the metro station which was much easier. Buy the T10 which allows you 10 journeys for about 7euros - its good value if you're there for a weekend. The Metro is really simple to use and quick to get to the centre. Didn't try the hotel for breakfast or dinner as there are other options in the cafe opposite or in the shopping centre. The area around the hotel is fine - part residential, part commercial. Some interesting buildings nearby too. Tried the pool on the 23rd floor - nice and warm (even in Oct!). Its a bit of a novelty factor really, but an enjoyable experience. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't mind the Metro and wants good value in a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nessun Dorma....”
Reviews.Author: Jayne-Mark
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona Princess is an ultra-modern hotel a couple of miles out of the city. The shopping centre next door has a variety of OK restaurants & bars & the adjacent Forum Conference Centre, surrounded by a huge concrete park and marina, makes for an interesting location. Some correspondents have commented on the showers - I enjoyed the multi-jet experience, though mopping up afterwards due to the ill-fitting door became tiresome. There are some terrific aspects from the lifts & high rooms, and with some more welcoming staff the hotel could move from good to great but for one thing outside its immediate control...'Espacio Movistar'. Adjacent to the Conference Centre, this marquee-like music venue pumped out rave at a volume sufficient to rattle the glasses on the shelf in our 18th floor room until 5am on Saturday morning....even my ipod at high volume in my ears couldn't drown out the beat. Reception were sympathetic (saying they had called on the police to intervene) but could offer no help, nor, when I asked them the following morning, a change of room (the hotel being full and anywhere 'it won't make much difference'). The following night's prog rock was better - it wasn't as loud and finished at 4am - but still cost us several hours' sleep. If you're thinking of going to this hotel at the weekend, unless you're deaf, a raver or the hotel have assured you there's nothing on down the road - don't.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: RKPT
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at this hotel and found it to be very good value for money. The room we had was very comfortable, with a huge bed. We had a lovely view of the sea and made use of the electric blinds. Plenty of toiletries and the free minibar was very handy. The shower was a bit daunting to begin with but we soon discovered if you adjusted the showerhead, that solved the problems. We thought it would have been more helpful if there had been more drawer space. However, we managed. If the green line had been operational it would have made a big difference to us for getting around, this stops in September. We used the tram and the metro which was a very slight hassle to reach the tourist bus. We were so tired with all the sightseeing that we would go to the shopping mall to eat before returning to the hotel. The choice of restaurants was great and suited us just fine. The downside of this hotel was not being able to bring food in. We thought this rule was a bit ridiculous, especially with there being a superb supermarket in the mall. Ok this hotel was not in the main centre, but it was a lovely hotel, very comfortable, quiet and made a very relaxing break for us. We would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from La Rambla and main action”
Reviews.Author: Nevadagirl
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and a good bargain at 100E a night. It is next door to a large shopping mall with places for breakfast. The rooms are very modern and the staff friendly and helpful. We thought the Barcelona Tourist Hopon, Hopoff bus went by the hotel but found out this is only in the summer and we had to take a tram and metro to get to the Tourist Bus stop which was okay but took time out from sightseeing. If you have a week or more and can't find a bargain like this closer, I would stay here but not for 2 nights post cruise like we did. I'd find something closer to La Rambla or the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad - could have been better”
Reviews.Author: reggy123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barcelona Princess Hotel on business in mid-October and here are my comments. On arrival it looks an impressive building, out in suburbs with quite a lot of building work going on around the hotel. We had a delayed check in by an hour or so, (system failure) conceirge offered free drinks which was a nice touch. Finally got to room and air-con was broke, took 2 hours to fix. Free Mini bar not replaced every day. Being a smoker in a smoking room you expect an ashtray, NO! Asked at reception and was told to use a drinking glass instead as they don't have them!!!! Room was clean enough with a great view of the city. Watch out for the shower, it leaked under the seal and flooded the bathroom!! Uber modern, or trying to be so not the most functional room you'll ever stay in. The lifts were a nightmare, only 3 and with the hotel being full it took upwards of 5 minutes waiting going up or down at times....badly designed! Only ate breakfast once and once was enough, good selection but the food was lukewarm at best and expensive. Staff in general were efficient if not that friendly except the two guys working in the foyer bar. Both were more than helpful and very friendly, they make some excellent cocktails as well :) Ideal location for business trip, convention centre across the way and superb shopping centre "Diagonal Mar" right next door. Good tapas to be had here! About 20 mins from Las Ramblas etc, centre of town. Tram was confusing at first but got the hang of it, trams stops right outside the hotel. Metro at Glorias stop takes you all over the city but be prepared with your map and expect a few line changes. Too conclude our stay we took the tourist bus around the city, excellent value and an ideal way to spend your day. Nou Camp was fantastic as was Port Olympic, good food and night life. Good hotel but as I say, it could and should have been better for a superior 4 star (as advertised). Probably won't stay again but it served the purpose well enough. Finally, watch your wallet as two guys had theirs pick-pocketed within yards of the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “our best accomodation during our 3-wk trip around europe”
Reviews.Author: VuittonFanatic
Reviews.Content: my friend and i decided to "semi-backpack" around europe earlier this year. what i mean by semi backpack is 3* hotels and up... no motels... and absolutely no hostels. average price of our hotels was around U$ 100/night. we were planning to stay in barcelona for 5 days and 4 nights... therefore, we feel like we could "compromise" on this hotel's not-so-central location. of course, several "dissapointed" comments on this hotel got us worried. but, we decided that like everything in life, it is most likely a 50/50 chance... so, we booked all of our 5 days and 4 nights accomodations at the princess. we arrived in barcelona late afternoon. figuring out the location to this hotel is a bit tricky. i think in expedia, it mentioned the nearest metro station was diagonal mar. well, hello... there's a diagonal metro... but no diagonal mar. we asked the tourist info at the sants' station (main train station at barcelona) and she told us that the hotel is "quite far out, about 30-40 minutes train ride from sants... and it is near diagonal mar MALL." duh! once we arrived, there were 2 exits (to the street level)... we took the wrong one and ended up walking quite a bit, compared to if we've taken the other exit (sorry readers, cant remember exactly which exit to take... but if i remember correctly, it's the kind that you'd have to take a lift to go up to the street level). the street lighting is quite dim at night... so for single girl traveller, i would suggest going home early or bring some kind of a defensive tool, just in case... since we bumped into several drunk people on several nights (i guess they party hard in spain). ok, about the hotel... there were 2 other people in front of us and the darn front desk took their sweet time, not even acknowledging our existence. we just got off a 7-hr train ride... a smile, an apology or a quick check-in service would have been nice. even after he was done checking in the other people, he curtly told us to "wait" for another 5 minutes. but the coolness of our room, totally made up for the lack of courtesy of the front desk officer. i cant believe we got such a great deal for our money! our room is super duper clean, none of that gross smell of smoke, the tables are clean, the window glasses are immaculate. we love it!!! we went downstairs to get suggestions on where to eat and the 'other' front desk person suggested the next-door mall (diagonal mar) since we rather not go anywhere far. at the top of the mall, was this open-air food court thing that's fabulous. we ate most of our dinner at this chinese restaurant, china guo. the food is good considering you're paying like 3 euros for a sumptous size vegetable fried rice. definitely a perfect restaurant for on-the-budget traveler. the waiters are nice and accomodating. if you've been to europe, you know what a rip-off dining out (or buying anything, in general) can be. oh, buy your water from the grocery inside the mall... SUPER DUPER CHEAP! but remember to "hide" it as you're entering the hotel and keep them inside your luggage. since the hotel has a policy where they reserve the right to charge you extra for bringing outside food and drinks. but, buy your water/juices from this mall before you head out to the city. save you tons of euros. GOOD THING abt this hotel: real great value. this is our best accomodation in the entire trip ($100/night budget, 3 countries, 9 cities)... clean. safe. mid to upper-class guests. the maid CLEANS the shower everyday... love that you can get free wireless internet! they have this ultra cool, great pictures, great descriptions guide book in our hotel room that really helps in planning our trip around the city. BAD THING abt this hotel: it is quite far out from the "central" of the city. but if you have plenty of time... if you can afford wasting a little time riding the metro, this is the place! it is close to the olympic village where the better food at more expensive price tags are. at night, around the hotel you have nothing... but the restaurants on the top of the mall (since people in spain dont eat dinner before 9pm). THINGS TO REMEMBER: every frickin' mall in spain/europe, in general closed on sundays... so plan your trip accordingly. visit sagrada familia EARLY in the morning... yeah, its a pain to wake up early, but its a bitch to wait in line for 1.5 hours. remember, it takes abt 40 minutes to get to city center by metro... bon voyage...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerz
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. It is 15 minutes to downtown Barcelona. Room was beautiful, very modern. It looked like a boutique hotel. It is right next to a huge mall, so lots of options for shopping and about 50 different restaurants. Very Clean and bright. Room has thick bathrobes and slippers and beautiful amenities. 2 small pools with loungers, including one on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: alli
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending a conference and I tagged along. the hotel was chosen by the event planners. The rooms looked like the web site. I have to say that it seemed like little thought went into the functionality of the design. You enter though the bathroom which is ok but it is all glass. Remember to close the bathroom blinds. The shape of the building is such that people walking down the hall can look right into your room. The views are very good but I had to keep the blinds drawn most of the time. The shower is great looking though again not well thought out. The shower heads face the shower door. Not thinking I turned the water on and got a direct hit. There is no way to let the water warm without getting sprayed. Plus the shower door is flush with the floor and did not seal correctly. Each time we showered we flooded the room. During our stay it rained heavily. Most of the hallways had water coming in. They had towels down lining the hallways in an attempt to stop the water from coming in. I found the staff to be disinterested at best. The only good thing I can say is it is a good location for attending a conference but if your traveling for fun I'd stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: loll01
Reviews.Content: Had read all the reviews on this hotel but still did not want to build up my hopes. We need not have worried as this was the first time i have stayed in a hotel and found it to be exactly as it was in the reviews and the photos. The staff were great and the rooms are stunning along with the facilities and the views were amazing. The only fault i had was the breakfast. It was awful. We arrived on friday 29th of sept my sister my father and myself for his 65th birthday. The location is fab as it is covered by the tourist bus the main bus line the tram and the metro. If you dont wish to use these then its only 10 euros for a taxi into catalunya square. We even met some lovely people while we were staying at the hotel. The shopping centre next door was great with some fab restuarants. The only other problem i would say someone could have would be the shower as ours was broken so the waterfall was more like a trickle against the wall but if you are over 5'10 you would probably struggle. Apart from that this a 10/10 hotel for me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Princess”
Reviews.Author: Lybie
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights in the beautiful Princess Barcelona hotel! I can only say that the location, rooms, staff, bed, free chunky dressing gowns are five star all the way!!! I would recommend this hotel to anybody going to barcelona, its great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, close to mall and the beach”
Reviews.Author: kiddo74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a great deal at Barcelona Princess when we booked our stay early, 2 nights for a total of 160 euros. We were nicely greated and given a room on the 25. floor. We did not see the ocean, but had a great view of Sagrada Familia and the city. This came in handy when there was an amazing fireworks show our first night! Our room was nice, very quiet/soundproof, big bed, cool interior design and free minibar. The hotel is close to the beautiful beach, approx 10 minutes walk. We enjoyed our first 2 of 4 Barcelona nights at the beach. Also there is a big mall next door, The Diagonal Mar, with lots of stores and restaurants. The third positive thing with the hotel is that you can catch the metro from the station Maresme, only 2 minutes walk. Within 10-15 minutes you can reach Barceloneta, Port Olimpic, Barri Gotic or Placa Catalunya, because the yellow line passes all these great places. The negative part at the hotel was a problem with the air condition, which was very cold no matter how warm we set it. Even at 35 degrees it was freezing, so we could just keep it on for shorter periods and not during the night. We told the hotel about this, but it was not fixed. It was also a bit disappointing that the pool area on the 23. floor was closed for maintenance. We would have liked to see the view from there. But all in all we were very happy with our stay and would absolutely return!

Reviews.Title: “Must Be A 5*”
Reviews.Author: audi21
Reviews.Content: I am not being snobbish but i have been to many 5* hotels around the world, and to think this hotel is not 5* is just incredible. It is in fact considered 4* superior and is very good at that. The rooms are very modern and clean. The staff were very polite and helpful and assisted us whenever possible. We arrived to the hotel at 12pm and requested a high floor room. We were told our room would be ready at 1pm so we went to have lunch on the beach, leaving behind our luggage in the hotel. We returned to the hotel at 2pm and were given a sea view room on the 25th floor. We were told that the minibar was free which included coke, lemonade,a beer, still water and sparkling water. The room was lovely. I have been to Barcelona twice before and stayed in 4* hotels and the rooms were much smaller that this one. The shower was powerful and massaging.It was a true pleasure to be in the hotel room and looked forward to coming back to the room. The only negative point i think is the tv which had 30 channels, but the only 3 english channels are CNN,bloomberg and eurosport. The blinds in the room are great, and make the room pitch black and difficult to wake up in the morning, so have an alarm ready to wake you up every morning. There are 2 computers in the first floor which we found always empty and used for the internet, but there is internet available in each room so thats another bonus. Hotel location can be annoying after a while. The tram is an easy way to reach the beach taking about 10mins and the metro takes 12-15mins to the centre. Overall, i cannot stress enough how impressed i am with this hotel and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very upscale feel”
Reviews.Author: Silent Crow
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona Princess is a wonderful hotel. The rooms are extraordinary in that the views are spectacular, and the features within the room are divine, right down to the faucets. Some of the rooms actually have balconies, and though those rooms don't have DIRECT ocean views, they give you a span of Barcelona well worth the (moderate) price of the hotel. Those same rooms are larger than the ocean view rooms, with a much more unique layout. The spa facilities are filled with young (attractive) visitors on holiday, and the pool itself, at the top of the roof, seems like an ad for Hedonism, with all the sun bathers. Had I not been there on business, I too would have whiled away many hours taking advantage of the tremendous spa facilities. The breakfast is actually one of the best I've ever had. It is, like 90% of hotel breakfasts, a buffet, but the choices are extraordinary. In reading the reviews before choosing the hotel, I had a couple concerns about the attitude of the staff. There were very few moments when I felt the staff wasn't exemplary. One has to know and understand Spain a bit to understand the attitude. No one is likely to get preferential treatment, but everyone is going to get great service. (I was able to check in when I arrived before noon, but I was only lucky.) The only complaint I have is not against the hotel itself. The location is not terribly accomodating if you're on holiday. It's great for the convention center, and it's great if you want to go to the mall. BUT, if you're in Barcelona to experience classic Barcelona, I would look to stay elsewhere. Otherwise, you'll be exhausted just getting around. For business, or a holiday with teenagers who want to hang around the hotel while YOU go experience Barcelona, it's perfect. Brilliant, in fact.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Excelent Value”
Reviews.Author: PM62
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights over a weekend and I could find little if anything to criticise the hotel for. We arrived around midday and as our room was ready they allowed us check in early, and met our request for a high floor with a city view. The rooms are very modern and a bit 'Austin Powers' with the electric blinds and the glass wall between the bedroom and the bathroom and the 'trick' shower, but all very nicely done. The free minibar (one of each of a beer, coke, lemonade, still and sparking water each day) was a nice touch. Although the hotel appears to be a fair way out of town, it is only 15 minutes by tube. There is a tube station just around the corner, and both the normal and tourist buses stop right outside. As this is a 'business' hotel, the rates drop dramatically on Saturday and Sunday, and the reduced weekend rates are a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view, not the stairs!!”
Reviews.Author: emma_1980
Reviews.Content: We chose the Barcelona Princess largely due to a lot of good reviews on the Trip Advisor website and everything we read was true . . . We arrived at 11am and couldn't check in until 2pm but were able to leave our luggage at reception. The staff spoke good English and this was hassle free. Our room was on the 26th floor, at the top, magnificent views over Barcelona and the sea. The room was definately the best we've stayed in - very clean, stylish and yes, the shower is unbelievable!! The hotel is a 20 minute tube ride to the city centre - we found the easiest way to get around was the tube, and purchased a metro ticket that enabled us to make 10 journeys for just under 7 euros. The metro tickets can be purchased from a ticket booth which has English instructions. The only downside of the hotel was that on our last night in Barcelona there was torrential rain and the lifts in hotel were out of order. We had to walk up 26 flights of stairs to get to our room without an apology or any explanation from the staff - their customer service could definately be improved!!

Reviews.Title: “The Height of Style..!”
Reviews.Author: LeighE
Reviews.Content: As usual, I picked this hotel after researching Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed! This truly is one of the most stylish hotels I have ever stayed in, and I've stayed in some of the top hotels in the UK. From the hassle-free check-in to the free soft drinks to the uber-cool bathroom and the views over Barcelona - we'll definitely stay here again! Yes, the mini bar is soft drinks and there's nothing "lite" or "diet" but, come on! It's free! And how often do you get that in a hotel??! We absolutely ADORED the room. I lost track of how many photos we took of the sunset over the city. The electric black-out blinds (and I mean black-out - we had no idea what time it was when they were closed!) were a nice touch and the bathroom was gorgeous. Was a little bit odd not having a completely separate toilet but the door into the bathroom does close if you're a bit shy. The location isn't overly central and we did find it a bit of a hassle trying to get back to the hotel late at night on the Friday and Saturday as taxis were few and far between, but it's not a bad walk and there were plenty of others with the same idea. There's so much going on around this new area and the transport links with the centre were really good. We bought a 2-day Tourist Bus pass that we used to get around the town as there's a stop on the green line right outside the hotel. The one thing I would say is that if you're afraid of heights (as I am) then the lift and the swimming pools are a bit of an ordeal. Luckily we were on the 15th floor which was high enough to have a good view but not too high to make each lift journey a nightmare! We visited the smaller pool on the 1st floor but it was in the shade in the afternoon and absolutely FREEZING! I couldn't make it to the one near the top of the hotel as you had to walk through a glass corridor to get to it and that was a bit much fo me! My husband loved it though and we weren't really there for the pool - there's too much else to do in Barcelona! I would completely recommend this hotel and I've bumped into a few people who have also stayed and also loved it. It's fantastic value for money with some of the best rooms and best views in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: elenaki
Reviews.Content: Just came back yesterday from our trip to Barcelona - a wonderful experience indeed! We booked the hotel based on comments from Trip Advisor's visitors. Overall a good choice! Nice, decent, very clean and modern accomodation. (+) : Nice view especially from elevator, clean rooms (slippers changed every day!), quiet area away from the centre, helpful staff, very convenient (especially for breakfast) shopping mall a few steps from the hotel . (-) : window in the room did not open for safety reasons as we were on the 22nd floor so there was a lack of fresh air in the room. In brief, we were not crazy about the hotel but we were really satisfied as you can't really expect a lot more in the middle of a big city. We would recommend it to others as long as they don't mind staying 15' by metro from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BriL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from Barcelona and we both agree that this hotel was great. We stayed for 7 nights and this was a perfect length of time to enjoy all that Barcelona offered. The rooms were extremely clean and very modem and the free minibar was a nice touch as there is a strict policy against bringing your own food / drink into the hotel (although a rucksack did come in useful!!). Th shopping centre beside the hotel is good and there are also plenty of places to eat out in. There is also a metro about 2 minutes from the hotel and a taxi to the Olympic Port is only about 6 euros. It is worthwhile taking the Tourist Bus which leaves from outside the hotel as it takes you all around Barcelona and you can on and off it as often as you like.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again - hopefully soon!!!”
Reviews.Author: jojovino
Reviews.Content: I took a group of my friends here for a long weekend for my hen party and we all agreed the Barcelona Princess rocked!! The previous reviews about no food being allowed into the hotel are correct, but we solved this by hiding any shopping bags in our beach bags - so no problems there!! The room service is not too expensive anyway but as we were only staying a couple of days this was not an issue. The rooms were beautifully decorated, the shower definately sorted out any kind of early morning hangovers we had! There was a great shopping mall just next door to the hotel with a lovely tapas restaurant on the top floor. My room was on the top floor(26th ) which had great views over the city. Some vertigo sufferers may want to mention this upon check in as some of the rooms are accessed via a glass walk way!! I would recommend anyone to stay at the Barcelona Princess again as although it was a little way out of town, cabs to the main bars at the Olympic Port were only around 5 -10 euros, and this was well worth the peace and quiet of the location!!

Reviews.Title: “security”
Reviews.Author: cal204
Reviews.Content: just returned with mixed opinions! first the hotel was spotless clean very modern very contempory which is what we like. pools lovely but very small, drinks and snacks in hotel very expensive, but thats hotels. Bar on 23rd floor never open, staff in corner bar not over friendly as with most staff in the hotel, although i dont restrict this to the hotel we found the catalonians to be a lot more unfriendly compared to regular spanish people. The hotel has a policy that you cannot bring food and drink into the hotel, however we were stopped by security for bringing booze in that we intended to take home to uk, after speaking to one of the managers we were allowed to take the bag in but we were made to feel like she was doing us a favour! On our third nite we switched rooms because we had some very noisy neighbours, this was done without problem, however i was shocked to be told by the night recepionist that they had several complaints about these people, so why wasnt they ejected from the hotel! The shopping centre has several restaurants, do use "canas y tapas" and the restaurant next door, avoid at all costs "hollywoods" and "gino's" have you ever heard of an itaalian to run out of garlic bread. Overall the hotel is good, however beause of the way we were embaressed over the drinks incident and the fact we had to switch rooms because of noisy neighbours we would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views from room at night”
Reviews.Author: alegna1
Reviews.Content: Booked thru Booking. Stayed 3 nights at the Princess. Travelled with my 3 kids (11,13,15). When they saw the hotel there were screams of delight. Impressive. Great views from our 14th floor rooms, which compensated for not having a sea-view. Great Location, but a 20 minute tram ride to the centre (Las Ramblas) or at least a 35 min walk. Tram stops outside the hotel. Tourist bus stops outside hotel! The tourist tickets can be bought from the hotel desk although it's odd that you have to pay for the 5 Euro voucher offered (?) by the hotel. The hotel receptionist insisted that it was a reduction, but this isn't true. It's the same price if you buy from the hotel or directly from the tourist bus. (But the hotel probably takes a commission !) The free mini bar was welcome, although room service forgot to replenish after the first night. This was corrected when we reported to the desk. The design bathrooms are lovely and the rooms large and nicely designed. Slippres and bathrobes are welcome gesture. The two pools are tiny but adequate. The view from the pool on the 26th floor is, needless to say, splendid. There's a shopping shopping centre next door where you can eat reasonably priced meals. We always ate breakfast there. Lots of different restaurants. Eating out in Spain is not expensive and the salads are delicious. Smooth and friendly check-in/out. Enjoyed our stay. One of the nicest 4 star hotels I've stayed at. :-)

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alison36
Reviews.Content: great hotel in a lovely quiet area. easy to reach by train and metro but takes about 1 hour - loads cheaper than a taxi though. We used the metro system a lot and found it to be very reliable, clean, cheap and safe. On checking in at the hotel, we had to leave 150 euros as a deposit as we don't have a credit card so be prepared before you go for that. Other than that couldn't fault the hotel or staff. Rooms are fantastic, pool gets a bit crowded so late afternoon we went for a 5 minute stroll to the promenade for a couple of hours - no beach, a wooden decked area, very safe, clean and cool with the sea breeze. Good shopping centre next door with plenty restaurants and shops. No complaints at all, can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The sweet Cherry of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ido4u
Reviews.Content: Holllaaa, We stayed at the Princess hotel for 3 nights and we loved every minute of it. From the airport to the hotel you can take a taxi (30 euros) or save your money by taking the AeroBus outside of the airport to Pl Catalunya and from there walk 2 minutes to Urquinaona take metro to La Pau and take off at El Maresme forum. Tip- at the airport, go to information to get map of the city marked with the directions marked. When we arrived at the reception, we were welcomed extremely nice by Christina. Her English was great and after checking in she even recommended us good places to go out in Barcelona (Vila Olimpica metro). Ask for the city map (it's a smaller one, and very good). Our flight back was at midnight, so after doing check-out our bags were stored in special room. As for the hotel. Yeah yeah, as all wrote before the hotel is located 15 minutes (by metro) from La Rambla but the facilities and the view from the window when u wake up in the morning worth everything. The room is super nice beautiful. Very electronic. Very clean. very comfortable. The mini bar was FREE (you get 5 drinks!!!). There are two small but cute swimming pools. Gym (which we didn't see) Besides, the beach is only 5-10 minutes by walk (my suggestion is for you to do it through the buildings so you could see the beautiful neighborhood. If you walk further you'll find yourself in Naturist beach (which was quite an experience). And of course, for those of you who like shopping, one of the biggest malls (if not the biggest) is just outside of the hotel - DIAGONAL MAR. Zara, H&M and lots of food resources are "included" in the mall. Recommendations- Go to VIP restaurant for dinner. Don't miss the Chocolata ice in Dunkin Daunts. Tips- Buy the T10 metro card- well worth it. Go to see Barcelona from Parc de Montjuic (amazing view). Don't miss Arc de triomf, Sagrada famillia and beautiful Barri Gòtic Just for u to know, that there is this resturant in barcelona which is called TelePizza and they khave two menus for tourists and for locals (prices are different!!!). Don't give them the pleasure to charge u for more money. Skip the Fonfone club (too small and crowded). You can email me ido8all@yahoo.com for further more information. Would love to help. Enjoy, Ido

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: wreimer
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, even better value. After reading some reviews about the lack of friendliness and help from the staff I was a bit apprehensive. I must say, that was not our experience. They certainly went to great effort to meet our needs. We were on the top floor, I would recommend asking for a view of the city as the view of the sea was not that impressive. Also, it did seem to be hard to keep our room as cool as I would have liked, not sure if it was being on the top floor or because it was so hot outside. It might be cooler on one of the lower floors. The beds were comfortable, although as throughout Europe, it is always a lttle disappointing to have two twins to make a King. It seems like they ought to be able to have some sort of snap to keep the mattresses together. The shower was awesome...a welcome from the other hotels we stayed at. Although, I do not invision visiting Barcelona again, this was by far the best value/nicest hotel we stayed at in Europe and would not hesitate to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Gorgeous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ACP30
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Barcelona Princess Hotel. The hotel is incredible and their services were magnificent. It was so hot and busy there, we couldn't wait to get back to the peace and air-conditioning of the hotel. The two pools are extremely small for such a big hotel, but the views from those floors are so unbelievable, that you actually forget about the size of the pool. Overall I would say that, for a fussy person like myself this was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in on.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel- definitely going back”
Reviews.Author: Tripper8
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this lovely hotel in July 2006 for 3 days before embarking on a Mediterranean cruise. I had read the reviews on Trip Advisor, and they were very accurate. The mini fridge is stocked with beer, lemonade and pop each day , and is free. I had a large bedroom facing the sea on the 20th floor and the view was great. The room is very modern, the King sized bed was comfortable, the room darkening blinds were very effective. Only 2 people per room - even little kids can't stay in the room with you. My sister has 2 small kids and she had to book a separate room for them. But my entire family (15 or us in total ) loved this hotel. The shower cubicle is separate from the toilet cubicle for each room. The kids (and I ) loved the shower- all over body shower. The toilet cubicle could be a problem for larger sized people , and for claustrophobic people because the door goes up almost to the ceiling so you have the sensation of being closed up. The toiletry area is outside the shower and toilet cubicles. There is a room safe for valuables. The only negative is the security staff is very strangely adamant about not bringing in any outside food. I had read this on a review before I left, and it was true. My mother was stopped and questionned about her bottled water which I thought was ridiculous. We had a wonderful dinner in the hotel restaurant on my last evening. The portions were small but very tasty. The beach is nearby - walking distance. There is a large shopping mall with lots of places to eat just a few steps from the hotel. The tourist bus goes by outside the hotel. We bought a 2 day pass, and hopped on and off the bus. Pay attention to the routes though . I will definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Princess will blow you away before or after your cruise!”
Reviews.Author: Warm Weather Traveler
Reviews.Content: As always when using a discount site, I was nervous about this hotel, especially when I got a $95 each room rate for two rooms on Expedia for my wife, myself, and our two teenagers. Not only did they get us adjoining rooms, they were adjoining on a high floor. We stay in 5-star places (Grand Wailea, Atlantis, etc.) in great suites, and this was easily a set of rooms worth $400+ combined. Like the rest of Barcelona, the design is amazing, and if you are a gadget person, you'll love the power window shades, power screen room dividers over the glass wall to the bathroom, cool showerhead system, free unlimited internet, wake up call built into the TV, decent cable, etc. The only thing you may want to do that we didn't is bring the two prong adaptors and voltage regulators, but they did provide (I brought an ethernet cable with me, but they provide that, too). We had nearly 10 bags and they were courteous about storing them for 2 hours until our room was ready at noon. The staff was universally courteous, and sent two guys that loaded us IN our cab for the airport the next day as fast as an Indy pit crew. If you have tiny kids, you might want something less avante garde, but for teenagers, the chic pools, free stocked minibars, $10 euro cabfares to Olympic Village or Avenidas Ramblas, etc., made this the wonderful surprise of the week. You are also just a block from the Hilton, next door to a very nice mall, and a very short walk to the largest public beach in town. BOOK THIS NOW before other people hear of this first class hotel posing as only a 3-star! If I ever go back to Barcelona, I'm all over this place! You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for a city break!”
Reviews.Author: nixfromlondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend for 3 nights at the end of a fortnight's holiday in Spain - and really loved it. Having visited barcelona before and been stuck in a souless hotel out by the airport, we had wanted to stay in the city centre but found prices too expensive. This hotel is a great compromise - it's just a short taxi/metro ride from the centre, and you get much more for your money than in a city centre hotel. It's a really chic modern building and the rooms are fantastic: spacious and equipped with all mod cons. We had an amazing view over the coast, which was only beaten by the view from the open-air pool which is virtually on the roof of the hotel! We didn't eat breakfast as it seemed quite pricey, but found plenty of places nearby instead. Overall - I'd definitely recommend this hotel - and will be back there whenever I'm next in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views!”
Reviews.Author: livH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in July for a (this is embarrassing) hen party. It was an excellent hotel, make sure you get a room with a city view, mine was 24 floors up with an amazing view of the whole of Barcelona from the Sagrada to Monjuic!! The pools are both pretty tiny, but great for an afternoon cool down, there is also a sauna and a spa pool with a bar that serves excellent spanish beer. It's a little far out of the centre, so if you want to be part of the Barcelona life, and don't mind paying slightly more, I would recommend a place in the Bari Gotic. But over all, nice hotel, good service, just in a slightly souless, built-up modern part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Doccrow
Reviews.Content: Great stay , asked for 2 romms ( boys age 8 and 9) and parents. Arrived and no adjacent rooms available, staff bent over backwards to get us a suite upgrade. Good position for quiet but ready access to city centre and sites. Ask for a room on the highest floor possible for best views

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautiful newly build hotel Great rooms (spacious, glass bathrooms with Jacuzzi, most of them sea-view, free refreshments every day, free internet access) Very nice, friendly staff Located on a nice neighbourhood, near a shopping centre Great value for money Cons: None

Reviews.Title: “Not as we expected”
Reviews.Author: shelbyandcecils-mom
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based in part on the reviews here, but also on the fact that we were staying in another hotel in a different city that is part of the same chain. We reserved 4 rooms for our group for a three night stay in Barcelona. The rooms were as discussed, beds comfortable and the blackout shades a necessity on the ocean view side of the hotel. The views from all of our rooms was nice. Be warned however that the shower temperature is very difficult to regulate. I was almost scalded several times without ever moving the temperature lever. It seemed to lessen if you turned the water on and left it running for about 10 minutes or so before getting in (what a waste of water), but the temperature was never consistent. We had also requested that one of the rooms have a bathtub. Fortunately, we were able to switch rooms around amongst ourselves to accomodate this need, but there is apparently only one room per floor that actually has a tub. The free minibar is misleading, there is one water with gas, one without, one Coke, one beer and one lemonade, per day period. Another review has noted the guard standing in the hotel lobby. Guests are not permitted to bring any food or drink into the hotel. At all. We found this to be very unreasonable. We drink lots of water. Some of our group were older and in the heat needed to stay hydrated. Needless to say, we found this to be a problem. We were also told that we could get a glass of ice from the bar. That worked on two occasions, on the third, the bartender refused. We were told to call roomservice for ice and they would bring it to our room. We then did so three different times...and we were given two different sized of ice buckets and charged three different prices, the largest being 5 euros. Outrageous for ice. The air conditioning in one of the rooms did not work, it was reported to the front desk. A man came and said that he fixed it, it continued to not work. The second day in the morning it was reported again. That afternoon, it required another visit to the front desk and a reminder that this was a 4 star hotel and perhaps they needed to increase their level of service to a 4 star level, that the airconditioning was finally fixed. In general, only one or two of the front desk staff spoke English, and not well, no Italian and only a little French. The breakfast buffet was complete, but at 17 euros, not a good value. There are several shops, cafes in the mall next door that are just fine. On a positive note, the laundry in the bottom floor of the mall did a terrific job on laundry, and a much better price than the hotel's quoted 4 euro for a pair of underwear price. Nice pressing of the gentlemans' and ladies' shirts and blouses too. Somehow, with them not speaking English and us not speaking Spanish we managed to have a great discussion and get our clothes done appropriately, unlike attempting to converse with the front desk staff. The tour bus does stop outside the hotel, and that was a reasonable way to become acquainted with the city. We spent the equivalent of 12 nights in this hotel, reservations made for us by a Spainish business associate and felt that it was not up to 4 star standards in the slightest.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly,”
Reviews.Author: EABaur
Reviews.Content: Modern and well equipped Hotel with a great view over the mediteranian and the city. Easy to get to by subway or tram, but rather far away from the downtown area. Night bus stops 10 minutes away. Nice shopping mall and a good varity of restaurants in 2 minutes walking distance. The elevator ride is adventures since one wall is completely out of glass. Sensational Breakfast Buffet! Only negative point: Water dripped from the ceiling in the shower. If you're affraid of hights then you might have some problems walking over a passage completely in glass from the elevator to some rooms on each floor from the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “great room, great service, fabulous views!”
Reviews.Author: goglu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess hotel from June 17th to 24th. We arrived early in the morning, and could not get our room until 1:00 pm. This was fine with us, as we spent a few hours walking along the coast up to Port Vell (approx. 20-25 minutes walk). We were given a room on the 25th floor, where the view was absolutely spectacular! The room was even nicer looking than on the pictures, and all features were working perfectly (electric blinds, super shower, etc). We enjoyed the bathrobes and slippers, the free mini bar, and the room was always kept spotless, although they did come late in the afternoon to clean it. After two days, we would hang the "make-up the room" sign on the door when we left in the morning, so they came earlier the following days. The hotel is out of the center, but the metro station is only a 2 minutes walk from the hotel. The station is Maresme y Forum. Use the metro if you are spending a few days in Barcelona, it is very cheap, efficient and safe. The reception staff was always professional, but I admit they were a little limited in giving informations. Some of them spoke french which was a pleasant surprise for us. We rented a car for one day to go to Torres winery, and they made all the arrangements for us. The car was brought to the hotel early in the morning, and we just had to bring it back at night. No hassle going to a Hertz counter, or finding parking. If you want a little quietness in the afternoon, use the 3rd floor pool. Lots of chairs, a little music, a bar, and it is never crowded. We were often only 3-4 person by the pool, as there is no sun at the end of the day. The 23rd floor pool however offers a great view of the sea, and has sun until about 6:00 pm. There are only about 10 chairs and they are always taken. Be warned, they do not allow you to bring food in the room. There is a guard at the door, and if you come in with a supermarket bag in your hand, they will purely refuse to let you in. We had an opaque carry-on bag in which we put a few things for breakfast, so we were able to bring that up to our room without any problem. We strongly recommend this hotel, which does deserve its 4 stars. We have travelled often to Europe and this is now one of our favorite places. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Amazing Price”
Reviews.Author: JustUsTwoDerby_UK
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through a last minute deal and was really impressed with the service and hotel from the moment we arrived. First of a taxi direct from barcelona airport to the hotel was only just over 30 Euros. For the convenience we thought this was great. Because of an early flight we arrived at the hotel around 10:30am (check in is from 3pm). But when we spoke to reception they said they would see if we could check in earlier. 5 minutes later we were in our room unpacking. But that isn't all because we had booked a really cheap deal (£200 for 4 nights), although I had asked for a room on a high floor I wasn't holding out a lot of hope, well I was wrong our room was actually on the 26th floor......(You can't get any higher than that). Throughout our stay we found the staff to be really friendly and the hotel was lovely, only thing we heard people say they were disappointed with were the pools. We weren't disappointed though because they look small on all the pictures from the barcelona princess website. The hotel bar was expensive compared to anywhere else we visited (but again you kind of expect that). On our last day they weren't able to allow us a late check out room (we did not need to leave the hotel until gone 7pm. However, they informed us that we could still use the full hotel facilities so we could shower and change in the Gym - so no problems there. Overall one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in (even compared to some 5 stars), location a little out but we actually liked that as right next to open top Tourist Bus stop and also Tram and Metro. We would recommend the hotel 100%, just one word of warning about Barcelona - pick pockets are rife. We were lucky - despite a couple of attempts on my wifes handbag (which we managed to foil) we didn't get anything stolen. But a couple of women staying in our hotel got handbags snatched apparently hotel staff said it happens a lot. So you have to be very careful and security conscious...... But it shouldn't spoil a beautiful city break.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for Hotel Princess”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and two other couples stayed at Hotel Princess two days Precruise and one day post cruise. We booked early last year because our stay was during the Spanish Grand Prix. We arrived at the Hotel at 1:30 PM and were in our rooms within 15 minutes. The Clerks were very helpful and friendly. We were given rooms on the 18th floor and had a choice of a city view or a Mediterrean view. We choose the ocean view since we are from the desert. The rooms were very clean and attractive. The only fault we could find was the door to the bathroom was stuck where only a very skinny person coule squeeze into the small toilet room. My wife pulled the door past the rubber stopper and that fixed the problem. I immediately headed to the beach down past the Hilton where on the weekends there are swarms of people enjoying the surf. Do remember once you get near Dela Mar beach the blue barriers indicate the clothing opional area. My wife really enjoyed the Del Mar shopping mall. It had more to offer than I had exspected. We found a bar with frozen mugs so it was really nice to just sit back and drink a draft while the ladies went shopping. Lots of good Resturants in the shopping mall. Our Friends took advantage of the Hop On bus but did find there were certain stops it was hard to catch another bus. The wife and I did a nice walk up the Diagonal to Sagrada Familia. Sure we could have taken the Metro but we both needed the exercise. Very pleasant walk. That night (Friday) there was a band playing late into the next morning next to the convention center which was not a problem for us. We alway carry ear plugs so we can get some sleep on the plane. I did notice the hotel security was paying close attention to the enterance to the Hotel. Saturday night there was another band playing "Old Folks Music" this time the music stopped at 11:00PM. The free drinks in the ice box came with 1 coke, 1 beer, 1 Lemonaid, 1 bottled water, and 1 bottled gas water. The only one mix up I noticed was the front desk said we had been included for the breakfast. When we approached the breakfast area we were told we could have breakfast for $18 Euros....we passed. Note: there isn't too much open on Sunday mornings (8:00 to 10:00 AM) We did find a sidewalk cafe across the street that served a really nice breakfast special for around 7.50 euros. For our ride to the Port we let the Hotel Clerks know that we needed a cab at a certain time. The cab arrived on time and we made it to the port in 15 minutes.
