Also if you can get a mini van four people can ride as long as you don't have a ton of luggage. My wife and I are looking foward to staying at Hotel Princess again. Tim and Cathy

Reviews.Title: “Overall enjoyed stay, but comes with warnings”
Reviews.Author: melsriver
Reviews.Content: A group of ten of us stayed at the hotel Princess for 5 days May 31st-June 5th. Overall we had a great time. Will give a brief description of the good and the bad: THE GOOD: Checkin went very smoothly, we arrived at about 10:30 am and check in was not until three, but we were all in our rooms within the hour. The rooms for the most part were great. The black out blinds make it hard to wake up but very easy to fall asleep We were on the 24th floor so the view was fantastic! The beds were also very comfortable and the mini bar was a great touch as well! The shower was fantastic! It has the spray nozzles that spray out on different body parts! very enjoyable! Being right next door to the shopping mall was great, we ate lunch outside on the roof one day, and that was quite enjoyable, we also got some food and beer for our room from the huge supermarket! That worked out very well! Having the tram right there and the metro one block away was great as well, we were a 10 minute metro ride from Las Ramblas and the Olympic Port, keep in mind the metro stops at 12:00 so you will have to take a taxi back to the hotel. Ok now for the BAD: Two out of the five rooms we had were missing doors, one on the shower and one on the toilet. Now if you are a couple this might not be so bad, but we had two friends staying in both these rooms so it made it quite difficult. The two girls staying in one room, complained about not having a shower door and were laughed at and told that some rooms did and some rooms didn't have doors. Well as I explained above the showers have those sprayers that spray out, without a door you would not be able to use them! They were eventually moved to a different room and everything was fine Now for the REALLY BAD, not altogether the hotels fault!!! The weekend of June 2nd-5th there was a huge music festival across the street from the hotel. It went until 6:00am one night, This made it very difficult to sleep if you were on the side facing the festival. My parents complained several times during the night and actaully checked out one night early to go on to Sitges because of the lack of sleep. The genreal manager was very nice in helping them get moved and offered to pay for their night in Sitges, however since it was booked through Expedia we shall see if it works. However the next morning when the rest of the group checked out no one was compensated anything even though we all complained about the lack of sleep due to the festival. Final word of advice: The Princess has a few quirks to work out but overall we enjoyed our stay and would probalby go back as long as we checked to see if any festivals were going on! Make sure you ask the hotel if any events are planned at the forum during your stay! One other piece of advice I highly recommend for everyone. Right outside the hotel is a bus stop for the Bus Turistica. It takes you all over Barcelona to see everything you would want. you can buy a daily pass or a two day pass. You can hop on and off the bus wherever you want. Great way to see all of Barcelona. We hopped on and off at our convenience and it was great. Also look into the multi day metro passes you will need those also!

Reviews.Title: “Goods to Declare - Beware”
Reviews.Author: ajhaeh
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends at the Princess for three nights and reading the reviews prior to visiting it appeared that there was no middle ground. Either people loved it or hated it. Well I'm somewhere in the middle and my report will be balanced. The thing that stood out for me above all the rest is that the hotel, for us, was not customer focused. Well certainly not 'holiday' customer focused. From the moment we checked in it appeared that we were 'privelged' to be staying at the hotel and the reception staff were efficient but assertive. We had rooms on the 4th floor overlooking the Forum and this hotel is not on the sea front as a previous correspondent has written. You are a good walk from the beach over car parks and two main roads. There is construction work at an industrial complex about 1/2 mile away which is near the sea front. The hotel is on the corner of Avenue Diagonal, it is number 1. The rooms are very spacious, modern and open plan. There is a complimentary mini bar of four soft drinks and a beer. The power shower is good but when on full blast the drains couldn't cope which resulted in the flooding of the bathroom area. (The same happened in our friends room). There are electronic blinds on the huge window and also blinds between the bathroom and bedroom. There is also a door between the two rooms for privacy. The walls are not too thick between you and next door and with Pete Doherty playing until the early hours of the morning next door to the Forum... there were a couple of noisy sleepless nights. The events of day two are quite farcical and bizzare. Next door to the hotel is a shopping mall, with a host of shops and supermarkets. I purchased some water, fruit juice and some potato crisps to nibble in the room. As I entered the hotel I was stopped by a receptionist who had been instructed by the manager (who was stood at reception). Well my bag was confiscated!! It was highly embarrasing and I felt like a naughty boy in the headmasters office. All the other customers were watching as my bag was taken away to a side room and I could collect it on departure. I could not beleive it. I complained to the manager who stated that it was 'rules' and indicated a small sign at reception. It did say a small fee was payable if you wanted extra items in your room... 50 Euro's! The night after the sign became bigger and was placed by the lift. The reception staff were then placed on guard duty taking bags off people as they came in. It was like going through customs with the 'Goods to declare' channel. Farsical! The confiscated items were placed in a room and when you went to collect them it was a free for all. Bizarre! However some people were lucky enough to get away with the draconian measures and take beer wine & spirits to their room when the staff were busy. Crazy. We got a great rate of £58 per room on Expedia and many correspondents have outlined the transport systems to down town Barca. The price is really half what it should be for the quality of the rooms, as the hotel is just two years old. We did visit the Hilton Diagonal Mar across the street and had a fantastic meal in the Indigo Restaurant. The food and service were first class. The Princess manager needs to visit to see how it should be done... but who am I to say, I am only a customer and I should be grateful for allowing the Princess to let me stay... Shouldn't I :-)

Reviews.Title: “A true Princess!”
Reviews.Author: RoryMc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Barcelona Princess for 3 nites in late May 06. We booked it with [--], about €300 for 3 nites!..Like most previous reviewers, i was a little apprehensive about the somewhat varied reviews. Yes, the hotel is a 15 minute Metro ride from the city centre, but the top floor view we had of the entire city more than made up for this. On top of this the open top tourist bus stopped right outside..this is the only way to see Barcelona. Also the tram ran along La Diagonal right outside also. The huge modern shopping mall next door was lovely and airy, never too busy or loud, had loads of nice restaurants for breakfast or lunch, and some very trendy stores. I would definitely rate this as a 4 star hotel. It looks great, ultra modern, staff are friendly and efficient, nice sauna and jacuzzi, swimming pools are small and don't get the sun after mid afternoon, but you aint in Barcelona to sunbade!! The rooms are very contempory, with wall to floor windows,blacked out electric blinds. A glass wall separates the bedroom area from the bathroom, which also has an electric blind for the more humble!. The shower though is amazing, the really powerful waterfall and body jets really invigorates you after a long days sightseeing. Room service was prompt and surprisingly tasty and fairly ok with regards price. The air con worked perfectly and was a must. The only negative comment was the constant humming noise, which i reckoned came from some sort of air con motor on the roof..but we were the closest room to this, being on the 26th floor, and besides we got used to it after a while. All in all..i would totally recommend this hotel and you will get far more value and quality than what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona (Fawlty Towers) Princess”
Reviews.Author: GeoffreyR
Reviews.Content: At first sight the design of the hotel is very modern and cool, but the service is at the very least confused. We had a conference here the food was generally poor, one dinner we had for 25 people the food was cold. The air conditioning in our room took 3 days and four attempts to fix and then the maid locked my wife out on the balcony for half an hour. The manager sent us a bottle of Cava by way of apology but never phoned to apologise. Asking reception for a taxi was like asking them to sell their family into slavery! In the main foyer beautiful glass windows and table are broken and remain unmended over 6 days. What a shame, the hotel could be superb if the service was improved and reorganised. Shame

Reviews.Title: “Only for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: c3graces
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Princess while he attended a conference in Barcelona from May 5-12, 2006. We would choose a hotel closer to the center of town with friendlier staff and more comfortable facitlites if ever we returned to Barcelona. The metro station is a two minute walk from the hotel, but it's a 20 minute ride to the center of the old town and farther to other tourist sights in the city. The rooms were very modern, but dark, and the beds are quite firm. The bathroom is separated from the room by a glass wall, and the toilet has no door- so no privacy there! We had a view of the sea, over the top of an industrial area (so really not very scenic). A room key is needed to turn on the electricity for the room. This is not unusual in modern hotels, but what caused us trouble was that the window shades were electric, and when my husband accidentally took both room keys with him, I was left in the pitch dark unable to open the curtains (bring a flashlight!). The staff was often not helpful, and sometimes even bordered on rude. We never did succeed in convincing the maids to let us use the extra pillows in the room, each day they took away the pillow cases and stored the pillows. Breakfast was a full buffet with a decent variety of fruits, pastries, meats, eggs and vegetables, but the quality was just average- sometimes the pastries were stale, usually the juice was sour.

Reviews.Title: “It truly is fit for a Princess”
Reviews.Author: Hally1982
Reviews.Content: We, being my girlfriend and I, stayed at the Princess Hotel for three nights, Sat to Mon. After reading some of the extreme range of views posted on this website, we were a little apprehensive. Some people said it was excellent and others that it was a dive. After our stay, I am under no illusion as to the fact that this is a magnificent hotel, truly deserving of it's 4 stars. Upon arriving at reception, we were greated by helpful staff who spoke better english than we spoke Spanish. They showed us the way to the local metro station, El Maresme I Forum. The location of this station is a major plus point for this hotel. You are no more than two hundred yards across from the Metro, linking to all the major sightseeing areas of the city. As such, the location was not a factor and don't let it be the deciding factor in your stay. All together the hotel is fantastic, the views from our room facing the city on the 20th floor were fantastic. I cannot over recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlie_ocs
Reviews.Content: We were visitng Barcelona at the weekend for the Formula One Grand Prix. Stayed in this hotel from Thursday, 11th May until Monday, 15th. We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. It's very modern. Our room was on the 18th floor, we asked for a City view - and what a view!! Glass lifts (scary at first), glass bridge (again, scary to cross) but gorgeous views. Maid service every day. The complimentary mini bar is a very nice touch. As with the bathrobes and slippers and also free internet access. Electric blinds on the windows and bathroom were very cool. I agree with other reviews though - you tended to sleep in as they blocked out so much light you didn't realise what time it was! Breakfast was lovely, loads of fresh fruit, yoghurt, breads, cereal, bacon, eggs, grilled veg and a lovely potato quiche/omelette. Breakfast was served between 6.30am and 10.30am which was quite good as other hotels we've stayed in haven't served breakfast so early/late. A bit out of the way but as this was our 2nd visit to Barcelona in the last 12 months, we knew about the metro/tram systems. Taxi from the hotel to the city centre cost about 10 euros. There is a taxi rank round the back of the hotel which meant you didn't have to ask the hotel to call you a cab! The only negative comments we have are that the Bar on the 23rd floor was never open the full time we were there which was a shame as it would have been nice to sit in the bar and look onto the sea. The other thing is that our toilet had been making a strange noise during the night one night, we woke up in the morning and it was blocked - I can only assume there was a problem with a toilet in the next room or something that caused this. By the time we got back to our hotel room that night though, the problem had been resolved! We are already thinking about coming back for the Spanish Grand Prix next year and if we do, we would definitely book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, spent our 5 year wedding anniversary here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from Massachusetts and were visiting my husbands family in Ireland for 2 weeks. While in Ireland we booked a 3 day/2 nite visit to Barcelona to celebrate our 5 year wedding anniversary. We were in the Barcelona Princess May 4th, 2006 evening and May 5th, 2006 evening. We booked the hotel based on the reviews in trip advisor. We loved the Barcelona Princess and only paid $106 per nite from hotels(--) You would never find a hotel of this quality at that price in Massachusetts, or most other places in the USA or Europe. We were on the 11th floor and had a view of the Mediterannean. The room darkening shades were great! The first morning I woke up and it was pitch black in the room so I thought it was 4am..turned out it was almost 9am! There were a bunch of young English Tourists on a trip and were very loud in the bar. We were afraid we'd hear them coming back from a big nite out but luckily we did not. Since we were only in Barcelona 2 nites we were only in the hotel to sleep. As the other reviewers pointed out, yes it's a mile or so away from the city center but the subway is right outside the Barcelona Princess. We had a 2 day Barcelona pass so we used the subway which was very convenient. I worked out on the outdoor stairmaster one day which wasn't a great stairclimber but it was okay. I didn't go in the pool but some of the English tourists were in there. The Sky Bar at the top was closed. I would recommend the Barcelona Princess. It's a great deal for the price. However as someone else wrote, the rooms may be a bit too modern. It took us awhile to figure out some of the light switches/shade controls.

Reviews.Title: “The best views of Barcelona are from the Princess”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: We just loved the Barcelona Princess. It is a very contemporary property (perhaps a bit too contemporary, and on the "trendy" side). The lobby area is small but has a great coffee shop, and the best Cappucino in Barcelona. The rooms are really very, very nice. All rooms have an amazing view of the city, and in particular those on the higher floors. We were quite impressed with the Junior Suite, and it even had a balcony, at 20 floors up, with a table and chairs to take a late afternoon glass of Cava and enjoy the views. What a wonderful, relaxing pool they have -- in fact, two of them. The lap pool on the 24th floor is the "zero edge" type and you can swim right up to the edge of this skyscraper. Looks like you are swimming right next to the ocean until you get up to the edge. Very nice, but small, exercise area and spa. The breakfast was outstanding, with a wide variety of veggies and hot items for all tastes. Overall, this is a highly recommended place to stay in Barcelona. The only drawback: Location. It is in a fine location, right next to a HUGE shopping mall, but it is about ten minutes by car to the "normal" tourism sights of this city. The subway is fast and cheap and located right next door, so we didn't consider this an issue. DGJ

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother if you are looking for a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel following the reviews on this website and have to say that I was not overly impressed. If you are looking for a four star hotel this will not meet your expectations. The hotel was fully booked because it was a bank holiday weekend but that is no excuse for the poor (and often rude) service. The double room I had booked 4 months in advance turned out to be two single beds pushed together. The hotel staff were most unhelpful when I pointed out that I had booked a double. The receptionist told me to speak to the manager. When I asked to be put through she told me that manager would not be available until the next day. The issue was never resolved. Some of the facilities the hotel claims to have were not working. The Jacuzzi didn't work and the person in charge told me to report it to reception if I wanted to use it. The Jacuzzi and swimming pools did not look like they had been cleaned for a while - with hindsight I was glad the Jacuzzi was not working! I wasn't impressed with the rooms either. Although we had a sea view the room was clearly visible by people using the bridge to the other side of the building. This meant that we had to keep the blinds drawn most of the time. Coupled with the black ceiling and blind over the glass bathroom wall most of the times the room was very dark. It's hard to think of any plus points. My overall feeling was that I would not stay there again unless all the other hotels in barcelona were fully booked. At most I would award this hotel 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Django987
Reviews.Content: If you are afraid of heights, do not stay at this hotel unless of course you're on the 6th floor or below. There's masses of glass and floor to ceiling windows. Glass elevators, glass walkways and of course the infamous glass bathrooms. Getting to the pool on the 23rd floor was a no-no for me due to the height/glass walkway issue but I hear that it's very nice. The reception staff were incredibly helpful and polite and check-in was efficient and quick. The one and only negative comment would have to be about the shower. The temperature fluctuated from freezing cold to scalding hot and that was without even turning the tap sometimes. The blackout blinds in the rooms and the largest beds that I've ever slept in definately made for a restful night. The free mini-bar was a really nice touch as well. All in all, a great hotel and coupled with the excellent transport links on it's doorstep (metro, tram and buses - including the tourist bus that stops right outside the door) it's definately worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Attitude”
Reviews.Author: mierman1
Reviews.Content: I booked my room in Barcelona based on the raves on this webpage. I figured I'd sacrifice prime location for a luxury stay. However...... First, we did not get the room that we booked. We booked a double room but instead got a twin. They fixed this by pushing the beds together. This might have been ok without the staff's rude "take it or leave it" attitude. Second, many of the so-called attractions of the hotel closed early (or maybe were never open). Twice we went up to the 23rd floor bar to have a drink and enjoy the view and it was never open, even during hours it was scheduled to be open 10.30 through 20.00. But most frustrating was the staff being rude, possibly even deliberately. Twice we asked for simple directions, such as the best way to get downtown, and was told incomplete and even WRONG information. We were told to get on the tram in the opposite direction and transfer train lines. This is completely unnecessary as the Metro is just around the corner - we just couldn't see it at first. (Note: if you are staying here, it is unlikely that you should need to take a tram). Later, we asked a different person if a bus would have been a more direct route to where we were going and we were given a curt "yes" without giving us which bus line to take and we ended up going all over the city. We also saw staff members giving condescending looks to a group of tourists that were just having fun. In short, the location ended up being ok with the proximity to the Metro, but the staff was so unfriendly and unaccomodating that I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a princess!”
Reviews.Author: Hoolit
Reviews.Content: We had a very happy few days here on a brillant Expedia deal, where the room worked out at about £50 per night. Our two rooms on the 21st floor were perfect with everything we needed to feel pampered-we were 2 mums and 2 teenage daughters on a girlie mini break. Took breakfast in the Diagonal Mar shopping centre next door, then caught the nearby metro or tram to the sights of the city centre and the Olympic Port. Very helpful hotel staff gave us directions and reserved restaurants for us. Recommend eating at Espai Sucre on Princesa street in the Born district: not cheap but food and ambience are wonderful-every course is a desert!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I came across this particular website that offers the hotel room with a spa package for only 20+ euros extra!!! I was so excited and immediately booked the package for 1 one night stay over the weekend. In the spa package description, it says there will be free one hour commercial massage, free soft drinks, access to the gym and jacuzzi. Indeed, everything was delivered, however I assumed the massage should be for 2 person since I booked the room for 2 adults. However, when me and my boyfriend happily go to the allocated timing for our massage, the therapist told us that its only for 1 person, otherwise we will have to split the hour into 2 between us!! In the end, my boyfriend gave up and went back to the room. I went for the hour massage but it was not that fantastic either!! I have learnt that in spain, there is no point in complaining. Your complains will not be attended to, and the staff will always tell you that theres nothing they can do about it. The fact is they are just plain lazy, where do you think 'siesta' was invented from?? So, as long as you do not require anything from the staff, or have any problems in your room, everything should be great. The view from our room was magnificient, we were facing the sea, and the room looked exactly like how it is on the websites. I would say its great value for money, afterall Barcelona is a very comtemporary city, so don't be over-joyed when everything seems so modern, its just very normal. I would recommend people to come though, as long as you come with the right mindset! :)

Reviews.Title: “Sooo quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Janeite
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, this hotel is a little out of the way for the major Barca sights. We considered that a plus. We could easily reach the city center by subway or taxi, then sleep peacefully all night. Our room was very quiet. The room was comfortable, if a little odd. The wardrobe is painted black inside and is in a dark part of the room, making it rather difficult to find one's black clothing. We actually used a flashlight. Drawer space was inadequate for two people who overpacked, but we made it work. The free minibar was nice, and telephone charges very reasonable. The bathroom sink is glass. Very pretty, but always looked dingy after we used it, esp. as no soap dish is provided. The shower is truly a treat. Other facilities were mixed. The jacuzzi was out of order throughout our stay (though there were men pounding on it, so perhaps it has been repaired). The sauna was lovely, but again dark--the only light was provided by the glass in the door. There were showers in the changing room, but no soap, shampoo, etc., and the showers were so small it was easy to switch off the water with a shoulder or elbow. There's a small massage room, where I received a very good and very reasonably-priced massage. We did not use the pools but they looked pretty. Breakfast was included in our package. It included a nice range of fruit, cereals, cold meats, yogurt, breads, etc. It also included some tired-looking vegetables probably left over from dinner. Coffee and juices were good. We didn't try any other meals. As others have noted, very good shopping is just next door. Cava at 2 euros a bottle, anyone?

Reviews.Title: “Every Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Any doubts you may have after reading some reviews about this hotel should be totally dispelled.I booked this hotel as a surprise 40th birthday for my wife. Three nights, Thurs.Fri and Sat. Hotel form the airport took around 20mins and taxi came to 25 euros. The hotel is very contempory in a lovely quieter area away from the noisier city. The hotel staff are exceptionally helpful and courteous and found a room for us @ 11.00am when really we should have checked-in during the afternoon. We asked for 26th floor city view...all my wife could say was wow!! it is an amazing view. Cleanliness is of massive importance to my wife so when looking around the room she kept smiling I knew everything was just as she wanted it. The slippers and dressing gowns just add that little extra class. Don't expect a work out in the gym because the treadmills and exercise bikes do not work!! There is a super shopping centre next door Diagonal Mar, with designer shops restaurants cafes and a supermarket. We travelled around using the metro which is 1 minute walk away ( L4 yellow line El Maresme-Forum)this we have never done before but found it quite easy.The longest wait we had was no longer than 8 minutes but generally 2 to 3 minutes. Buy a T10 ticket which allows you 10 trips to the underground. This costs 6.55 euros where a single ticket costs 1.35 euros so you save a tidy packet. Oh yes....ask for a map from reception because this has all the places of interest on it plus a map of the metro lines. We asked on the last day !! only wished we knew. !! Nev..

Reviews.Title: “First Visit to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: G3RSM
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Barcelona, and our taxi ride from the station made us wonder just how far from the centre this hotel was. However the bus stops and metro station were within 5 minutes of the hotel, and the trains were very frequent, taking around 13 minutes to reach the city centre. A 4 day ticket for use on either transport was very reasonably priced so it wasn't a problem. It was a very open and quiet neighbourhood too. The reception staff were very helpful and the chap behind the bar gave us a map and highlighted places to visit. On booking in, we were offered the 18th floor but we preferred to be lower down and so we were offered the 4th floor. Booking in was easy. The room was awe-inspiring at first glance. 10 light switches and 3 electric blind switches are scattered around the room for use with sun, sunscreen and bathroom screen blinds. It was very modern looking - all glass, chrome and wood. There were many items included - complimentary mini bar, safe, bathrobes, slippers, and a whole range of toiletries. There was piped music and a TV with limited English programmes which repeated frequently. Our only problem was hot water. The glass sink did not have an overflow outlet, which I can only assume to be the reason for their being no plug. The hotel was sparsely occupied during the week, no doubt due to the time of year, and it took between 10 and 15 minutes for hot water to come through, even though the tap and the shower were left running. This improved somewhat over the weekend when there were more occupants. I understand that in hotels of this size hot water is normally pumped around the building, so I assume that either it wasn't working or they don't have a pumped system and the hot water had to come down from the 25th floor or higher. There was free Internet access on the 1st floor, and the limited range of food in the bar was appetising and not unreasonably priced for this type of hotel. The restaurant evening meal was classed as a buffet, but we didn't see a huge choice and at 36 Euros we considered it to be far too expensive, so we never used it. Equally we felt that the breakfast was overpiced and we made use of the cafes in the shopping mall next door.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very modern”
Reviews.Author: kciremil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights. Staff were very helpful; we had no Spanish at all, and had some difficulty with directions etc. They made every effort to help us. Rooms were spotless, with fantastic views of either the city or the sea. Free minibar stocked every day, bathrobes, slippers etc provided. Safe included in the room. The hotel is a little bit out of the city, but is still only a 10-15 min metro trip. For a livelier atmosphere, it's probably too far out, but the hotel itself is very good. The Diagonal Mar shopping centre is beside the hotel, and has two floors of shops, and one of restaurants/cafes. I would stay at the hotel again; it's lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Glassed Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: mascarasnake
Reviews.Content: March 2006 - 4 of us stayed here for a long weekend, we had adjoining rooms which was great. Check in was a little slow as was check out - staff were friendly but slow. The bar staff went out of their way to make our stay memorable, nothing was too much trouble for them. As all hotels the drinks here were more expensive than bars - about 40% more. Breakfast was not included in our rate-we were charged 16 euros each. The selection was fresh fruit, cold meats and cheese, hot grill, cereals,toast,muffins etc. It was as one would expect from a 4* hotel. Dont get too excited about the swimming pools, they are very small but welcoming for a quick dip after a long day sightseeing. This hotel is a 10 euro taxi ride into the centre. Near the hotel was a shopping mall. If I return to Barcelona for a short stay I would choose a hotel a little nearer the centre, but this is an individual choice. The hotel bedroom was very clean, and the bathroom a little different with a glass partition dividing this area from the bedroom - we were on a high floor with spectacular views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service And Ignorant Staff”
Reviews.Author: SamYes
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews for this hotel, I decided to book it for 3nights from March 15-18. The hotel´s location was my first nasty surprise since it was really out of the way in a residential area far from downtown barcelona, but the hotel´s worst attribute is its terrible service. The reception´s young staff spoke hardly any English, were usually clueless about the goings on in their hotel and hardly knew anyhting regarding their city´s attractions .Also many of them had a very bad attitude. To top it all, For the 3 days I stayed in this hotel, I would leave early in the morning, return in the afternoon and my room would still be unmade. The staff even tried to make excuses for their inefficiency. To cut a long story short, a hotel not worth its price at all.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel but not the location”
Reviews.Author: cass1410
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights whilst the football was on. Found the staff very friendly, on check-in we were offered a sea or city view room. We chose a cityview and were located on 24th floor - the views are amazing! The room itself was lovely, spacious, very comfy bed, the minibar was included in the room rate with water coke and beer which was refilled every day. The bathrooms were a bit odd. There is a glass partition between the bathroom and the bedroom which there is a blind to pull down but our room didnt have a door to the toilet! the shower had 3 settings with small and large jets and I loved the bathrobe and slippers. Room service was pricey, one night we tried for 15 minutes to order food and noone answered the phone. The location is the only thing that let this hotel down. The public transport is great and there is a bus and tram stop just down the road but if you want to be in the action dont choose this hotel. It takes a good 15/20 minutes by public transport to get to the ramblas and costs 10 euros by cab.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. We arrived for a 4 night break at around 11 o'clock and were pleasantly surprised to be able to check in instantly. Not only that, we were offered a high or low room with city or sea views. If the same choice is offered take the high option with a city view. It's fantastic in daylight but as the sun goes down the panoramic views just get better. The room itself was extremely clean with black out blinds that leave you wondering where the morning went as they're that effective. The other plus point is the fantastic shower. Admittedly the location is out of the centre, but it's about 15 minutes on the metro. For the metro there are various options such as 1, 2, 3 or 4 day tickets available. This however is purely for the metro, whereas the T10, the ten journey tickets can be used for bus, tram or the metro which gives more flexibility. Overall if I was to go back to Barcelona I'd happily go back to the Barcelona Princess

Reviews.Title: “Modern Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: 2HpyTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Barcelona Princess for one night before departing on a cruise through southern Europe. The room was reasonably priced and very modern in style. After the long flight from New York, the BLACKOUT blinds in the room made our midmorning sleep refreshing. The room was smaller than a standard American room, but very comfortable. Hotel staff members seemed nice and helped to minimize the language barrier. My wife managed to flood the bathroom shower (in her defense the drain was slow) around midnight, but the hotel staff quickly responded to soak up our sixth floor Lake Victoria. The exercise facility was small and horribly appointed and the pools are tiny, but those amenities were not factored into our choice of hotel. We would definitely stay at the Barcelona Princess again in the same situation. If we were going to Barcelona to stay there for a week or two, we would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Silk2704
Reviews.Content: So far on our slowly increasing list of places visited this is the best hotel my spouse and i have stayed in! Normally we've just gone for whatever fitted our budget, however after staying here (which was cheap at the time <£200 pp) we find ourselves looking at only 4+ * places. We weren't even sure what more you'd have to do to make it 5*. I can only guess at the location, as it is out of the centre, but only 10 mins on the metro (which is ridiculously cheap - about 14 euros each for 3 full days travel anywhere). Anyways, anyone who stays here shouldnt fail to see how nice the hotel is, i just hope you enjoy it as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Amazing very modern hotel suitable for all kinds of visotors, we stayed on the 18th floor with a city view which was amazing, especially at night time when the whole city was lit up, the rooms very beyond comfortable and offered many great things such as free mini-bard which was topped up daily free of charge with water, beer, coke, etc. The rooms were cleaned daily and towels replaced, free television with about 30 chanels including sky news and mtv. The shower was great very powerful with 3 different settings, the bathroom is all glass and silver and looks amazing and is seperated from the bedroom by electric blinds which were great! the electric blinds for the window were great as well as they offer complete darkness if you fancy a few winks. the kingsize bed was very comfortable as well! The hotel as is the whole city no smoking (apart from a few small bars/cafes) so if you smoke like me you have to go outside, or alternatively theres a nice little bar directly opposite the hotel called la rambla which allows you to smoke and also sells very cheap beer and does food as well. The metro and tram are both outside the hotel and the metro is about 7 stops into the city centre, be careful though as one british tourist standing next to us got her purse stolen out of her bag on the metro when it was busy, the pickpockets are very clever when doing it. The room service however was poor, very expensive, poor portions and the food wasnt all that great. Amazing city and an amazing hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona Princess in January and it was absolutely amazing. From the moment I stepped into the hotel I was awestruck! It was fantastic! The staff on reception were generally very friendly, and if not friendly then still very helpful. The room was fabulous, breathtaking, I was very impressed and I would recommend a city view room as high up as possible. We were on the top floor (the 26th) and you get a great view. If you want to be right in the centre then it isn't but there is a very good metro all around the city and a tram service as well right outside. There is also a shopping centre right next door, the biggest is Catalunya I think. The only advice I have is do NOT order room service!!! We did for out first evening meal and it was miniscule and very pricey. However, the breakfast room service is huge and although also pricey it is very large. Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Nat747
Reviews.Content: I was in this Hotel for only 2 nights at Christmas 2005. The room was small, kind of German style, black roof, electronic curtains, with the thickest matress I ever seen, big two beds together. I must recognize that the black, orange and wooden colours make this Hotel to be fancy, and the glass between the bathroom and the room is quite modern and original. Unfortunately the bad smell coming out from the shower was unbeateable. I complaint but nothing was done about it, maybe cause I am from Madrid (just kidding but hey! it is possible!) The little bar at the ground floor and free internet is a plus. The gym was too small and nothing was working, the two saunas were OK, but the jacuzzi room was closed and I couldn´t use it. A small swimming pool is next to the mini-gym. The mall next to the hotel is great and the metro and tranvia also quite close to go to downtown. It is a modern, stylish hotel but I would not come back over there.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my boyfriend and could not be more thrilled with our choice. The check-in was quick and easy and the room was lovely and tidy, with amazing views. The house keeping was spot on and the shower is simply devine. Furniture and decor is very modern, with a nice european chic about it. As mentioned before, the electronic blackout blinds are great, but be warned that it does make you oversleep! The location of the hotel is nicely situated outside the hustle and bustle of the city centre. However, do not let this put you off, as the Metro station (Maresme Forum) is less than a 3 minute walk from the hotel. The Metro is very convienient and is about a 10 minute journey to the city centre and many other attractions, such as Sagrada Familia, La Rambla and L'Aquarium. The hotel also facilitates a sauna, jacuzzi and two swimming pools. Massages are also available for about 50 Euros. My boyfriend said the massage was superb and almost fell asleep! The room service is fast and not hugely expensive. There is always a security guard at the door, which is a nice safety precaution. Though, I'm sure he is not really needed as the area is pleasent and quiet. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful, although with limited English, but they do try and help in anyway they can. There is a big shopping centre 2 minutes away and has everything you need. Many restaurants are located on the 3rd floor of the mall, with a wide selection to choose from. I would highly recommend going to Araguil, which is a tasty Lebanese restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattyMoo1981
Reviews.Content: with the reviews of ths hotel being high my expectations were too, this hotel was of high quality and would recommend it to anyone. The hotel is not near La Ramba but if your happy giving public transport a go then your on a winner staying here. The rooms were fantastic and very much enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Good location and new hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is not located at the center of town, the metro station is just round the corner and it takes less than 10 minutes to get to town. There are also large shopping center around the area. The hotel is new with good services. Remember to bring along a kettle though for they charge Euro4 for every pot of hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Great new year...great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maxineperry
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from barcelona this morning and felt it absolutely necesarry to leave a great review for other travellers. This hotel is excellent, its clean, modern and greatly situated if you dont want to stay right in the hussle and bussle of las ramblas. Our room did not have the glass bathroom wall like on the website but im sure we were compensated as our bathroom was huge and we had our own balcony. The metro is literally on your doorstep and is easy to use and is not intimidating at all. I even shot into las ramblas alone one morning and felt completely safe. it very cheap about 90p for a single trip, however i recommend a 2, 3, 0r 4 day pass as its very cost effective. There is a great mini trafford centre right next door to the hotel with many places to shop, eat and get snacks. Its got a bowling alley and a cinema, however none of the films were in english. All in all we had a great new year and we will definately stay here again and we will be returning to barcelona for sure. Please dont be put off by the location as it is about 20 mins on the metro from the centre. trust me if we can find our way around anyone can and we give it a huge thumbs up! we were warned about pick pockets and handbag thieves in barcelona but if you be sensible and dont advertise yourself as a tourist i.e... have your camera out at every opportunity or hang it around your neck, flash your wallet and leave your bag unnatendended you have nothing to worry about. remember, its not rocket science just common sense!! book now you wont be dissappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pinkrose1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at the Barcelona Princess Hotel. The hotel was fantastic! We had a room on the 17th floor and the view to the city was amazing! The block out blinds worked well to block the lights at night and the room had the best massage shower - I wanted to take it home with me!! The hotel is right next to the shopping centre, which made it easy for meals when we were too tired from sightseeing to go to the city. The staff were friendly and were there to help with any question that we had. They also recommended a flamenco show for us to see - a definate must when in Barcelona! We found the hotel central enough for our needs, as we didnt mind travelling the 15min on the metro to the city. Well Done Barcelona Princess! You made our holiday an enjoyable and unforgetable one!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a seriously perfect hotel. What rooms. Pure class with lots of glass. Lie in bed and flcik those motorised blinds to reveal all of Barcelona. Swim on the roof - wow! Cold? Then jacuzzi and sauna. Helpful staff, great bar, good shopping and easy links to the centre. What a place - look out for Steve the taxi driver - he charges nothing and takes you for a drink. We found even better places than Bar Boobie in London.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: marianina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at barcelona princess for 4 nights, i think that is far the best hotel i 'v ever stayed!!! we had a room in the 26 floor with a view at the city!! the staff was the best , the metro was next to the hotel, for brekfast we went to diagonal center which has a lot of nice things to do and eat and shopping too!!! we payed total 328 euros included taxes!i will recomended it for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Value”
Reviews.Author: shimmergirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value: Good price (about $100 a night from Expedia), close access to Metro, Clean, Nice Views, and a free minibar. The Bathroom was very European. The tub had glass that covered only half way so there was a lot of water splashes on the floor (being an American, this is one of my pet peeves about European showers). There were no face towels. They provided a free toothbrush, shaver, shower cap, shampoo, and soap. We arrived on a Thursday and the taxi cost us €25 Euro. We checked out on a Sunday and the taxi cost of €35 Euro. Apparently, there are two tariff rates. One for Monday - Friday. And a more expensive rate for Saturday and Sunday. Plus, there is a €3 Euro charge for the airport and €.90 charge for luggage...so don't freak out when you see the fare start at €3.90. The closest metro station is Maresme-Forum. When you exit out of the hotel, cross the street and continue straight two minutes. The metro station will be on your left. There is also a mall next door to the hotel called El Diagonal Mar with many restaurants. The food at Pizza Marzano was really good!

Reviews.Title: “visited, loved it, will recommend it!!”
Reviews.Author: wisher
Reviews.Content: just come back from Thursday- Monday at the hotel. Absolutely brilliant and great to get out of the city centre hustle and bustle.Bus turistic which passes nearby finished on 30/9, but will be great for anyone next spring/summer. Don't even bother going next door to the shopping centre for breakfast -- just go across the road to Bar Ramblas. Service is slow (they are not used to so many english people asking for cafe con leche so they can run out of big cups at weekends!), but you will be able to have real tostadas and genuine tapas or freshly squeezed orange juice. If you must, they will do bacon and eggs too! Don't speak much English! Four of us ate for less than the price of one hotel breakfast. Hotel great, room fantastic, beds huge, but yes, the pools are in the shade! Quickest route in tot he centre is via the metro - the stop is on the next street, behind the bar Ramblas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rimini
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess for 3 nights in October. Its a nice hotel although the recption is smokey!!! Rooms were very nice and beds were lovely and comfortable. Unfortuantely we didnt get to use the gym/pool/sauna as it is only open between 10am and 8pm....we were visiting the sights of Barcelona at this time.....it would be nice if they opened earlier in the morning. I have read other people review and i think we were conned with the taxi because we were charged nearly 40 euros....there were four of us, two cases and it was night time so i am not sure if this makes a difference. Overall a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: gm2484
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in the Princess because the children were offered a free connecting room. This was great as they had their own room, bathroom and facilities. I found the staff pleasant and helpful, though as pointed out in previous postings, slow to book in. But we were on our holidays and time was not a problem. The rooms are very dark , quite small but clean . Our shower leaked all over the bathroom floor, so much so that we had to use quite a lot of the towels to soak it up. Yes, we too had the knob inside the toilet stuck on with selotape!! But the toiletries were lovely, towels spotless and fluffy and replaced everyday. The pool was very cold and never seemed to have the sun shinning on it. I realised quite quickly why no one was in the water or sunbathing. The pool area was in the shade most of the time. The seating in the bar area was faded and had seen better days. The location of the hotel is 15 mins by metro from the centre. We are well used to travelling so this was not a problem. The shopping centre next door had the whole floor of eating places with lots of choices. We enjoyed seeing how the local people lived and their children playing in the little play areas. There was a huge play area both inside the shopping mall and acroos the way beside the Forum which kept the children happy. We enjoyed our stay at the Princess but if going back to Barcelona would stay somewhere more central. Hope this helps anyone making a decision as whether to stay or not.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Stamina1914
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a hotel in Barcelona, look no further. The hotel was for us a$25 cab ride from the airport and about $15 from Las Ramblas. The hotel was fantastic. Excellent service and amenities. Fantastic very contempary designed rooms. There was also a great mall on the same block and metro stop about a 2 min walk from the hotel. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “room with a view”
Reviews.Author: yyzron
Reviews.Content: We only had a one night stay at the Princess but we were very impressed with our short stay. The rooms are very well layed out and I really liked the ultra modern design of the washroom. This room had the best hotel shower I've ever been in. Not the largest but great water pressure and three nozzel options made for satisfying shower experience. Our view on the 20th floor overlooked the city and offered a view of the Sagrada Familia (a must visit site for all travellers). They also have two pools, and the one on the 23rd floor that overlooks the edge of the building is not to be missed. The Princess is somewhat removed from the Las Ramblas tourist center but is in a very new developing location. However, if you had an extended stay in Barcelona, you'd probably take transit to some of the more popular locations.

Reviews.Title: “"friendly! We liked it"”
Reviews.Author: LNCG
Reviews.Content: We were quit worried at the beginning because it was not in the city center; but with the subway you are in town within 10 minutes! Rooms are modern furnished and the view is amazing - you can see all the city of Barcelona... A good point : the mini bar in the room is FREE!! so abuse it! You must have a look at the 23rd floor swimming-pool! quiet dangerous... but wonderfully strange. Go have a swim; The breakfast is really expensive (16€) so go outside to have a capuccino at "la rambla" just in front of the hotel entrance (5€); We liked our first trip in Barcelona and hope to come again. Thank you Barcelona Princess!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic City, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iain____Mitchell
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in September 2005 for 11 nights. We arrived at Barcelona Airport late afternoon and caught a train from the airport to Sant Adria del Besos (4 euro each taking approx 30mins) Since the tram outside this station wasn't operating we got on a bus that was put on instead, and this dropped us off outside the hotel. Taxi Fare would have been 30 euro. We took advantage of a room on the 22nd floor which provided breathtaking views of the city. The room was modern and clean. Facilities included air conditioning, pc point with free internet access for those with their own laptop, television, safe, and minibar providing 5 free drinks daily (1 beer, 1 coke, 1 lemon and 2 water). We were slightly dissapointed that the large double bed was in fact 2 single beds pushed together but they were joined by brackets so didn't come away from each other. The hotel pools were very small however as we were rarely in the hotel we would not have been in a position to use them anyway. We did use the sauna which was again very clean and free towels provided. Across from the hotel entrance about 75metres is the underground station El Maresme/Forum(Line 4) and I would recommend you buy a T 10 given 10 rides on the underground system. NB The underground closes at 12am Mon-Thurs but is open until 2am at weekends. Taxis are reasonably inexpensive so if you have ventured into the city centre it doesn't cost a fortune to get back to the hotel in the early hours. Barcelona has so much to offer from a sandy beach to gothic architecture to modern art. The hotel offers free internet access from 2 pc's on the 1st floor and this is useful for finding out places of interest or local restaurants whilst you are there. The hotel bar is well stocked and nice for a quiet drink although did lack a bit of atmosphere. Olympic Port is only 30minutes walking distance for those looking for a more lively nightime scene. Overall a modern, clean and friendly hotel and we will definetly consider staying there on our next Barcelona visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique Princess Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mramsbottom
Reviews.Content: This hotel - PRINCESS - has to be the most excellent hotel in Europe in which I have ever stayed. Four of us travelled from Alicante airport to Barcelona for an Irish wedding ! from the moment we arrived at reception to check in until we checked out, we were simply amazed with the friendly staff, beautiful interiors, comfortable beds, and panoramic views which makes this hotel a 'gem' in Barcelona. We will be back ! Maura Ramsbottom
